original: re zhig de ni rdzogs so /

translated: This concludes the section on the fruits.

original: // / yang 'bras bu 'di dag las 'bras bu gang zhig rgya gang gi yin zhe na /
analyzed: // / yang 'bras bu 'di dag las 'bras bu gang zhig rgya gang gi yin zhe na /
translated: What is the fruit of what cause?

original: rnam smin 'bras bu tha ma'i yin //
analyzed: rnam smin 'bras bu tha ma'i yin //
translated: The last is the fruit of the cause of retribution.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni tha mar bstan pa'i phyir tha ma ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni tha mar bstan pa'i phyir tha ma ste /
translated: The cause of retribution is the last one mentioned.

original: rnam par smin @96b pa'i 'bras bu ni de yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin @96b pa'i 'bras bu ni de yin no //
translated: Its fruit is the fruit of retribution.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu dang po'i yin //
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu dang po'i yin //
translated: The first is the fruit of the dominant🔽condition.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni dang par bstan pa'i phyir dang po ste bdag po'i 'bras bu ni de'i yin no //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni dang par bstan pa'i phyir dang po ste bdag po'i 'bras bu ni de'i yin no //
translated: The cause of the dominant condition is the first one mentioned.🔽Its fruit is the fruit of the dominant condition.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni bdag po yin no //
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni bdag po yin no //
translated: The dominant condition is the dominant fruit.🔽What is the dominant condition?🔽It is the mere nonobstruction of one thing in the arising of another.🔽What does it do as the dominant condition?

original: mi sgrib pa'i dngos po tsam du gnas pa go ci zhig dbang byed ce na /
analyzed: mi sgrib pa'i dngos po tsam du gnas pa go ci zhig dbang byed ce na /
translated: It does nothing.

original: de nyid dbang byed pa yin no ;
analyzed: de nyid dbang byed pa yin no ;
translated: The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.🔽The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.🔽The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.🔽The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.🔽The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.🔽The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.🔽The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.🔽The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.🔽The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.🔽The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.🔽The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.🔽The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.🔽The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.🔽The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.🔽The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.🔽The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.🔽The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.🔽The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.🔽The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.🔽The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.🔽The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.🔽The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.🔽The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.🔽The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.

original: / byed rgyu'i rgyu la skyed pa'i dngos po yang yod de /🔽'di lta ste rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag la skye mched bcu lta bu dang / snod kyi 'jig rten la las rnams lta bu'o //
analyzed: / byed rgyu'i rgyu la skyed pa'i dngos po yang yod de /🔽'di lta ste rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag la skye mched bcu lta bu dang / snod kyi 'jig rten la las rnams lta bu'o //
translated: The cause of the dominant condition is the cause of the dominant fruit.🔽The cause

original: rna ba la sogs pa la yang mig gi rnam par shes pa bskyed pa la brgyud pas dbang byed pa yod de /
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa la yang mig gi rnam par shes pa bskyed pa la brgyud pas dbang byed pa yod de /
translated: The ear, etc. also exercise indirect control over the arising of eye consciousness,

original: thos nas lta bar 'dod pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: thos nas lta bar 'dod pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: because the desire to see arises after hearing.

original: rgyu mthun skal mnyam kun 'gro ba'i //
analyzed: rgyu mthun skal mnyam kun 'gro ba'i //
translated: The result of natural outflow is similar to its cause.

original: 'di gnyis dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: These two are results of natural outflow because they are results that are similar to their causes.

original: skyes bu pa ni gnyis kyi yin //
analyzed: skyes bu pa ni gnyis kyi yin //
translated: The result of conscious effort is of two causes.

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag gi yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag gi yin no //
translated: The result of conscious effort is the result of the coemergent cause and the concomitant cause.

original: skyes bu'i ngo bo las mi gzhan pa'i phyir skyes bu byed pa ni skyes bu nyid yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i ngo bo las mi gzhan pa'i phyir skyes bu byed pa ni skyes bu nyid yin no //
translated: Because it is not different from the nature of a person, conscious effort is a person.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni skyes bu yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni skyes bu yin pa'o //
translated: Its result is a person.

original: skyes bu byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is this so-called conscious effort?

original: chos gang gi byed pa gang yin pa de skyes bu'i byed pa lta bu ni skyes bu byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos gang gi byed pa gang yin pa de skyes bu'i byed pa lta bu ni skyes bu byed pa ste /
translated: The activity of a factor is like the activity of a person.

original: dper na sman bya rog rkang dang / mi glang po che myos pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sman bya rog rkang dang / mi glang po che myos pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the medicine called “crow’s foot” and the person called “intoxicated elephant.”

original: ci gzhan dag la yang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yod dam /
analyzed: ci gzhan dag la yang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yod dam /
translated: Do other factors besides these two have a human activity effect?

original: 'on te gnyis kho na'i yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gnyis kho na'i yin zhe na /
translated: Or do only these two have it?

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa gzhan dag la yang yod de /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa gzhan dag la yang yod de /
translated: Other factors, with the exception of the ripening cause, also have it.

original: 'di ltar skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang de ma thag tu 'byung ba yin na rnam par smin pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang de ma thag tu 'byung ba yin na rnam par smin pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: In fact, the human activity effect is a factor that arises either simultaneously with or immediately after its cause; but this is not the case with the ripening effect.

original: gzhan dag na re de la yang skyes bu'i byed pa'i 'bras bu'i skal ba ni yod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de la yang skyes bu'i byed pa'i 'bras bu'i skal ba ni yod do //
translated: According to other masters, the ripening cause also has a human activity effect,

original: dper na zhing pa rnams kyi 'bras bu lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na zhing pa rnams kyi 'bras bu lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: like the harvest for farmers.

original: yang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba 'di ni ci yin /
analyzed: yang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba 'di ni ci yin /
translated: What is the effect of dominance?

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu'i bar du ci zhig yin zhe na /🔽rnam smin lung du ma bstan chos //
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu'i bar du ci zhig yin zhe na / rnam smin lung du ma bstan chos //
translated: The result of the dominant🔽condition is a non-obscured, indeterminate dharma.

original: rnam par smin pa ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i chos yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i chos yin no //
translated: The result of the dominant condition is a non-obscured, indeterminate dharma.

original: sems can du ston pa ma yin ba yang yod pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can du ston pa ma yin ba yang yod pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since it is not only a sentient being that is the dominant result,

original: sems can brjod ces bya ba smos so //🔽rgyas pa las byung @97a * //
analyzed: sems can brjod ces bya ba smos so // rgyas pa las byung @97a * //
translated: he says, “the dominant result is a sentient being.”

original: ba dang rgyu mthun pa las byung ba yang yod pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: ba dang rgyu mthun pa las byung ba yang yod pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since it is not only a result that arises from the cause of accumulation that is the dominant result,

original: lung bstan phyis byung zhes bya ba smos te /🔽dge ba dang mi dge ba ni rnam par smin pa'i phyir lung du bstan pas lung du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lung bstan phyis byung zhes bya ba smos te / dge ba dang mi dge ba ni rnam par smin pa'i phyir lung du bstan pas lung du bstan pa'o //
translated: he says, “the dominant result is a dharma that arises later.”🔽Since it is not only a virtuous or nonvirtuous dharma that arises later that is the dominant result,

original: gang zhig de las dus phyi ma la 'byung zhing de ma thag tu ma yin pa de ni rnam par smin pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig de las dus phyi ma la 'byung zhing de ma thag tu ma yin pa de ni rnam par smin pa ste /
translated: he says, “the dominant result is a dharma that arises later and is not immediate.”

original: 'di ni rnam par smin pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par smin pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: This is the definition of the dominant result.

original: ci'i phyir sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'i don las las skyes pa rnam par smin pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'i don las las skyes pa rnam par smin pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Why is the result of retribution not included among the results of the action of sentient beings?

original: thun mong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: thun mong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not common.

original: de ni gzhan gyis kyang de bzhin du yongs su spyad par nus so //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyis kyang de bzhin du yongs su spyad par nus so //
translated: For it is possible that another person enjoys the result of action accomplished by a given agent.

original: rnam par smin pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i ste /
translated: But the result of retribution is not common,

original: gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa gzhan gyis myong bar ni med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa gzhan gyis myong bar ni med do //
translated: for it is impossible for one person to experience the result of action accomplished by another.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu ci'i phyir myong zhe na /
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu ci'i phyir myong zhe na /
translated: Why does the agent experience the dominant result?

original: thun mong gi las las byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽rgyu mthun rgyu dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: thun mong gi las las byung ba'i phyir ro // rgyu mthun rgyu dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Because it arises from the collective action of many.🔽The result similar to the cause is like the cause.

original: rgyu dang 'dra ba'i chos gang yin pa de ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'dra ba'i chos gang yin pa de ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: The result similar to the cause is the effect which is like its cause.

original: 'di lta ste skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu dag gi lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu dag gi lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the homogeneous cause and the universal cause.

original: gal te kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu'i 'bras bu yang 'dra ba yin na go ci'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kho nar mi 'dod ce na /🔽'di ltar de ni sa dang nyon mongs pa can las 'dra ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu'i 'bras bu yang 'dra ba yin na go ci'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kho nar mi 'dod ce na / 'di ltar de ni sa dang nyon mongs pa can las 'dra ba yin gyi /
translated: If the result of a universal cause is similar to its cause, why is it not considered to be a homogeneous cause?

original: rnam pa las kyang 'dra ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa las kyang 'dra ba ni ma yin no //
translated: A universal cause is similar to its result in realm and stage, but not in aspect.

original: gang zhig rnam pa las kyang 'dra ba de ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin par khas len pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang zhig rnam pa las kyang 'dra ba de ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin par khas len pa nyid do //
translated: That which is similar in aspect is accepted as a homogeneous cause.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang zhig gang gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa de kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu yang yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang zhig gang gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa de kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu yang yin nam zhe na /
translated: Therefore, is that which is a homogeneous cause also a universal cause?

original: mu bzhir bya ste /
analyzed: mu bzhir bya ste /
translated: There are four possibilities:

original: mu dang po ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mu dang po ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni kun tu 'gro ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The first possibility is a homogeneous cause that is not a universal cause.

original: gnyis pa ni ris gzhan pa'i kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ris gzhan pa'i kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: The second is a universal cause that is not a homogeneous cause, such as a universal cause belonging to another class.

original: gsum pa ni ris gcig pa'i kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni ris gcig pa'i kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: The third is a universal cause that is a homogeneous cause, such as a universal cause belonging to the same class.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The fourth is that which is neither.

original: bral ba blo yis zad pa'o //
analyzed: bral ba blo yis zad pa'o //
translated: Cessation is the exhaustion of the object of the mind.

original: zad pa ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: Extinction is cessation.

original: blo ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: blo ni shes rab ste /
translated: Intelligence is discernment.

original: des na so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni bral ba'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //🔽gang gi stobs kyis gang skye ba'i //
analyzed: des na so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni bral ba'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro // gang gi stobs kyis gang skye ba'i //
translated: Thus the text should be interpreted as follows: the effect of disjunction is the cessation due to deliberation.

original: 'bras de skyes bu byed las skyes //
analyzed: 'bras de skyes bu byed las skyes //
translated: The effect of human action is the effect that arises through the power of an action.

original: dper na sa 'og ma pa'i sbyor ba'i sems kyis gong ma pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i zag pa med pa dang / bsam gtan gyi sems kyi @97b sprul pa'i sems so zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na sa 'og ma pa'i sbyor ba'i sems kyis gong ma pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i zag pa med pa dang / bsam gtan gyi sems kyi @97b sprul pa'i sems so zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, the concentration of a stage is the effect of human action of the thought of the stage or of a lower stage. The pure thought is the effect of human action of the impure thought. The thought of emanation is the effect of human action of the thought of absorption.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni gang gi stobs kyis 'thob pa zhes brjod par bya'o //🔽sngon byung ma yin 'dus byas ni //🔽'dus byas kho na'i bdag po'i 'bras //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni gang gi stobs kyis 'thob pa zhes brjod par bya'o // sngon byung ma yin 'dus byas ni // 'dus byas kho na'i bdag po'i 'bras //
translated: The cessation due to deliberation is the effect of human action of the power that obtains it.🔽The effect of dominance is the effect of an action that is not a homogeneous cause.🔽The effect of dominance of a conditioned factor is a conditioned factor.

original: sngar byung ba las gzhan pa'i 'dus byas kyi chos ni 'dus byas thams cad kyi bdag po'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: sngar byung ba las gzhan pa'i 'dus byas kyi chos ni 'dus byas thams cad kyi bdag po'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The effect of dominance of a factor is a factor that has arisen later than it.

original: skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dag la tha dad du bya ba ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dag la tha dad du bya ba ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the effect of dominance and the effect of human action?

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni byed pa po'i yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni byed pa po'i yin no //
translated: The effect of human action is the effect of the agent.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni byed pa po ma yin pa'i yang yin te /
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni byed pa po ma yin pa'i yang yin te /
translated: The effect of dominance is the effect of a non-agent.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: bzo bo rnams kyi bzo ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yang yin la bdag po'i 'bras bu yang yin no //
analyzed: bzo bo rnams kyi bzo ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yang yin la bdag po'i 'bras bu yang yin no //
translated: the craft of the artisans is the effect of human action and the effect of dominance.

original: gzhan dag gi ni bdag po'i 'bras bu kho na yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi ni bdag po'i 'bras bu kho na yin no //
translated: The effect of dominance of others is only the effect of dominance.

original: yang rgyu 'di dag las rgyu gang zhig dus gang du 'bras bu 'dzin tam 'byin ce na /
analyzed: yang rgyu 'di dag las rgyu gang zhig dus gang du 'bras bu 'dzin tam 'byin ce na /
translated: Among these causes, which cause takes an effect or gives up an effect in what time period?

original: lnga po da ltar 'bras bu 'dzin //
analyzed: lnga po da ltar 'bras bu 'dzin //
translated: Five causes take an effect in the present.

original: yongs su bzung zin pa'i phyir 'das pa rnams kyang ma yin la skyes bu byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa rnams kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su bzung zin pa'i phyir 'das pa rnams kyang ma yin la skyes bu byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa rnams kyang ma yin no //
translated: Past causes do not take an effect because the effect has already been taken. Future causes do not take an effect because they do not yet have activity.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu yang de dang 'dra mod kyi de ni 'bras bu dang bcas par ma nges pas ma brjod do //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu yang de dang 'dra mod kyi de ni 'bras bu dang bcas par ma nges pas ma brjod do //
translated: The efficient cause is also like this, but it is not mentioned here because it is not certain that it is associated with an effect.

original: gnyis ni rab tu 'byin par byed //
analyzed: gnyis ni rab tu 'byin par byed //
translated: Two causes give forth their effect when they are in the present.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag ni da ltar 'bras bu 'byin par byed de /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag ni da ltar 'bras bu 'byin par byed de /
translated: The co-existent cause and the associated cause give forth their effect when they are in the present, for the effect is produced only when they are.

original: 'di gnyis kyi 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa ni dus mnyam pa kho na yin no //🔽da ltar gyi dang 'das pa dag /'bras bu 'byin par byed de /🔽skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu dag go //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa ni dus mnyam pa kho na yin no // da ltar gyi dang 'das pa dag /'bras bu 'byin par byed de / skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu dag go //
translated: The effect that they grasp and the effect that they give forth are simultaneous with them.🔽Two causes give forth their effect when they are in the present or in the past.🔽The homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause give forth their effect when they are in the present or in the past.

original: re zhig gang 'das pa dag ni rigs ni da ltar gyi dag go //
analyzed: re zhig gang 'das pa dag ni rigs ni da ltar gyi dag go //
translated: The past homogeneous cause gives forth its effect when it is in the present, for the effect that it grasps and the effect that it gives forth are simultaneous.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ji ltar 'byin ce na /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ji ltar 'byin ce na /
translated: How can the homogeneous cause give forth an effect similar to itself?

original: mjug thogs su bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mjug thogs su bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it establishes the effect immediately after it.

original: 'bras bu grub na ni de dag kyang 'das pa yin la 'bras bu yang byung zin pas yang de nyid mi 'byin to //
analyzed: 'bras bu grub na ni de dag kyang 'das pa yin la 'bras bu yang byung zin pas yang de nyid mi 'byin to //
translated: When the effect is achieved, the cause is past and the effect has already arisen: the cause no longer gives forth the effect.

original: dge ba'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'bras bu 'dzin la mi 'byin pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'bras bu 'dzin la mi 'byin pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: Is there a virtuous homogeneous cause that does not give a result?

original: mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four possibilities:

original: mu dang po ni dge ba'i rtsa bdag kun tu gcod pas thams cad kyi tha mar 'dor ba'i thob pa gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: mu dang po ni dge ba'i rtsa bdag kun tu gcod pas thams cad kyi tha mar 'dor ba'i thob pa gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: The first possibility is the obtainment that is discarded last of all when severing the roots of virtue.

original: gnyis pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dag gi nyid mtshams sbyor bas thams cad kyi dang por 'thob pa gang dag yin pa'o //🔽'di skad du de dag nyid kyis nyid mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i zhes @98a * //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dag gi nyid mtshams sbyor bas thams cad kyi dang por 'thob pa gang dag yin pa'o // 'di skad du de dag nyid kyis nyid mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i zhes @98a * //
translated: The second possibility is the obtainment that is first obtained when connecting with the roots of virtue.

original: brjod par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It should not be said that they are connected by those roots themselves.

original: gsum pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu ma chad pa'i gnas skabs lhag ma rnams su'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu ma chad pa'i gnas skabs lhag ma rnams su'o //
translated: The third possibility is the remaining states when the roots of virtue are not severed.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The fourth possibility is that which is not excluded from those three.

original: mi dge ba'i mu dang po ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral pa thob pa dang ldan pas thams cad kyi tha mar 'dor ba'i thob pa gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i mu dang po ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral pa thob pa dang ldan pas thams cad kyi tha mar 'dor ba'i thob pa gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: The first possibility of nonvirtue is the obtainment that is discarded last of all when obtaining freedom from attachment to the desire realm.

original: gnyis pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams pas thams cad kyi dang por 'thob pa gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams pas thams cad kyi dang por 'thob pa gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: The second is that which is obtained first of all by one who has regressed from freedom from attachment to the desire realm.

original: 'di skad du de dag nyid kyis yongs su nyams pa'i zhes brjod par bya ba ni yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du de dag nyid kyis yongs su nyams pa'i zhes brjod par bya ba ni yin no //
translated: It should be stated that they are obtained by one who has regressed from freedom from attachment.

original: gsum pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral pa'i gnas skabs lhag ma rnams su'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral pa'i gnas skabs lhag ma rnams su'o //
translated: The third is in the remaining states of freedom from attachment to the desire realm.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The fourth is that which is not included in those types.

original: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i yang de bzhin du dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa dang yongs su nyams pa las ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i yang de bzhin du dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa dang yongs su nyams pa las ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Obtained by the arhat and by one who has regressed from the state of an arhat, respectively.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i ni tshig phyi ma dang sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i ni tshig phyi ma dang sbyor ba ste /
translated: The fourth line is applied to unobscured neutral states.

original: re zhig 'byin pa gang yin pa ni 'dzin pa yang yin no //
analyzed: re zhig 'byin pa gang yin pa ni 'dzin pa yang yin no //
translated: That which is emitted is also retained.

original: 'dzin pa las mi 'byin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: 'dzin pa las mi 'byin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is retention without emission.

original: dgra bcom pa'i phung po tha ma rnams so //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i phung po tha ma rnams so //
translated: This refers to the final aggregates of an arhat.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i nges pas ni skad cig re re la ste /🔽dge ba'i skal pa mnyam pa'i 'bras bu 'dzin la mi 'byin pa zhes bya ba mu bzhi'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i nges pas ni skad cig re re la ste / dge ba'i skal pa mnyam pa'i 'bras bu 'dzin la mi 'byin pa zhes bya ba mu bzhi'o //
translated: The first alternative is when one seizes a homogeneous result of virtuous karma, but does not give it out.

original: mu dang po ni dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa can nam lung du ma bstan pa'i sems mngon du byed pa'o //🔽gnyis pa ni bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: mu dang po ni dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa can nam lung du ma bstan pa'i sems mngon du byed pa'o // gnyis pa ni bzlog pa'o //
translated: The second alternative is when one gives it out, but does not seize it.

original: gsum pa ni dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su dge ba kho na'o //🔽bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su dge ba kho na'o // bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The third alternative is when one both gives it out and seizes it.🔽The fourth alternative is when one neither gives it out nor seizes it.

original: mi dge ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same four alternatives should be applied to nonvirtuous karma and so on.

original: yang ji ltar na 'bras bu gzung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na 'bras bu gzung ba yin zhe na /
translated: How does one seize a result?

original: de'i sa bon gyi dngos por nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sa bon gyi dngos por nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it becomes the seed of that result.

original: gcig ni 'das pas 'byin par 'gyur //
analyzed: gcig ni 'das pas 'byin par 'gyur //
translated: One result is given out by the past.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni 'das pa kho nas 'bras bu 'byin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni 'das pa kho nas 'bras bu 'byin te /
translated: The cause of karmic maturation gives out its result only as a past cause.

original: 'di ltar lhan cig gam de ma thag tu rnam par smin pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar lhan cig gam de ma thag tu rnam par smin pa ni med do //
translated: In fact, the effect cannot be simultaneous with or immediately after the action.

original: gzhan dag ni 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi zhig tu yang 'chad de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi zhig tu yang 'chad de /
translated: Other masters establish four effects:

original: rten gyi 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: rten gyi 'bras bu ni /
translated: 1. effect of dominance,

original: 'di lta ste rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis chu'i dkyil 'khor lta bu nas sa gzhi'i rtsa ba la sogs pa'i bar lta bu'o //🔽sbyor ba'i 'bras bu ni @98b 'di lta ste mi sdug pa nas mi skye ba shes pa'i bar lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis chu'i dkyil 'khor lta bu nas sa gzhi'i rtsa ba la sogs pa'i bar lta bu'o // sbyor ba'i 'bras bu ni @98b 'di lta ste mi sdug pa nas mi skye ba shes pa'i bar lta bu'o //
translated: like the circle of wind with respect to the circle of water, like the root of a tree with respect to the trunk, etc.

original: tshogs pa'i 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshogs pa'i 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: 2. effect of human action, like the object made by the artisan;

original: mig la sogs pa dag gi mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag lta bu'o //🔽bsgom pa'i 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste gzugs na spyod pa'i lam gyi sprul pa'i sems lta bu'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dag gi mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag lta bu'o // bsgom pa'i 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste gzugs na spyod pa'i lam gyi sprul pa'i sems lta bu'o //
translated: 3. effect of dominance, like the eye and its consciousness;🔽4. effect of human action, like the path and its fruit.

original: 'di thams cad ni skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dag gi khongs su 'dus so //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dag gi khongs su 'dus so //
translated: All these effects are included in the two effects of the category of homogeneous cause and the category of pervasive cause.

original: rgyu rnams dang 'bras bu rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: rgyu rnams dang 'bras bu rnams bshad zin to //
translated: We have explained the causes and the effects.

original: de la chos gang zhig rgyu dag du zhig gis skyed par byed ce na smras pa /
analyzed: de la chos gang zhig rgyu dag du zhig gis skyed par byed ce na smras pa /
translated: How many causes generate how many results?

original: mdor bsdu na chos ni rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na chos ni rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag yin te /
translated: In brief, there are four types of phenomena:🔽afflicted phenomena,🔽those arisen from the cause of karmic maturation,🔽those that are uncontaminated, and

original: 'di lta ste chos nyon mongs pa can rnams dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i dbang po rnams dang / de dag gi lhag ma rnams so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste chos nyon mongs pa can rnams dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i dbang po rnams dang / de dag gi lhag ma rnams so //
translated: the remaining phenomena.

original: lhag ma yang gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: lhag ma yang gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: What are the remaining phenomena?

original: rnam par smin pa las ma gtogs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i skad cig ma dang po ma gtogs pa'i dge ba rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las ma gtogs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i skad cig ma dang po ma gtogs pa'i dge ba rnams so //
translated: They are neutral phenomena that are not karmic maturation and virtuous phenomena that are not the first moment of uncontaminated states.

original: chos rnam pa bzhi po de dag ni /🔽nyon mongs can dang rnam smin skyes //
analyzed: chos rnam pa bzhi po de dag ni / nyon mongs can dang rnam smin skyes //
translated: These four types of phenomena🔽are generated by four causes,🔽two causes,🔽three causes, and two causes, respectively.

original: lhag dang dang po 'phags rim bzhin //
analyzed: lhag dang dang po 'phags rim bzhin //
translated: Afflicted phenomena and those arisen from the cause of karmic maturation

original: rnam smin kun 'gro de gnyis dang // skal mnyam ma gtogs lhag las skyes //
analyzed: rnam smin kun 'gro de gnyis dang // skal mnyam ma gtogs lhag las skyes //
translated: are generated by four causes, excluding the cause of universal occurrence.

original: chos nyon mongs pa can rnams ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa lhag ma lnga las skye'o //
analyzed: chos nyon mongs pa can rnams ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa lhag ma lnga las skye'o //
translated: Defiled dharmas are produced from five causes, excluding the ripening cause.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams ni kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ma gtogs pa lhag ma lnga po kho na las skye'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams ni kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ma gtogs pa lhag ma lnga po kho na las skye'o //
translated: Dharmas born of retribution are produced from five causes, excluding the universal cause.

original: chos lhag ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu de dag ma gtogs pa lhag ma bzhi las skye'o //
analyzed: chos lhag ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu de dag ma gtogs pa lhag ma bzhi las skye'o //
translated: The remaining dharmas are produced from four causes, excluding the ripening cause and the universal cause.

original: zag pa med pa'i dang po rnams ni rnam par smin pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu de dag dang / skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa lhag ma gsum las skye'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dang po rnams ni rnam par smin pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu de dag dang / skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa lhag ma gsum las skye'o //
translated: The first uncontaminated dharmas are produced from three causes, excluding the ripening cause, the universal cause, and the similar cause.

original: chos rnam pa bzhi po bstan pa de dag gang yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: chos rnam pa bzhi po bstan pa de dag gang yin snyam pa la /
translated: What are the four kinds of dharmas that are taught?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba yin zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba yin zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The root text states, “They are mind and mental factors.”

original: 'o na gang dag sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang / gzugs can gyi chos de dag ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang dag sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang / gzugs can gyi chos de dag ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What about the dharmas that are not associated with mind and those that are form?

original: mtshungs ldan ma gtogs gzhan de bzhin //🔽mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gcig po ma gtogs pa chos nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa gzhan yang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ji lta ba de kho na @99a * //
analyzed: mtshungs ldan ma gtogs gzhan de bzhin // mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gcig po ma gtogs pa chos nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa gzhan yang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ji lta ba de kho na @99a * //
translated: The same is true of other dharmas, except for the concomitant cause.🔽The same is true of other dharmas, except for the concomitant cause.

original: bzhin du skye ste /
analyzed: bzhin du skye ste /
translated: The defiled dharmas, etc., arise in the same way as the mind and mental activities, except for the concomitant cause.

original: de la nyon mongs pa can rnams dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams ni bzhi las so //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa can rnams dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams ni bzhi las so //
translated: The defiled dharmas arise from four causes.

original: lhag ma rnams ni gsum las so //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni gsum las so //
translated: The remaining dharmas arise from three causes.

original: zag pa med pa'i dang po ni gnyis las te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dang po ni gnyis las te /
translated: The first pure dharmas arise from two causes.

original: rgyu gcig las byung ba'i chos ni med do //
analyzed: rgyu gcig las byung ba'i chos ni med do //
translated: There are no dharmas that arise from one cause.

original: rgyu rgya cher bshad pa rdzogs so //
analyzed: rgyu rgya cher bshad pa rdzogs so //
translated: The extensive explanation of causes is completed.

original: rkyen rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: rkyen rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are conditions?

original: rkyen ni bzhi po dag tu gsungs //
analyzed: rkyen ni bzhi po dag tu gsungs //
translated: Four conditions are taught.

original: gang nas gsungs she na /
analyzed: gang nas gsungs she na /
translated: Where are they taught?

original: mdo las rkyen nyid ni bzhi ste rgyu'i rkyen nyid dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen nyid dang / bdag po'i rkyen nyid do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo las rkyen nyid ni bzhi ste rgyu'i rkyen nyid dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen nyid dang / bdag po'i rkyen nyid do zhes gsungs so //
translated: In the sutra, it says: “There are four conditions: the causal condition, the immediately antecedent condition, the condition qua object, and the dominant condition.”

original: rkyen du 'dra ba ni rkyen nyid do //
analyzed: rkyen du 'dra ba ni rkyen nyid do //
translated: The condition of similarity is the similar condition.

original: de la rgyu zhes bya ba rgyu lnga yin ;
analyzed: de la rgyu zhes bya ba rgyu lnga yin ;
translated: The cause is fivefold.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu ma gtogs pa rgyu lnga ni rgyu'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu ma gtogs pa rgyu lnga ni rgyu'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The five causes, with the exception of the efficient cause, are the causal condition.

original: sems dang sems byung skyes pa rnams //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung skyes pa rnams //
translated: Arisen minds and mental factors🔽are the similar and immediately antecedent condition.

original: tha ma yin mtshungs de ma thag / dgra bcom pa'i tham ma gtogs pa sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: tha ma yin mtshungs de ma thag / dgra bcom pa'i tham ma gtogs pa sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin te /
translated: With the exception of the final mind and mental factors of an arhat, all minds and mental factors are the similar and immediately antecedent condition.

original: rkyen 'di ni mtshungs pa yang yin la de ma thag pa'i yang yin pas mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
analyzed: rkyen 'di ni mtshungs pa yang yin la de ma thag pa'i yang yin pas mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
translated: This condition is similar and immediately antecedent, thus it is the similar and immediately antecedent condition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi mnyam par 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi mnyam par 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin te /
translated: Form is not a similar and immediately antecedent condition because it arises unequally.

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs kyi mjug thogs su res 'ga' ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs kyi mjug thogs su res 'ga' ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs 'byung ngo //
translated: For example, sometimes nonindicative form of the desire realm arises immediately after form of the desire realm, sometimes nonindicative form of the form realm arises.

original: res 'ga' ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa 'byung bas gzugs mngon du 'gyur ba 'chol pa yin no //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa 'byung bas gzugs mngon du 'gyur ba 'chol pa yin no //
translated: Sometimes, form belonging to the desire realm and uncontaminated form arise.

original: mtshungs pa de ma theg pa'i rkyen ni 'chol pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma theg pa'i rkyen ni 'chol pa ma yin no //
translated: The condition as equivalent immediately antecedent is not confused.

original: btsun pa dbyig bshes na re rgyas pa las byung ba'i gzugs kyi rgyud gcig ma 'gags pa kho nar gnyis pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: btsun pa dbyig bshes na re rgyas pa las byung ba'i gzugs kyi rgyud gcig ma 'gags pa kho nar gnyis pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Bhadanta Vasumitra says that one stream of form derived from enhancement arises while another stream of form derived from enhancement does not cease.

original: btsun ba na re ches mang ba dang nyung du 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: btsun ba na re ches mang ba dang nyung du 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Bhadanta says that it is because many or few arise.

original: res 'ga' ni gzugs mang po las nyung du 'byung ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni gzugs mang po las nyung du 'byung ste /
translated: Sometimes, many forms arise from few,

original: dper na sog ma'i thal ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sog ma'i thal ba lta bu'o //
translated: for example, from a small amount of chaff.

original: res 'ga' ni nyung du las mang po 'byung ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni nyung du las mang po 'byung ste /
translated: Sometimes, many arise from few,

original: dper na shing pa ta'i sa bon chung du las rim gyis yal ga du ma skye ba dang ldan pa'i shing n+ya gro dha'i bar lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na shing pa ta'i sa bon chung du las rim gyis yal ga du ma skye ba dang ldan pa'i shing n+ya gro dha'i bar lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: for example, from a small nyagrodha seed, a tree gradually arises with many branches.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la yang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dag dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa @99b la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum la chos mang ba dang nyung du 'byung ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la yang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dag dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa @99b la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum la chos mang ba dang nyung du 'byung ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Don't many virtuous, nonvirtuous and neutral minds and the three concentrations such as that possessing investigation and analysis arise in minds and mental factors?

original: rigs gzhan la ni yod kyi rang gi rigs la ni med de /
analyzed: rigs gzhan la ni yod kyi rang gi rigs la ni med de /
translated: They exist in different types but not in the same type.

original: nam yang tshor ba'am 'du shes la sogs pa ches mang du 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: nam yang tshor ba'am 'du shes la sogs pa ches mang du 'byung ba med do //
translated: Because feeling, discernment and so on never arise in greater number.

original: yang ci rang gi rigs kho na'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci rang gi rigs kho na'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are they only equivalent immediately preceding conditions of their own type?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not,

original: 'dir ni tshogs mtha' dag kho na tshogs mtha' dag gzhan gyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir ni tshogs mtha' dag kho na tshogs mtha' dag gzhan gyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin gyi /
translated: because here the entire collection is the equivalent immediately preceding condition of the entire collection.

original: 'dir ni tshor ba la sogs pa'i rdzas nyung ngu las tshor ba la sogs pa'i rdzas mang po 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de tsam zhig bshad par zad do ;
analyzed: 'dir ni tshor ba la sogs pa'i rdzas nyung ngu las tshor ba la sogs pa'i rdzas mang po 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de tsam zhig bshad par zad do ;
translated: But here it is explained that a small substance of feeling and so on does not arise from a large substance of feeling and so on.

original: / rgyud 'dra ba dag ni rang gi rigs kho na'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: / rgyud 'dra ba dag ni rang gi rigs kho na'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin te /
translated: Those of similar type are the equivalent immediately preceding condition of their own type alone.

original: sems kyang sems kho na'i yin la /
analyzed: sems kyang sems kho na'i yin la /
translated: Mind is that of mind alone,🔽and feeling is that of feeling alone.

original: tshor ba yang tshor ba kho na'i yin no snyam du rgyas par sems shing gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa can 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa de'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni sngon 'gags pa'i nyon mongs🔽pa yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba yang tshor ba kho na'i yin no snyam du rgyas par sems shing gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa can 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa de'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni sngon 'gags pa'i nyon mongs pa yin te /
translated: When afflicted states arise from nonafflicted states, the equivalent immediately preceding condition of that affliction is an affliction that has previously ceased.

original: dper na ldang ba'i sems kyi 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems lta bu'o zhes zer te //
analyzed: dper na ldang ba'i sems kyi 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems lta bu'o zhes zer te //
translated: For example, it is like the mind entering meditative attainment in absorption on cessation being the equivalent immediately preceding condition of the mind of emergence.

original: de skad du ni mi brjod do //
analyzed: de skad du ni mi brjod do //
translated: But that is not stated.

original: ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang 'chol bar mngon du gyur pa de nyid kyi phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin te /
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang 'chol bar mngon du gyur pa de nyid kyi phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin te /
translated: Non-associated compositional factors are also not equivalent immediately preceding conditions because they manifest in a confused way.

original: khams gsum pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams cig car mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams cig car mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those of the three realms and those not associated with a realm manifest simultaneously.

original: ci'i phyir ma 'ongs pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma 'ongs pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why is a future state not considered an equivalent immediately preceding condition?

original: ma 'ongs ba'i dus ni 'chol ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs ba'i dus ni 'chol ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the future time period is confused.

original: snga phyi med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga phyi med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no sequence of earlier and later.

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis ma 'ongs pa che ge mo zhig gi mjug tu ma 'ongs pa 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya bar ji ltar mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis ma 'ongs pa che ge mo zhig gi mjug tu ma 'ongs pa 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya bar ji ltar mkhyen ce na /
translated: But how does the Bhagavān know that this future state arises after that future state?

original: 'das pa dang da ltar gyi las rjes su dpag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar gyi las rjes su dpag pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because he infers from past and present states.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis las 'di lta bu'i rnam par smin pa ni 'di lta bu 'am chos las chos skyes so zhes bya bar 'das pa'i dus gzigs la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis las 'di lta bu'i rnam par smin pa ni 'di lta bu 'am chos las chos skyes so zhes bya bar 'das pa'i dus gzigs la /
translated: The Bhagavān sees the past time period, “This karma has such and such a ripening” or “This dharma arises from that dharma.”

original: da lta'i las 'di yang de lta bu yin pas /
analyzed: da lta'i las 'di yang de lta bu yin pas /
translated: This present action is also like that.

original: de lta bas na 'di las kyang rnam par smin pa de lta bu'am /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di las kyang rnam par smin pa de lta bu'am /
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One knows that such a ripened effect will arise from this action,

original: chos las chos skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar mkhyen la /
analyzed: chos las chos skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar mkhyen la /
translated: or that a phenomenon will arise from a phenomenon.

original: de'i mkhyen pa de yang rjes su dpag pa las byung ba yang ma yin @100a * //
analyzed: de'i mkhyen pa de yang rjes su dpag pa las byung ba yang ma yin @100a * //
translated: And that knowledge of the Blessed One does not arise from inference.

original: te ; 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'das pa dang da ltar las rjes su dpag nas ma 'ongs pa'i rdzas 'chol pa rnams mngon sum du brtags te /
analyzed: te ; 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'das pa dang da ltar las rjes su dpag nas ma 'ongs pa'i rdzas 'chol pa rnams mngon sum du brtags te /
translated: For the Blessed One infers from the past and present and directly perceives the future, which is hidden.

original: gang zag 'dis las 'di lta bu byas pas ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu 'di yongs su bzung ngo zhes bya bar mkhyen to zhes grag go //
analyzed: gang zag 'dis las 'di lta bu byas pas ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu 'di yongs su bzung ngo zhes bya bar mkhyen to zhes grag go //
translated: It is said that he knows, “This person has created this kind of action and will obtain this kind of future effect.”

original: de lta na bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon gyi mtha' ma gzigs par phyi ma'i mtha' mi mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon gyi mtha' ma gzigs par phyi ma'i mtha' mi mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the Blessed One would not know the future without seeing the past.

original: gzhan dag na re sems can rnams kyi rgyud la 'bras bu'i rtags su gyur pa sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi khyad par zhig yod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sems can rnams kyi rgyud la 'bras bu'i rtags su gyur pa sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi khyad par zhig yod de /
translated: Others say: There is a special nonmental formation that is a sign of the result in the mindstreams of sentient beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de gzigs nas bsam gtan nam mngon par mkhyen pa mngon du mdzad bzhin du yang ma 'ongs pa mkhyen to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de gzigs nas bsam gtan nam mngon par mkhyen pa mngon du mdzad bzhin du yang ma 'ongs pa mkhyen to zhes zer ro //
translated: The Bhagavat sees that and, even though he does not manifest concentration or higher perception, he knows the future.

original: mdo sde pa rnams na re di ltar na bcom ldan 'das mtshan mkhan kho na yin par 'gyur gyi mngon sum du mdzad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams na re di ltar na bcom ldan 'das mtshan mkhan kho na yin par 'gyur gyi mngon sum du mdzad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Sautrantikas say: In that case, the Bhagavat would be a mere fortuneteller, but he is not one who makes predictions.

original: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das ni bzhed pa tsam gyis thams cad mkhyen te /
analyzed: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das ni bzhed pa tsam gyis thams cad mkhyen te /
translated: Therefore the Bhagavat knows all by mere wish.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul ni bsam gyis mi khyab po zhes gsungs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul ni bsam gyis mi khyab po zhes gsungs so zhes zer ro //
translated: The Bhagavat also said, The domain of buddhas is inconceivable.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i go rims nges par gnas pa med na ci'i phyir chos kyi mchog gi mjug thogs su sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa kho na skye'i gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i go rims nges par gnas pa med na ci'i phyir chos kyi mchog gi mjug thogs su sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa kho na skye'i gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: If the order of future factors is not determined, why is it that the receptivity to the cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness is produced immediately after the supreme mundane factor, and not any other cognition?

original: de bzhin du rdo rje lta bu'i mjug thogs su zad pa shes pa kho na skye'i gzhan ma yin pa'i bar du yin zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje lta bu'i mjug thogs su zad pa shes pa kho na skye'i gzhan ma yin pa'i bar du yin zhe na /
translated: In the same way, why is it that the cognition of exhaustion is produced immediately after the vajra-like concentration, and not any other cognition?

original: gang zhig gang la rag las te skye ba de ni de'i mjug thogs su skye ste /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la rag las te skye ba de ni de'i mjug thogs su skye ste /
translated: The cognition that is produced in dependence on a certain factor is produced immediately after this factor.

original: dper na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen med bzhin du yang sa bon la sogs pa'i myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen med bzhin du yang sa bon la sogs pa'i myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the sprout is produced in dependence on the seed, etc.

original: ci'i phyir dgra bcom pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba tham rnams mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dgra bcom pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba tham rnams mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are the last thought and thought-concomitants of the perfected being not an equivalent and immediately antecedent condition?

original: sems gzhan dang 'brel pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems gzhan dang 'brel pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not followed by another thought.

original: de lta na 'gags ma thag pa'i sems yid yin no zhes bya ba de ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir sems tha ma yid du yang mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de lta na 'gags ma thag pa'i sems yid yin no zhes bya ba de ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir sems tha ma yid du yang mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If that is so, then is not the final mind not the mental faculty, because the immediately preceding consciousness does not exist?

original: yid ni rten gyi dngos pos rab tu phye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: yid ni rten gyi dngos pos rab tu phye ba yin gyi /
translated: The mental faculty is distinguished by its support,

original: byed pas rab tu phye ba ni ma yin pas rten ni yod pa nyid kyi rgyu ma tshang bas rnam par shes pa @100b gzhan mi skye ba kho nar zad do //
analyzed: byed pas rab tu phye ba ni ma yin pas rten ni yod pa nyid kyi rgyu ma tshang bas rnam par shes pa @100b gzhan mi skye ba kho nar zad do //
translated: but it is not distinguished by its activity. Therefore, the support exists, but another consciousness does not arise due to the incompleteness of its causes.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni byed pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni byed pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: The condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent is distinguished by its activity.

original: des chos gang 'bras bur gzung ba de ni chos thams cad dam srog chags thams cad kyis kyang ji ltar yang mi skye bar dgag par mi nus so //
analyzed: des chos gang 'bras bur gzung ba de ni chos thams cad dam srog chags thams cad kyis kyang ji ltar yang mi skye bar dgag par mi nus so //
translated: Whatever dharma it takes as its result, that dharma cannot be prevented from arising by any dharma or any living being.

original: chos gang dag sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yin pa de dag sems kyi de ma thag pa can yang yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: chos gang dag sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yin pa de dag sems kyi de ma thag pa can yang yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are those dharmas that are equivalent and immediately antecedent to mind also equivalent and immediately antecedent to mental factors?

original: mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four possibilities.

original: mu dang po ni sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba'i sems dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: mu dang po ni sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba'i sems dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa dag go //
translated: The first possibility is the mind that arises from the mindless meditative attainments and the second moment and so on of meditative attainment.

original: mu gnyis pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang po dang sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs kyi skye ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mu gnyis pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang po dang sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs kyi skye ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The second possibility is the first moment of meditative attainment and the arising and so on of the mind that possesses mind.

original: mu gsum pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang po dang / sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs dag go //
analyzed: mu gsum pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang po dang / sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs dag go //
translated: The third possibility is the first moment of meditative attainment and the mind that possesses mind.

original: mu bzhi pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa dang / ldang ba'i sems kyi skye ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mu bzhi pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa dang / ldang ba'i sems kyi skye ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The fourth possibility is the second moment and so on of meditative attainment and the arising and so on of the mind that arises from meditative attainment.

original: chos gang dag sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yin pa de dag snyoms par 'jug pa'i de ma thag pa can yin nam zhe na /🔽mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: chos gang dag sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yin pa de dag snyoms par 'jug pa'i de ma thag pa can yin nam zhe na / mu bzhi ste /
translated: Are any phenomena that are equivalent immediately preceding conditions of mind also immediately preceding conditions of meditative attainment?🔽There are four possibilities.

original: gsum pa dang bzhi pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni dang po dang gnyis pa dag go //
analyzed: gsum pa dang bzhi pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni dang po dang gnyis pa dag go //
translated: The third and fourth are the first and second.

original: dang po dang gnyis pa gang dag yin ba de dag ni gsum pa dang bzhi pa gang dag yin par bshad do //
analyzed: dang po dang gnyis pa gang dag yin ba de dag ni gsum pa dang bzhi pa gang dag yin par bshad do //
translated: The first and the second are explained as the third and the fourth.

original: da ni ji ltar ldang ba'i sems yun ring mo zhig tu chad pa snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar ldang ba'i sems yun ring mo zhig tu chad pa snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: But how can the thought of leaving the meditative attainment, which is separated from the thought of entry into meditative attainment by a long period of time, be the immediately preceding condition of this thought of entry?

original: sems gzhan gyis mchod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems gzhan gyis mchod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the thought of entry that arrests the thought of leaving.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen bshad zin to //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen bshad zin to //
translated: The condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent has been discussed.

original: dmigs pa chos rnams thams cad do //
analyzed: dmigs pa chos rnams thams cad do //
translated: The condition as the object is all factors.

original: ci rigs par mig gi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i ni gzugs so //
analyzed: ci rigs par mig gi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i ni gzugs so //
translated: The object-field of the visual consciousness, accompanied by its associated elements, is visible form.

original: rnam ba'i rnam par shes pa'i ni sgra'o //🔽sna'i rnam par shes pa'i ni dri'o //🔽lce'i rnam par shes pa ni ro'o //
analyzed: rnam ba'i rnam par shes pa'i ni sgra'o // sna'i rnam par shes pa'i ni dri'o // lce'i rnam par shes pa ni ro'o //
translated: The object-field of the auditory consciousness is sound.🔽The object-field of the olfactory consciousness is odor.🔽The object-field of the gustatory consciousness is taste.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa ni reg bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa ni reg bya'o //
translated: The object-field of the tactile consciousness is the tangible.

original: yid kyi rnam bar shes ba ni chos thams cad do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam bar shes ba ni chos thams cad do //
translated: The object-field of the mental consciousness is all factors.

original: chos gang zhig chos gang gi dmigs pa yin pa'i chos de ni mi dmigs kyang de lta bu'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir nam yang dmigs pa ma yin te /🔽dper na shing la sogs pa mi sreg kyang de lta ba'i @101a * //
analyzed: chos gang zhig chos gang gi dmigs pa yin pa'i chos de ni mi dmigs kyang de lta bu'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir nam yang dmigs pa ma yin te / dper na shing la sogs pa mi sreg kyang de lta ba'i @101a * //
translated: The object of consciousness is not always the object of consciousness, even when the object exists, because the object is not always present.

original: mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir bud shing zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir bud shing zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, even though fuel is not burning, it is called fuel because it has the nature of fuel.🔽The mind and mental factors are determined in regard to the object in terms of the sense sphere, substance, and moment, because they are momentary.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos skye mched dang / rdzas dang / skad cig ma des pas dmigs pa la skad cig bdag nyid ji lta bar nges pa 'di dag ci rten nges pas kyang nges pa zhig yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos skye mched dang / rdzas dang / skad cig ma des pas dmigs pa la skad cig bdag nyid ji lta bar nges pa 'di dag ci rten nges pas kyang nges pa zhig yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are they also determined in regard to the support?

original: smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: smras pa de bzhin te /
translated: They are just so.

original: skyes pa rnams ni rten dang lhan cig pa dag yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa rnams ni rten dang lhan cig pa dag yin no //
translated: Those that have arisen are associated with the support.

original: ma skyes pa rnams dang / 'das pa rnams ni rten dang ma 'brel pa dag yin no //
analyzed: ma skyes pa rnams dang / 'das pa rnams ni rten dang ma 'brel pa dag yin no //
translated: Those that have not arisen and those that have passed away are not associated with the support.

original: gzhan dag na re 'das pa rnams kyang rten dang lhan cig pa dag yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'das pa rnams kyang rten dang lhan cig pa dag yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that those that have passed away are also associated with the support.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen bshad zin to //🔽byed rgyu zhes bya bdag por bshad //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen bshad zin to // byed rgyu zhes bya bdag por bshad //
translated: The objective condition has been explained.🔽The efficient cause is the dominant condition.

original: byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de nyid bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de nyid bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The efficient cause is the dominant condition.

original: rkyen 'di ni lhag pa yin pas bdag po'i rkyen to //
analyzed: rkyen 'di ni lhag pa yin pas bdag po'i rkyen to //
translated: This condition is the dominant one, thus it is the dominant condition.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen yang chos thams cad yin la /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen yang chos thams cad yin la /
translated: All factors are the objective condition.

original: bdag po'i rkyen yang chos thams cad yin na 'di la lhag pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen yang chos thams cad yin na 'di la lhag pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: All factors are the dominant condition. What is the difference between them?

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni nam yang dmigs pa ma yin gyi bdag po'i rkyen ni yin pas 'di la lhag pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni nam yang dmigs pa ma yin gyi bdag po'i rkyen ni yin pas 'di la lhag pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: The factors that coexist never are the objective condition, but they are the dominant condition. Thus, the dominant condition is distinguished from the objective condition.

original: yang na lhag pa'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: yang na lhag pa'i rkyen yin te /
translated: Or else, the dominant condition is so called because it is the preeminent condition.

original: chos thams cad rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa'i 'dus byas thams cad kyi yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa'i 'dus byas thams cad kyi yin no //
translated: All factors are the dominant condition of all conditioned factors, with the exception of themselves.

original: rkyen bzhi char gyis kyang chos kyi rkyen ma yin pa'i chos lta yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: rkyen bzhi char gyis kyang chos kyi rkyen ma yin pa'i chos lta yod dam zhe na /
translated: Can there be a factor that is not a condition of some other factor?

original: yod de / rang gi ngo bos rang gi ngo bo lta bu'o //
analyzed: yod de / rang gi ngo bos rang gi ngo bo lta bu'o //
translated: Yes, the intrinsic nature of a factor is not a condition of that factor.

original: gzhan gyi ngo po yang yod de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo po yang yod de /
translated: The intrinsic nature of another factor is not a condition of it either.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi 'dus byas lta bu dang / 'dus ma byas kyi 'dus ma byas lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi 'dus byas lta bu dang / 'dus ma byas kyi 'dus ma byas lta bu'o //
translated: unconditioned phenomena are like conditioned phenomena, and conditioned phenomena are like unconditioned phenomena.

original: yang rkyen 'di dag bya ba byed pa na gnas skabs gang gi chos la byed ce na /
analyzed: yang rkyen 'di dag bya ba byed pa na gnas skabs gang gi chos la byed ce na /
translated: When these conditions perform their function, with respect to what state of a phenomenon do they perform their function?

original: re zhig rgyu'i rkyen rnam pa ldar bshad pa de las /
analyzed: re zhig rgyu'i rkyen rnam pa ldar bshad pa de las /
translated: From among the four types of causal conditions that were explained,

original: rgyu gnyis po dag 'gag pa la bya ba byed do //
analyzed: rgyu gnyis po dag 'gag pa la bya ba byed do //
translated: two causes perform their function with regard to cessation.

original: 'gag pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar yin te /
analyzed: 'gag pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar yin te /
translated: Cessation is the present.

original: 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is directed toward cessation.

original: de la ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag bya ba byed de /
analyzed: de la ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag bya ba byed de /
translated: With regard to that, coemergent causes and concomitant causes perform their function.

original: de gnyis ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i 'bras bu la bya ba byed do //🔽gsum po ni skye ba la'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i 'bras bu la bya ba byed do // gsum po ni skye ba la'o //
translated: Because those two perform their function with regard to coemergent effects.🔽Three perform their function with regard to arising.

original: skye ba zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa ste /
translated: Arising is the future.

original: skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa yin no //
translated: Because it is directed toward arising.

original: de la ni skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun tu 'gro ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu rnams bya ba byed de /
analyzed: de la ni skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun tu 'gro ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu rnams bya ba byed de /
translated: With regard to that, homogeneous, omnipresent, and ripening causes perform their function.

original: re zhig rgyu'i rkyen ni @101b de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: re zhig rgyu'i rkyen ni @101b de lta bu yin no //
translated: The causal condition is as just explained.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rkyen dag de las bzlog pa yin /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rkyen dag de las bzlog pa yin /
translated: The other conditions are the opposite.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dag ni byed pa'i tshul gang gis rgyu'i rkyen rnam pa gnyis su byas nas bshad pa de las bzlog par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dag ni byed pa'i tshul gang gis rgyu'i rkyen rnam pa gnyis su byas nas bshad pa de las bzlog par rig par bya ste /
translated: The condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent and the condition as object are the opposite of the causal condition, which is divided into two parts.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni skabs 'byed pa'i phyir skye ba la bya ba byed do //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni skabs 'byed pa'i phyir skye ba la bya ba byed do //
translated: The condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent performs its function with regard to birth, because it opens up a place for the arising of the effect.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni da ltar gyi sems dang sems las byung pa rnams kyis 'dzin pa'i phyir 'gag pa la bya ba byed do //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni da ltar gyi sems dang sems las byung pa rnams kyis 'dzin pa'i phyir 'gag pa la bya ba byed do //
translated: The condition as object performs its function with regard to cessation, because the present mind and mental factors hold the object.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni gnas skabs thams cad du mi sgrib pa'i ngo por gnas pas 'di'i bya ba ni 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni gnas skabs thams cad du mi sgrib pa'i ngo por gnas pas 'di'i bya ba ni 'di nyid yin no //
translated: The dominant condition performs its function in all situations, because it is the mere absence of obstruction.

original: rkyen rnams byed pa dang bcas par bshad zin to //
analyzed: rkyen rnams byed pa dang bcas par bshad zin to //
translated: The conditions and their functions have been explained.

original: yang chos gang zhig rkyen du zhig gis skyed ce na /
analyzed: yang chos gang zhig rkyen du zhig gis skyed ce na /
translated: What dharmas are produced by how many conditions?

original: bzhi yis sems dang sems byung rnams //
analyzed: bzhi yis sems dang sems byung rnams //
translated: The four conditions are the cause,

original: de la 'di dag rgyu'i rkyen ni rgyu lnga po thams cad do //
analyzed: de la 'di dag rgyu'i rkyen ni rgyu lnga po thams cad do //
translated: The causal condition is the five causes.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni sems dang sems las byung ba snga ma gzhan dag gi bar du ma chod pa rnams so //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni sems dang sems las byung ba snga ma gzhan dag gi bar du ma chod pa rnams so //
translated: The condition as equivalent and immediate antecedent is the preceding mind and mental factors, without interval.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni ci rigs par yul lnga po dag dang chos thams cad do //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni ci rigs par yul lnga po dag dang chos thams cad do //
translated: The objective condition is the five sense objects and all dharmas, as appropriate.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa chos thams cad do //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa chos thams cad do //
translated: The dominant condition is all dharmas, excluding its own nature.

original: gsum gyis snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis //
analyzed: gsum gyis snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis //
translated: Two meditative attainments are by three.

original: 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag la ni dmigs pa'i rkyen med de /
analyzed: 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag la ni dmigs pa'i rkyen med de /
translated: The meditative attainments of cessation and nonperception do not have an objective condition,

original: de dag ni dmigs par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni dmigs par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: because they do not take an object.

original: de gnyis kyi rgyu'i rkyen ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi rgyu'i rkyen ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The causal condition of those two is twofold:

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni skye ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni skye ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: the coemergent cause is arising and so on.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni sa mtshungs pa'i dge ba'i chos sngar byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni sa mtshungs pa'i dge ba'i chos sngar byung ba rnams so //
translated: The homogeneous cause is previously arisen virtuous dharmas of the same level.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent is the thought of entry into the meditative attainment and its associated factors.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The condition as the dominant is as above.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag ni sems kyi mngon par 'du byed pa las skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag ni sems kyi mngon par 'du byed pa las skye ba'i phyir /
translated: These meditative attainments are born from the formation of thought.

original: sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can dag ni yin gyi sems skye pa la bgegs byed pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can dag ni yin gyi sems skye pa la bgegs byed pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni ma yin no //
translated: They are thus preceded by a thought similar to themselves, but they are not a condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent of a thought, for they hinder the birth of a thought.

original: gzhan ni gnyis po dag las skye //
analyzed: gzhan ni gnyis po dag las skye //
translated: The other factors are born from the two.

original: chos gzhan ldan pa ma yin pa rnams dang gzugs can rnams ni rgyu dang bdag po'i rkyen dag las skye'o //
analyzed: chos gzhan ldan pa ma yin pa rnams dang gzugs can rnams ni rgyu dang bdag po'i rkyen dag las skye'o //
translated: The other factors, namely, the non-associated formative forces and the material factors, are born from the causal condition and the condition as the dominant.

original: dngos po rnams ni ji skad bshad pa'i @102a * //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni ji skad bshad pa'i @102a * //
translated: The factors that are born, as the Abhidharma explains,

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams kho na las skye'i 'gro pa thams cad kyi rgyu gcig pu dbang phyug dang skyes bu dang / gtso bo la sogs pa ni med do zhes bya ba 'di la gtan tshigs ci zhig yod /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams kho na las skye'i 'gro pa thams cad kyi rgyu gcig pu dbang phyug dang skyes bu dang / gtso bo la sogs pa ni med do zhes bya ba 'di la gtan tshigs ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the reason for saying that all beings are born from causes and conditions alone, and that there is no single cause of all beings such as God, Purusha, or Prakriti?

original: gal te gtan tshigs kyis byas pa'i grub par sems na de nyid kyis thams cad kyi rgyu dbang phyug la sogs pa cig car du zhig yin no zhes bya ba'i smra ba 'di pa stsal ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs kyis byas pa'i grub par sems na de nyid kyis thams cad kyi rgyu dbang phyug la sogs pa cig car du zhig yin no zhes bya ba'i smra ba 'di pa stsal ba ma yin nam /
translated: If you think that this is established by reason, then by that very fact, is it not the case that the assertion that God is the single cause of all is refuted?

original: gzhan yang / dbang phyug sogs min rim sogs phyir //🔽gal te dbang phyug gam /
analyzed: gzhan yang / dbang phyug sogs min rim sogs phyir // gal te dbang phyug gam /
translated: Moreover, they are not God, etc., because of sequence, etc.

original: gzhan yang rung ste rgyu gcig pu kho na zhig yin na 'gro ba thams cad cig car du 'byung bar 'gyur pa zhig na /
analyzed: gzhan yang rung ste rgyu gcig pu kho na zhig yin na 'gro ba thams cad cig car du 'byung bar 'gyur pa zhig na /
translated: If God or some other single cause were the cause of all, then all beings would arise simultaneously.

original: dngos po rnams ni rim gyis 'byung ba yang snang ngo //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni rim gyis 'byung ba yang snang ngo //
translated: But it is seen that things arise sequentially.

original: de ni 'di ni da ltar skye bar gyur cig /'di ni 'gag par gyur cig /'di ni phyis skye bar gyur cig ces dbang phyug gi 'dod pa'i dbang gis yin no //🔽'o na ni 'dod pa tha dad pa'i phyir rgyu du mar 'grub par 'gyur la /🔽'dod pa tha dad pa de yang de'i rgyu'i dbang phyug la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir cig car 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽'on te rgyu gzhan la ltos na ni dbang phyug rgyu ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ni 'di ni da ltar skye bar gyur cig /'di ni 'gag par gyur cig /'di ni phyis skye bar gyur cig ces dbang phyug gi 'dod pa'i dbang gis yin no // 'o na ni 'dod pa tha dad pa'i phyir rgyu du mar 'grub par 'gyur la / 'dod pa tha dad pa de yang de'i rgyu'i dbang phyug la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir cig car 'byung bar 'gyur ro // 'on te rgyu gzhan la ltos na ni dbang phyug rgyu ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur la /
translated: It is not that it is so because of the power of Īśvara’s desire, such as “Let this be born now,” “Let this cease,” “Let this be born later.”🔽But if so, it is established that there are many causes because of the difference in desires.🔽And that difference in desires would occur simultaneously because there is no difference in the cause of that, Īśvara.🔽But if it depends on another cause, then Īśvara is not a cause at all.🔽🔽
