original: de dag kyang rim gyis skye ba la rgyu gzhan gyi bye brag la ltos pa'i phyir thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur bas rgyu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i bye brag mtha' yas pa thog ma med pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir dbang phyug gi rgyur
analyzed: de dag kyang rim gyis skye ba la rgyu gzhan gyi bye brag la ltos pa'i phyir thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur bas rgyu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i bye brag mtha' yas pa thog ma med pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir dbang phyug gi rgyur

original: mos pa 'di ni sh'akya'i sras po'i lus kho na las ma 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: mos pa 'di ni sh'akya'i sras po'i lus kho na las ma 'das pa yin no //
translated: This desire is not beyond the body of the son of the Śākyas.

original: gal te dbang phyug gi 'dod pa rnams cig car yin du zin kyang 'gro ba ni cig car ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug gi 'dod pa rnams cig car yin du zin kyang 'gro ba ni cig car ma yin te /
translated: If the desires of Īśvara are simultaneous, the world is not simultaneous,

original: 'dod pa ji lta bar skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa ji lta bar skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: because it arises in accordance with desire.

original: de dag la phyis khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la phyis khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not so, because there is no difference later.

original: re zhig dbang phyug gi 'byin pa'i tshegs 'di rnyed la don ci zhig yod /
analyzed: re zhig dbang phyug gi 'byin pa'i tshegs 'di rnyed la don ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the point of this effort of Īśvara in creating?

original: gal te dga' ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dga' ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is pleasure,

original: 'o na ni thabs med par de byed par mi nus pas de la dbang phyug ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni thabs med par de byed par mi nus pas de la dbang phyug ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: then he is not Īśvara with regard to that, because he is not able to do it without a cause.

original: gzhan la yang de kho na dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yang de kho na dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies to others.

original: gal te yang dbang phag dmyal ba la sogs par skye dgu gnod pa mang po dang 'bol pa dag phyung nas des dga' bar 'gyur na ni de lta bu'i dbang phyug de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gal te yang dbang phag dmyal ba la sogs par skye dgu gnod pa mang po dang 'bol pa dag phyung nas des dga' bar 'gyur na ni de lta bu'i dbang phyug de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: If Īśvara creates living beings in hell and so on, who are tormented by many harms and pains, and if he is pleased by that, then homage to him!

original: de las brtsams nas /
analyzed: de las brtsams nas /
translated: Starting from that,

original: gang phyir @102b ma lus sreg pa dang // gang phyir rna dang gang phyir gtum //
analyzed: gang phyir @102b ma lus sreg pa dang // gang phyir rna dang gang phyir gtum //
translated: Because he burns everything, because he is the ear, because he is fierce,

original: gang phyir gdung ldan gang gi phyir //
analyzed: gang phyir gdung ldan gang gi phyir //
translated: because he is the one who torments,

original: sha dang khrag dang rkang za ba //
analyzed: sha dang khrag dang rkang za ba //
translated: because he eats flesh, blood, and marrow,

original: de phyir drag po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de phyir drag po zhes bya'o //
translated: therefore he is called Rudra.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di yang legs par smras pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di yang legs par smras pa yin no //
translated: This verse is also well spoken.

original: yang 'gro ba'i rgyu gcig tu yongs su bzung bas don gzhan dag gi skyes bu'i phyed pa mngon sum ni bsnyon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang 'gro ba'i rgyu gcig tu yongs su bzung bas don gzhan dag gi skyes bu'i phyed pa mngon sum ni bsnyon par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, by holding that there is only one cause of the world, you deny the existence of other objects that are directly perceived.

original: rgyu rnams dang bcas pa'i dbang phyug la yang rgyur rtog pa rnams ni gus pas smra ba 'ba' zhig tu zad de /
analyzed: rgyu rnams dang bcas pa'i dbang phyug la yang rgyur rtog pa rnams ni gus pas smra ba 'ba' zhig tu zad de /
translated: Those who imagine that God, together with the causes, is the cause, are only speaking out of devotion.

original: rgyu rnams las gzhan gyis byed pa mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu rnams las gzhan gyis byed pa mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because no activity is seen that is different from the causes.

original: dbang phyug de lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang po rnams la yang dbang phyug ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug de lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang po rnams la yang dbang phyug ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: And God is not the cause of the primary causes that are simultaneous with him.

original: 'on te dang po byung pa dbang phyug gi rgyu las byung ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dang po byung pa dbang phyug gi rgyu las byung ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the first one arose from the cause of God,

original: de yang rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir dbang phyug bzhin du thog ma med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir dbang phyug bzhin du thog ma med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then, since it does not depend on another cause, it follows, absurdly, that like God, it too would be beginningless.

original: de bzhin du gtso bo la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gtso bo la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same argument can be made with regard to the primal substance.

original: de lta bas na 'jig rten gyi rgyu gcig pu ni med kyi 'di ni rang gi las rnams kho nas skye ba de dang der skye bar byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'jig rten gyi rgyu gcig pu ni med kyi 'di ni rang gi las rnams kho nas skye ba de dang der skye bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, there is no single cause of the world. It is one’s own karma that causes one to be born in this or that place of birth.

original: nyon mongs blo ma sbyangs pa rnams ni rang rang gi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu nyams su myong ba na log par gzhan dbang phyug tu yongs su rtog par byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs blo ma sbyangs pa rnams ni rang rang gi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu nyams su myong ba na log par gzhan dbang phyug tu yongs su rtog par byed do //
translated: Those whose minds are not trained in the afflictions, when they experience the fruitional effects and the effects of conscious effort, wrongly imagine that God is the cause.

original: de ni rdzogs so /🔽// / yang /
analyzed: de ni rdzogs so / // / yang /
translated: This concludes the chapter on God, the fourth chapter of the Root Verses on the Middle Way.

original: gzhan ni gnyis po dag las skye //
analyzed: gzhan ni gnyis po dag las skye //
translated: The other arises from both.

original: zhes gang bshad pa de ji ltar na 'byung ba rnams 'byung ba rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyen yin zhe na /
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa de ji ltar na 'byung ba rnams 'byung ba rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyen yin zhe na /
translated: How can the primary elements be the causal condition of the primary elements?

original: de yi 'byung ba rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: de yi 'byung ba rnam pa gnyis //
translated: The primary elements are twofold.

original: 'byung ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning of the term is that they are the cause of the primary elements.

original: skal ba mnyam pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dag gis so ;🔽/'byung las gyur pa'i rnam pa lnga //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dag gis so ; /'byung las gyur pa'i rnam pa lnga //
translated: They are the homogeneous cause and the co-existent cause.🔽The primary elements are the five causes of the derivative form.

original: byung ba rnams 'byung ba las gyur pa'i ni rgyu rnam pa lnga yin te /
analyzed: byung ba rnams 'byung ba las gyur pa'i ni rgyu rnam pa lnga yin te /
translated: The primary elements are the five causes of the derivative form.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: What are the five?🔽Because they generate, support, and maintain,

original: skyed phyir brten phyir gnas phyir dang / rtog pa'i phyir dang 'phel byed phyir //
analyzed: skyed phyir brten phyir gnas phyir dang / rtog pa'i phyir dang 'phel byed phyir //
translated: because they cause the imagination, and because they increase.

original: de yang byed rgyu'i rgyu kho na rnam pa lnga tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang byed rgyu'i rgyu kho na rnam pa lnga tha dad pa yin te /
translated: The active cause alone is distinguished into five types.

original: skyed pa'i rgyu ni de dag las skye pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyed pa'i rgyu ni de dag las skye pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The generating cause is because derivative form arises from them.🔽The supporting cause is because it is the support of that which has arisen.🔽It is like, for example, the earth being the support of the sprouts.

original: brten pa'i rgyu ni skyes pa 'byung ba'i rjes su mthun par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: brten pa'i rgyu ni skyes pa 'byung ba'i rjes su mthun par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: The maintaining cause is because it causes the continuity of that which has arisen to remain.🔽It is like, for example, food being the cause for the continuation of sentient beings.🔽The causing the imagination cause is because it is the cause for the imagination of the unreal.

original: slob dpon la sogs pa la brten pa bzhin no //
analyzed: slob dpon la sogs pa la brten pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like, for example, the eye being the cause for the imagination of visible form.🔽The increasing cause is because it causes the growth of that which has arisen.🔽It is like, for example, manure being the cause for the growth of a crop.

original: gnas pa'i rgyu ni rten du gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyu ni rten du gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: The cause of duration is the support,

original: ri mo'i rtsig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ri mo'i rtsig pa bzhin no //
translated: like a wall for a painting.

original: rton pa'i rgyu ni rgyan mi 'chad pa'i rgya yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽'phel bar byed pa'i @103a * //
analyzed: rton pa'i rgyu ni rgyan mi 'chad pa'i rgya yin pa'i phyir ro // 'phel bar byed pa'i @103a * //
translated: The cause of reliance is the cause of the non-interruption of the series.

original: rgyu ni 'phel ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu ni 'phel ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The cause of growth is the cause of increase.

original: de lta bas na de dag gi skye ba dang / 'gyur ba dang / brten pa dang gnas pa dang / rton pa dang 'phel ba'i rgyu nyid du bstan pa yin no //🔽'byung 'gyur rnam gsum phan tshun du //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag gi skye ba dang / 'gyur ba dang / brten pa dang gnas pa dang / rton pa dang 'phel ba'i rgyu nyid du bstan pa yin no // 'byung 'gyur rnam gsum phan tshun du //
translated: Thus, these are taught as the causes of birth, transformation, support, duration, reliance, and growth.

original: rgyu yin te /
analyzed: rgyu yin te /
translated: The three elements are causes of each other,

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang / skal ba mnyam pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dag gis so //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang / skal ba mnyam pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dag gis so //
translated: as the causes of co-existence, of similar lot, and of ripening.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni bye brag med par 'jug pa'i phyir rtag tu mi bgrang ngo //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni bye brag med par 'jug pa'i phyir rtag tu mi bgrang ngo //
translated: The efficient cause is not always mentioned, because it is the cause of everything, without distinction.

original: de la lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni lus dang ngag gi las sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa phan tshun du yin gyi rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de la lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni lus dang ngag gi las sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa phan tshun du yin gyi rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Coemergent causes are the mutual relationship of the body and speech karma that follow the mind.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni sngar byung ba thams cad skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni sngar byung ba thams cad skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Homogeneous causes are all those that have arisen previously.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni lus dang ngag gi las gang gi rnam par smin pa mig la sogs pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni lus dang ngag gi las gang gi rnam par smin pa mig la sogs pa yin pa'o //
translated: Karmic maturation causes are the body and speech karma that are the cause of the eyes and so on.

original: 'byung ba rnams kyi de rnams gcig /'byung pa las gyur pa'i gzugs 'byung ba rnams kyi ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams kyi de rnams gcig /'byung pa las gyur pa'i gzugs 'byung ba rnams kyi ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu kho na yin te /
translated: The primary elements are one cause of primary elements.

original: de ni bcu'i 'jug thogs su 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni bcu'i 'jug thogs su 'byung ste /
translated: It is produced from ten stages:

original: rang gi bzhi dang / 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i skye gnas thob pa dang / spyod lam pa dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag las so //
analyzed: rang gi bzhi dang / 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i skye gnas thob pa dang / spyod lam pa dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag las so //
translated: from its own four stages, from the minds obtained from birth in the desire realm and the form realm, and from the minds of demeanor and the maturational birth.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i mjug thogs su ni drug ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i mjug thogs su ni drug ste /
translated: It is produced from six stages:

original: sbyor ba las byung ba ma gtogs pa rang gi gsum dang / 'og ma'i nyon mongs pa can gsum mo //
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba ma gtogs pa rang gi gsum dang / 'og ma'i nyon mongs pa can gsum mo //
translated: from its own three stages, excluding the mind of preparation, and from the three defiled minds of the lower stages.

original: de ni bzhi las te /🔽rang gi dag kho na las so //
analyzed: de ni bzhi las te / rang gi dag kho na las so //
translated: It is produced from four stages:🔽from its own three stages, excluding the unobscured-neutral mind, and from the defiled mind of the desire realm.

original: slob pa'i mjug thogs su ni drug ste /
analyzed: slob pa'i mjug thogs su ni drug ste /
translated: It is produced from six stages:🔽from its own three stages, excluding the unobscured-neutral mind, and from the defiled minds of the two lower stages.🔽It is produced from four stages:🔽from its own three stages, excluding the unobscured-neutral mind, and from the defiled mind of the desire realm.

original: khams gsum pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba rnams dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i skye gnas thob pa dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba rnams dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i skye gnas thob pa dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa'o //
translated: The first is the mind of emanation of the realm of desire, the mind obtained through birth in the realm of desire, the learner mind and the nonlearner mind.

original: de ni bzhi las te /
analyzed: de ni bzhi las te /
translated: It arises from four minds:

original: sbyor ba las byung ba gsum dang / slob pa las so //
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba gsum dang / slob pa las so //
translated: three of the realm of desire, namely, the mind obtained through birth, the mind acquired through preparatory effort and the learner mind;🔽the mind of emanation of the realm of fine-materiality.

original: mi slob pa'i mjug thogs su ni lnga ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i mjug thogs su ni lnga ste /
translated: The nonlearner mind arises immediately after five minds:

original: slob pa gcig pu ma gtogs pa slob pa'i mjug thogs ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: slob pa gcig pu ma gtogs pa slob pa'i mjug thogs ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: the learner mind of the three realms, the mind acquired through preparatory effort of the realm of fine-materiality and the nonlearner mind.

original: de ni lnga las te /
analyzed: de ni lnga las te /
translated: It arises from five minds:

original: sbyor ba las byung ba gsum dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa dag las so //🔽ci'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas pa'i sems dag 'byung la /
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba gsum dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa dag las so // ci'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas pa'i sems dag 'byung la /
translated: the three of the realm of fine-materiality acquired through preparatory effort, the learner mind and the nonlearner mind.🔽Why does the mind acquired through preparatory effort arise immediately after the wholesome, unwholesome and non-defined minds acquired through preparatory effort of the realm of desire?

original: sbyor ba las byung ba ni de dag las ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba ni de dag las ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why does the mind acquired through preparatory effort not arise after the mind acquired at birth, etc.?

original: de dag ni spyod lam dang / bzo mngon par 'du bya ba la zhugs pa'i phyir dang / stobs chung ba dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug pa'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba'i rjes su mthun pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni spyod lam dang / bzo mngon par 'du bya ba la zhugs pa'i phyir dang / stobs chung ba dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug pa'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba'i rjes su mthun pa ma yin no //
translated: These are not compatible with the mind arisen from application because they are applied to deportment and to the creation of crafts, because they are weak, and because they are not applied.

original: 'byung ba'i sems ni mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug pas de ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su 'byung bar rigs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i sems ni mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug pas de ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su 'byung bar rigs so //
translated: The mind of emanation is not applied, therefore it is correct that it arises immediately after the mind arisen from application.

original: de lta na 'o na ni nyon mongs pa can dag las kyang sbyor ba las byung ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /🔽mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni nyon mongs pa can dag las kyang sbyor ba las byung ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur te / mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that is so, then also the mind arisen from application would not arise from the afflicted because they are incompatible.

original: 'on kyang nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung bas yongs su skyo ba la ni de yongs su shes pa las sbyor ba las byung ba mngon du 'gyur bar rigs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung bas yongs su skyo ba la ni de yongs su shes pa las sbyor ba las byung ba mngon du 'gyur bar rigs so //
translated: However, it is correct that the mind arisen from application manifests from the complete knowledge of the afflicted, since it is generated by the complete knowledge of the afflicted that arises from the occurrence of the afflicted.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i skye gnas thob pa la ni gsal ba'i phyir slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i mjug thogs su 'byung gi mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'byung ba'i phyir de @107a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i skye gnas thob pa la ni gsal ba'i phyir slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i mjug thogs su 'byung gi mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'byung ba'i phyir de @107a * //
translated: The attainment of birth existence in the desire realm arises immediately after the learner, nonlearner, and form realm meditative development.

original: las ni de dag mi 'byung ngo //🔽gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi mjug thogs su ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i skye gnas thob pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: las ni de dag mi 'byung ngo // gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi mjug thogs su ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i skye gnas thob pa 'byung ste /
translated: But it does not arise from those meditative developments that arise effortlessly.

original: gsal ba'i phyir ro //🔽gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi mjug thogs su ni gzugs na spyod pa'i skye gnas thob pa mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: gsal ba'i phyir ro // gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi mjug thogs su ni gzugs na spyod pa'i skye gnas thob pa mi 'byung ste /
translated: The attainment of birth existence in the desire realm arises immediately after the afflicted meditative development of the form realm because it is clear.

original: mi gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The attainment of birth existence in the form realm does not arise immediately after the afflicted meditative development of the formless realm because it is unclear.

original: yid la byed pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three types of attention:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid yid la byed pa ni dper na gzugs ni gnod par byar rung ba'i mtshan nyid can no snyam pa de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid yid la byed pa ni dper na gzugs ni gnod par byar rung ba'i mtshan nyid can no snyam pa de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Attention to specific characteristics, for example, thinking, form is characterized by being suitable to be form.🔽Attention to the lack of specific characteristics, for example, thinking, form is not suitable to be form.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid yid la byed pa ni rnam pa bcu drug dang ldan pa'o ;
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid yid la byed pa ni rnam pa bcu drug dang ldan pa'o ;
translated: The attention of the general characteristics has sixteen aspects.

original: / mos pa yid la byed pa ni mi sdug pa dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs can gyi rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched la sogs pa dag la'o //🔽de la yid la byed pa rnam pa gsum gyi mjug thogs su 'phags pa'i lam mngon du byed la /
analyzed: / mos pa yid la byed pa ni mi sdug pa dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs can gyi rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched la sogs pa dag la'o // de la yid la byed pa rnam pa gsum gyi mjug thogs su 'phags pa'i lam mngon du byed la /
translated: The attention of conviction is with regard to the meditation on the impurities, the immeasurables, the liberations of form, the spheres of mastery, the spheres of totality, and so on.🔽Immediately after the three kinds of attention, one manifests the noble path.

original: de las kyang yid la byed pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de las kyang yid la byed pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: And immediately after the noble path, one manifests the three kinds of attention.

original: de lta na mi sdug pa dang / lhan cig pa'i dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag sgom par byed do zhes bya ba 'di rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na mi sdug pa dang / lhan cig pa'i dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag sgom par byed do zhes bya ba 'di rigs pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is reasonable to say that one cultivates the member of enlightenment called mindfulness accompanied by the meditation on the impurities.

original: gzhan dag na re spyi yid la byed pa kho na'i mjug thogs su 'phags pa'i lam mngon du byed la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re spyi yid la byed pa kho na'i mjug thogs su 'phags pa'i lam mngon du byed la /
translated: Others say that one manifests the noble path immediately after the attention of the general characteristics.

original: de las ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de las ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: And immediately after the noble path, one manifests the three kinds of attention.

original: mi sdug pas sems btul nas spyi yid la byed pa'i mjug thogs su 'phags pa'i lam mngon du byed pa de'i phyir brgyud pa las dgongs nas mi sdug pa dang lhan cig pa'i dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag sgom par byed do zhes gsungs so🔽zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mi sdug pas sems btul nas spyi yid la byed pa'i mjug thogs su 'phags pa'i lam mngon du byed pa de'i phyir brgyud pa las dgongs nas mi sdug pa dang lhan cig pa'i dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag sgom par byed do zhes gsungs so zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus, with regard to the continuum, it is said that he cultivates the branch of enlightenment that is mindfulness associated with the meditation on the foul.

original: gzhan dag na re 'phags pa'i lam gyi mjug thogs su yang spyi yid la byed pa kho na'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'phags pa'i lam gyi mjug thogs su yang spyi yid la byed pa kho na'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: At the conclusion of the noble path, he cultivates only the general mental contemplation.

original: re zhig mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pas gsum la brten nas nges pa la 'jug na ni lam de rnams kyi mjug thogs su 'dod pa na spyod pa'i skyi yid la byed pa mngon du byed pa par 'gyur na /
analyzed: re zhig mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pas gsum la brten nas nges pa la 'jug na ni lam de rnams kyi mjug thogs su 'dod pa na spyod pa'i skyi yid la byed pa mngon du byed pa par 'gyur na /
translated: If one enters ascertainment in dependence on the three, such as the stage of unrestricted access concentration, then at the conclusion of those paths, he would manifest the mental contemplation of the desire realm.

original: gal te bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa la brten nas nges pa la 'jug na go ji ltar te /
analyzed: gal te bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa la brten nas nges pa la 'jug na go ji ltar te /
translated: But if one enters ascertainment in dependence on the second concentration and so on, how is that?

original: shin tu bskal pa'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa ni mi nus so //
analyzed: shin tu bskal pa'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa ni mi nus so //
translated: Because it is too distant, he cannot manifest the desire realm.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ma @107b gtogs par de dag gis pa yang mi thob bo //🔽'phags pa ni yang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa mngon du mdzad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ma @107b gtogs par de dag gis pa yang mi thob bo // 'phags pa ni yang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa mngon du mdzad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They do not obtain the state of being a non-returner, except for the state of being a candidate for the realization of the fruit of non-returner.🔽The noble ones do not manifest the state of being a candidate for the realization of the fruit of non-returner.

original: 'bras bu thob zin pa de'i sbyor ba mngon du byed pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob zin pa de'i sbyor ba mngon du byed pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that one who has already obtained the fruit should manifest the preparatory state for that fruit.

original: des ni de dang 'dra ba'i spyi yid la byed pa gzhan yang 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: des ni de dang 'dra ba'i spyi yid la byed pa gzhan yang 'di lta ste ;
translated: They obtain other general mental attentions similar to that, such as:

original: 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: All conditioned things are impermanent.

original: chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are selfless.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o snyam pa 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o snyam pa 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Nirvana is peace.

original: de mngon du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de mngon du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: They manifest that.

original: de skad du ni mi brjod do //
analyzed: de skad du ni mi brjod do //
translated: But that is not said.

original: mi lcogs pa med pa la brten nas dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa'i ldang ba'i sems ni de'i sa pa'am 'dod pa na spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pa la brten nas dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa'i ldang ba'i sems ni de'i sa pa'am 'dod pa na spyod pa yin no //
translated: The mind of emergence for attaining the state of an arhat based on unrestricted access concentration is either of its level or belongs to the desire realm.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched la brten nas 'thob pa ni de'i sa pa'am srid pa'i rtse mo pa yin no //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched la brten nas 'thob pa ni de'i sa pa'am srid pa'i rtse mo pa yin no //
translated: The cognition of exhaustion and cognition of non-arising are of the domain of the fourth meditation, or of the summit of cyclic existence, when they are obtained through the sphere of nothingness.

original: sa lhag ma rnams su ni rang gi sa pa kho na'o //
analyzed: sa lhag ma rnams su ni rang gi sa pa kho na'o //
translated: In the other stages, they are of the stage of the meditation in which one is.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na ni yid la byed pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na ni yid la byed pa gsum ste /
translated: In the realm of desire, there are three types of attention:

original: thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba dang / skyes nas thob pa rnams so //
analyzed: thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba dang / skyes nas thob pa rnams so //
translated: attention arisen from listening, reflection, and cultivation.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni gsum ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni gsum ste /
translated: In the realm of fine-materiality, there are three types of attention:

original: thob pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / skyes nas thob pa rnams so //
analyzed: thob pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / skyes nas thob pa rnams so //
translated: attention arisen from listening, from reflection, and from cultivation.

original: bsams pa las byung ba ni med do //
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba ni med do //
translated: There is no attention arisen from reflection in the realm of immateriality.

original: gang gi tshe de dag sems par rtsom pa de'i tshe de dag gi ting nge 'dzin kho na nye bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de dag sems par rtsom pa de'i tshe de dag gi ting nge 'dzin kho na nye bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: When beings of this realm begin to reflect, then concentration itself is present.🔽In the realm of immateriality, there are two types of attention:

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / skyes nas thob pa dag go //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / skyes nas thob pa dag go //
translated: attention arisen from cultivation and attention acquired at birth.

original: de la skyes nas thob pa dag ma gtogs pa yid la byed pa rnam pa lnga'i mjug thogs su 'phags pa'i lam mngon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la skyes nas thob pa dag ma gtogs pa yid la byed pa rnam pa lnga'i mjug thogs su 'phags pa'i lam mngon du 'gyur te /
translated: Except for those obtained from birth, the ārya path manifests immediately after five types of attention.

original: sbyor ba la rag lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba la rag lus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it depends on preparation.

original: lam gyi mjug thogs su ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i skyes nas thob pa yang mngon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: lam gyi mjug thogs su ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i skyes nas thob pa yang mngon du 'gyur te /
translated: Immediately after the path, the virtuous mind obtained from birth of the desire realm manifests,

original: gsal ba'i phyir ro //🔽gang dag sems bcu gnyis bshad pa de dag las sems gang la du zhig rnyed ce na /
analyzed: gsal ba'i phyir ro // gang dag sems bcu gnyis bshad pa de dag las sems gang la du zhig rnyed ce na /
translated: because it is clear.

original: khams gsum pa yi nyon mongs can //
analyzed: khams gsum pa yi nyon mongs can //
translated: From among the twelve minds explained, how many minds are obtained in dependence on which mind?

original: drug dang drug dang gnyis rnyed do //
analyzed: drug dang drug dang gnyis rnyed do //
translated: Six, six and two are obtained🔽in dependence on afflicted minds of the three realms.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi sems mngon du gyur na /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi sems mngon du gyur na /
translated: When an afflicted mind of the desire realm manifests,🔽six minds are obtained.

original: sems drug po 'di dag dang mi ldan pa las rnyed de /
analyzed: sems drug po 'di dag dang mi ldan pa las rnyed de /
translated: One obtains those six minds not previously possessed.

original: the tshom gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba'i nyid mtshams sbyor ba dang / khams su slar ldog pa las 'dod pa'i khams kyi dge ba dang / khams su slar @108a * //
analyzed: the tshom gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba'i nyid mtshams sbyor ba dang / khams su slar ldog pa las 'dod pa'i khams kyi dge ba dang / khams su slar @108a * //
translated: When one again enters the desire realm, one obtains the virtuous mind of the desire realm.

original: ldog pa dang / yongs su nyams pa las mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang / yongs su nyams pa las gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang /
analyzed: ldog pa dang / yongs su nyams pa las mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang / yongs su nyams pa las gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang /
translated: Nonvirtuous and obscured neutral minds are obtained from the reversal of the uncontaminated mind and from complete degeneration.

original: slob pa'o // gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can la yang drug rnyed de /
analyzed: slob pa'o // gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can la yang drug rnyed de /
translated: A form realm afflicted mind is obtained from six minds.

original: khams su slar log pa las gzugs na spyod pa gsum dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / yongs su nyams pa las gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang / slob pa'o //
analyzed: khams su slar log pa las gzugs na spyod pa gsum dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / yongs su nyams pa las gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang / slob pa'o //
translated: Three form realm minds, a desire realm unobscured neutral mind and a formless realm afflicted mind from complete degeneration and a learner mind.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can la ni gnyis rnyed de /
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can la ni gnyis rnyed de /
translated: A formless realm afflicted mind is obtained from two minds.

original: yongs su nyams pa las nyon mongs pa can de nyid dang / slob pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa las nyon mongs pa can de nyid dang / slob pa'o //
translated: That formless realm afflicted mind and a learner mind from complete degeneration.

original: gzugs skyes dge la gsum dag go //
analyzed: gzugs skyes dge la gsum dag go //
translated: A form realm virtuous mind is obtained from three.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba la sems gsum rnyed de /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba la sems gsum rnyed de /
translated: Three minds are obtained in relation to virtuous form realm minds.

original: dge ba de nyid dang / 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag go //
analyzed: dge ba de nyid dang / 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag go //
translated: The three are the virtuous mind itself, and unobscured neutral minds of the desire realm and form realm.🔽Four in relation to learner minds.

original: slob pa la bzhi //
analyzed: slob pa la bzhi //
translated: Four minds are obtained in relation to learner minds.

original: slob pa de nyid dang / 'phags pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams las 'dod chags dang bral bar byed pa na 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag dang / gzugs med pa'i dge ba'o //
analyzed: slob pa de nyid dang / 'phags pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams las 'dod chags dang bral bar byed pa na 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag dang / gzugs med pa'i dge ba'o //
translated: The three are the learner mind itself, unobscured neutral minds of the desire realm and form realm, and virtuous formless realm mind when one is freed from attachment to the desire realm and form realm by the ārya path.

original: lhag ma de /🔽lhag mar byas pas lhag ma ste //
analyzed: lhag ma de / lhag mar byas pas lhag ma ste //
translated: The remaining minds are not explained.🔽The remaining minds are those not explained.

original: sems gang la rnyed pa ma bshad pa de la ni de nyid rnyed par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems gang la rnyed pa ma bshad pa de la ni de nyid rnyed par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The remaining minds are those not explained.🔽The remaining minds are those not explained.🔽The remaining minds are those not explained.🔽The remaining minds are those not explained.🔽The remaining minds are those not explained.

original: gzhan dag la ni khyad par med par nyon mongs can gyi sems la ni /🔽mkhas pa rnams kyi dgu rnyed brjod //
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni khyad par med par nyon mongs can gyi sems la ni / mkhas pa rnams kyi dgu rnyed brjod //
translated: The remaining minds are those not explained.

original: // / dbang po bstan pa zhes bya ba mjod  kyi bshad pa las gnas gnyis pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: // / dbang po bstan pa zhes bya ba mjod  kyi bshad pa las gnas gnyis pa rdzogs so /
translated: The second part of the commentary on the first chapter, called “The Explanation of the Aggregates,” is complete.

original: // / da ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nges pa nyid kyi sems la sogs pa bstan pa byas pa de la /
analyzed: // / da ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nges pa nyid kyi sems la sogs pa bstan pa byas pa de la /
translated: Now, having explained the certainty of the mind and so on of the desire, form, and formless realms,

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams de dag gang yin pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams de dag gang yin pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: it should be stated what those desire, form, and formless realms are.

original: de'i phyir / dmyal ba yi dags dud 'gro dang // mi rnams dang ni lha drug dag /'dod pa'i khams yin zhes bya ba 'di smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / dmyal ba yi dags dud 'gro dang // mi rnams dang ni lha drug dag /'dod pa'i khams yin zhes bya ba 'di smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said: The hells, ghosts, animals, humans, and the six gods are the desire realm.

original: 'gro ba bzhi dang / lha'i ris drug po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba bzhi dang / lha'i ris drug po 'di lta ste /
translated: The four types of reincarnating beings and the six types of gods are as follows:

original: rgyal chen bzhi po rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams te /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi po rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams te /
translated: the Four Great Kings, the Thirty-Three, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, and the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods.

original: de ltar na de dag snod kyi 'jig rten dang bcas pa ni 'dod pa'i khams yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag snod kyi 'jig rten dang bcas pa ni 'dod pa'i khams yin no //
translated: Thus the desire realm consists of the hells and the physical cosmos.

original: de la gnas du zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: de la gnas du zhig yod ce na /
translated: How many abodes are there?🔽There are twenty abodes,

original: dmyal ba dang / gling dbye ba las de nyi shu zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dmyal ba dang / gling dbye ba las de nyi shu zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: because they are divided by the hells and the continents.

original: gnas rnams zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnas rnams zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: The remainder of the sentence is applied to the abodes.

original: dmyal ba chen po brgyad yod de /
analyzed: dmyal ba chen po brgyad yod de /
translated: There are eight great hells:🔽Saṃjīva, Kālasūtra, Saṃghāta, Raurava, Mahāraurava, Tapana, Pratāpana, and Avīci.

original: yang sos dang / thig nag dang / bsdus 'joms dang / ngu 'bod dang / ngu 'bod chen po dang / tsha ba dang / rab tu tsha ba dang / mnar med pa dang / gling bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang sos dang / thig nag dang / bsdus 'joms dang / ngu 'bod dang / ngu 'bod chen po dang / tsha ba dang / rab tu tsha ba dang / mnar med pa dang / gling bzhi ste /
translated: There are four continents:🔽Jambudvīpa, Pūrvavideha, Aparagodānīya, and Uttarakuru.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling dang / shar gyi lus 'phags gling dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / bshad ma thag pa'i lha'i ris drug dang / yi dvags rnams dang / dud 'gro ste /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling dang / shar gyi lus 'phags gling dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / bshad ma thag pa'i lha'i ris drug dang / yi dvags rnams dang / dud 'gro ste /
translated: There are six classes of gods that have just been explained, ghosts, and animals.

original: de ltar na gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa dag nas mnar med pa'i bar gyi gnas nyi shu po de dag ni 'dod pa'i khams yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa dag nas mnar med pa'i bar gyi gnas nyi shu po de dag ni 'dod pa'i khams yin no //
translated: Thus, the desire realm consists of twenty places, from the heaven of Controlling Others' Emanations down to the Avici hell.

original: snod dang bcas par bzung na ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi bar yin no //
analyzed: snod dang bcas par bzung na ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi bar yin no //
translated: If one includes the receptacle world, then the desire realm extends as far as the wind mandala.

original: 'dod pa'i khams 'di'i /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams 'di'i /
translated: Above the desire realm,

original: gong ma'i gnas dag bcu bdun ni //
analyzed: gong ma'i gnas dag bcu bdun ni //
translated: there are seventeen other places

original: gzugs khams yin /
analyzed: gzugs khams yin /
translated: that constitute the form realm.

original: ji lta zhe na /🔽der so so'i /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / der so so'i /
translated: How is this so?🔽The first, second, and third absorptions

original: bsam gtan sa ni gsum pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bsam gtan sa ni gsum pa yin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: each consist of three stages.

original: bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dag na re re zhing sa gsum pa @109a * //🔽dag yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dag na re re zhing sa gsum pa @109a * // dag yin no //
translated: The first, second, and third absorptions each consist of three stages.

original: bzhi bas ni brgyad pa yin //
analyzed: bzhi bas ni brgyad pa yin //
translated: The fourth absorption consists of eight stages.🔽The first absorption consists of three stages:

original: de la bsam gtan dang po ni tshangs ris rnams dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don rnams dang / tshangs chen rnams so //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po ni tshangs ris rnams dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don rnams dang / tshangs chen rnams so //
translated: Brahmakayika, Brahmapurohita, and Mahabrahma.🔽The second absorption consists of three stages:

original: gnyis pa ni 'od chung rnams dang / tshad med 'od rnams dang / 'od gsal rnams so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'od chung rnams dang / tshad med 'od rnams dang / 'od gsal rnams so //
translated: Parittabha, Apramanabha, and Abhasvara.

original: gsum pa ni dge chung rnams dang / tshad med dge rnams dang / dge rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: gsum pa ni dge chung rnams dang / tshad med dge rnams dang / dge rgyas rnams so //
translated: The third is the Parīttābha, Apramāṇābha, and Ābhāsvara gods.

original: bzhi pa ni sprin med rnams dang / bsod nams skyes rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang / shin tu mthong ba rnams dang 'og min rnams te /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni sprin med rnams dang / bsod nams skyes rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang / shin tu mthong ba rnams dang 'og min rnams te /
translated: The fourth is the gods of Akaniṣṭha, Anabhraka, Puṇyaprasava, Bṛhatphala, Avṛha, Atapa, Sudarśana, and Sudṛśa.

original: de ltar na gnas bcu bdun po 'di dag den gnas pa'i sems can rnams dang bcas pa ni gzugs kyi khams yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gnas bcu bdun po 'di dag den gnas pa'i sems can rnams dang bcas pa ni gzugs kyi khams yin no //
translated: Thus, the realm of form is made up of these seventeen places and the sentient beings who live there.

original: kha che ba rnams na re bcu drug yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha che ba rnams na re bcu drug yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The Kashmiri masters say that there are sixteen places.

original: tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don kho na dag na tshangs pa chen po'i gnas ches mchog tu gyur pa gtso bo gcig pa can cig spags pa bzhin du mngon par grub kyi sa gzhan ni med do zhes grag go //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don kho na dag na tshangs pa chen po'i gnas ches mchog tu gyur pa gtso bo gcig pa can cig spags pa bzhin du mngon par grub kyi sa gzhan ni med do zhes grag go //
translated: In the Brahmapurohita heaven, there is a single residence of Brahmā, the Great One, which is higher than the rest and resembles a terrace.

original: gzugs med khams na gnas med do //
analyzed: gzugs med khams na gnas med do //
translated: There is no place in the formless realm.

original: chos gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la ni gnas med de /
analyzed: chos gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la ni gnas med de /
translated: But the non-material factors have no location.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang ; chos gzugs can ma yin pa rnams ni yul na mi gnas zhes bya bar nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang ; chos gzugs can ma yin pa rnams ni yul na mi gnas zhes bya bar nges pa yin no //
translated: It is certain that the past, the future, the non-informative, and the non-material factors do not have a location in space.

original: de yang / skye ba las ni rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: de yang / skye ba las ni rnam pa bzhi //
translated: And they are classified in four ways according to their mode of birth.🔽The formless realm is classified in four ways according to the mode of birth.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams skye ba'i bye brag gis ni rnam pa bzhi ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams skye ba'i bye brag gis ni rnam pa bzhi ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the four?

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched do //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched do //
translated: The base of infinite space, the base of infinite consciousness, the base of nothingness, and the base of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de dag la yul gyis byas pa'i bla 'og ni med do //
analyzed: de dag la yul gyis byas pa'i bla 'og ni med do //
translated: There is no higher or lower in these modes of birth due to location.

original: ting nge 'dzin thob pa rnams yul gang du 'chi 'pho ba de nyid du skye la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thob pa rnams yul gang du 'chi 'pho ba de nyid du skye la /
translated: Those who have attained the meditative absorption are born in the very place where they die.

original: yang de nas 'chi 'pho ba rnams kyi srid pa bar ma yang de nyid du 'grub bo //
analyzed: yang de nas 'chi 'pho ba rnams kyi srid pa bar ma yang de nyid du 'grub bo //
translated: And the intermediate existence of those who die there is also established there.

original: ji ltar sems can gzugs can rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud gzugs la brten nas 'jug pa de ltar gzugs med pa dag na ci la brten nas 'jug ce na /🔽der ni ris dang srog la yang //
analyzed: ji ltar sems can gzugs can rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud gzugs la brten nas 'jug pa de ltar gzugs med pa dag na ci la brten nas 'jug ce na / der ni ris dang srog la yang //
translated: Just as the mental stream of sentient beings who possess form enters into the body and is supported by the body, so too, in the formless realm, the mental stream enters into and is supported by what?

original: sems kyi rgyud ni brten pa yin //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud ni brten pa yin //
translated: The mental stream of sentient beings in the formless realm is supported by class and life force.

original: chos mngon @109b pa pa rnams na re ris mthun pa dang / srog gi dbang po la brten nas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: chos mngon @109b pa pa rnams na re ris mthun pa dang / srog gi dbang po la brten nas so zhes zer ro //
translated: The Abhidharma masters say that the mental stream of sentient beings in the formless realm is supported by class nikāya and the faculty of life force jīvitendriya.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir sems can gzugs can rnams kyi sems kyi rgyun yang de gnyis kho na la brten nas 'jug par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir sems can gzugs can rnams kyi sems kyi rgyun yang de gnyis kho na la brten nas 'jug par mi 'gyur /
translated: Why don’t the mental streams of sentient beings who possess form also enter into and are supported by those two?

original: stobs chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stobs chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are weak.

original: de na ci'i phyir stobs dang ldan pa nyid yin ;
analyzed: de na ci'i phyir stobs dang ldan pa nyid yin ;
translated: Why are they weak?

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par las skyes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par las skyes pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are born from the special meditative attainment.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa de ni gzugs dang bral ba'i 'du shes can yin no //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa de ni gzugs dang bral ba'i 'du shes can yin no //
translated: That meditative attainment is the perception of freedom from form.

original: 'o na ni stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir de kho nas 'jug par 'gyur gyi rten gyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'o na ni stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir de kho nas 'jug par 'gyur gyi rten gyis ci zhig bya /
translated: If they are strong, then they enter into and are supported by that alone. What is the use of a support?

original: ji ltar sems can gzugs can rnams kyi ris mthun pa dang / srog gi dbang po gzugs la brten nas 'jug pa de ltar sems can gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kyi ci la brten nas 'jug pa 'di yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sems can gzugs can rnams kyi ris mthun pa dang / srog gi dbang po gzugs la brten nas 'jug pa de ltar sems can gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kyi ci la brten nas 'jug pa 'di yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Just as the homogeneous character and the vitality faculty of sentient beings who possess material form are supported by material form, so too, the homogeneous character and the vitality faculty of sentient beings who do not possess material form are supported by what?

original: de gnyis phan tshun du'o //
analyzed: de gnyis phan tshun du'o //
translated: They are supported by each other.

original: 'o na ni gzugs can rnams kyi yang de gnyis kho na phan tshun du ci'i phyir mi brten /
analyzed: 'o na ni gzugs can rnams kyi yang de gnyis kho na phan tshun du ci'i phyir mi brten /
translated: If that is so, then why do sentient beings who possess material form not support each other?

original: de gnyis stobs chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis stobs chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those two are weak.

original: de ni ci'i phyir stobs dang ldan pa nyid yin /
analyzed: de ni ci'i phyir stobs dang ldan pa nyid yin /
translated: Why are they weak?

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par las skyes pa'i phyir ro //🔽mdo sde pa rnams na re de ni sems kyi rgyud dam /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par las skyes pa'i phyir ro // mdo sde pa rnams na re de ni sems kyi rgyud dam /
translated: Because they arise from the special meditative development of equipoise.🔽The Sautrantikas say: The homogeneous character and the vitality faculty of sentient beings who do not possess material form are supported by the mind-stream.🔽The mind is supported by the mind itself, and the mind and mental factors are supported by the vitality faculty.

original: sems kyang sems las byung bdag la yang mtshungs te de lta bas na sems can gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kyi sems kyi rten gzhan ni med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sems kyang sems las byung bdag la yang mtshungs te de lta bas na sems can gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kyi sems kyi rten gzhan ni med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, sentient beings who do not possess material form have no other support for the mind.

original: gzhan yang sems kyi rgyun gang gi 'phen pa'i rgyu gzugs la sred pa dang ma bral ba de ni gzugs dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems kyi rgyun gang gi 'phen pa'i rgyu gzugs la sred pa dang ma bral ba de ni gzugs dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, the stream of mind that is not free from craving for form is projected by a cause that is associated with form.

original: gzugs la brten nas 'jug go //
analyzed: gzugs la brten nas 'jug go //
translated: It is said to occur in dependence on form.

original: gang gi rgyu gzugs la sred pa dang bral ba de ni gzugs la mi ltos par 'jug ste /
analyzed: gang gi rgyu gzugs la sred pa dang bral ba de ni gzugs la mi ltos par 'jug ste /
translated: The stream of mind that is free from craving for form is not dependent on form.

original: rgyu de la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu de la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said to occur in opposition to that cause.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'di dag 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams rnams zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'di dag 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams rnams zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are these called the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir na khams so //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir na khams so //
translated: They are called realms because they hold their own characteristics.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i khams ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i khams ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: The desire realm is the realm that is associated with desire.

original: gzugs dang ldan pa'i khams ni gzugs kyi khams so //
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa'i khams ni gzugs kyi khams so //
translated: The form realm is the realm that is associated with form.

original: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: 'jig rten sna tshogs gang de 'dod min gyi //

original: gal te 'jig rten sna tshogs gang de 'dod //

translated: “If the variety of the world is desire,

analyzed: zhes smras so //

original: smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /

analyzed: gang dag la 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dag rgyas par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is that in regard to which the attachment of the realm of desire, the attachment of the realm of fine-materiality, and the attachment of the realm of immateriality can become active.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags de dag kyang gang yin zhe na ;
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags de dag kyang gang yin zhe na ;
translated: What are the attachment of the realm of desire, etc.?

original: gang dag 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu rgyas par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu rgyas par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They are the attachments that can become active in the realms of desire, of fine-materiality, and of immateriality.

original: da ni 'di rta dang bres lta bu de yin te /

analyzed: rta 'di su'i yin pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: one is told that it belongs to the horse.

original: rta 'di su'i yin zhes smras na /
analyzed: rta 'di su'i yin zhes smras na /
translated: If one asks whose is the horse,🔽one is told that it belongs to the owner of the equipment.

original: rta'i bres 'di su'i yin @110b pa'o zhes zer bas gnyi ga yang mi shes pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: rta'i bres 'di su'i yin @110b pa'o zhes zer bas gnyi ga yang mi shes pa lta bu yin no //
translated: Thus neither answer is satisfactory.

original: 'di ni rta dang bres lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rta dang bres lta bu ma yin te /
translated: The example of the horse and its equipment is not appropriate.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su gnas brten pa de dag la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags yin la de gang du rgyas par 'gyur ba'i chos de yang 'dod pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su gnas brten pa de dag la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags yin la de gang du rgyas par 'gyur ba'i chos de yang 'dod pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The attachment of those who are not detached from the realm of desire is attachment to the realm of desire. The factors which increase this attachment are also associated with the realm of desire.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dang / 'og ma'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dag kyang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dang / 'og ma'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dag kyang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand attachment to the realm of fine-materiality and attachment to the realm of immateriality, as well as the attachment to the lower stages, in their proper order.

original: yang na mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i 'dod chags ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: yang na mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i 'dod chags ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags so //
translated: Or else, attachment to the realm of desire is attachment to the stage of ordinary persons.

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dag la 'dod chags pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dag la 'dod chags pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags so //
translated: Attachment to the realm of fine-materiality and attachment to the realm of immateriality are attachment to the meditations and the formless meditative attainments.

original: sprul pa'i sems la ji ltar 'dod pa'i 'dod chags pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems la ji ltar 'dod pa'i 'dod chags pa yin zhe na /
translated: How can there be attachment to the realm of desire in the thought of emanation?

original: thos pa dang yongs su nyams nas de la chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa dang yongs su nyams nas de la chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is attached to the enjoyment of the object-field of the realm of desire, or because one is attached to the enjoyment of the meditative attainment of enjoyment.

original: yang na sprul pa'i dbang gis sprul pa byed pa'i sems la yang 'dod chags so ;
analyzed: yang na sprul pa'i dbang gis sprul pa byed pa'i sems la yang 'dod chags so ;
translated: Or else, because of the power of emanation, there is attachment to the thought of emanation.

original: / yang na dri dang ro sprul pa'i phyir na de 'dod pa na spyod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: / yang na dri dang ro sprul pa'i phyir na de 'dod pa na spyod pa nyid yin te /
translated: Or else, because they emit odors and tastes, they belong to the realm of desire.

original: gzugs na spyod pas ni de gnyis mi sprul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pas ni de gnyis mi sprul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Beings in the realm of form do not emit odors and tastes.

original: yang ci khams gsum gcig kho na zhig yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci khams gsum gcig kho na zhig yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are the three realms only one single place?

original: khams gsum rnams la mtha' med de //
analyzed: khams gsum rnams la mtha' med de //
translated: The three realms are infinite,🔽like space.

original: nam mkha' ji tsam pa 'jig rten gyi khams dag kyang de tsam mo //
analyzed: nam mkha' ji tsam pa 'jig rten gyi khams dag kyang de tsam mo //
translated: The world-realms are as vast as space.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sngon med pa'i sems can 'byung ba yang med la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sngon med pa'i sems can 'byung ba yang med la /
translated: Consequently, there is no arising of sentient beings without a cause,

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba re res sems can grangs med pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang sems can rnams yongs su gtugs pa med de nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba re res sems can grangs med pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang sems can rnams yongs su gtugs pa med de nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: and sentient beings are not exhausted, even though each Buddha saves innumerable sentient beings, just as space is not exhausted even though innumerable urns are produced and destroyed.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rnams ji ltar gnas she na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rnams ji ltar gnas she na /
translated: How are the world-realms arranged?

original: thad kar gnas te /
analyzed: thad kar gnas te /
translated: They are arranged in a straight line.🔽The Sūtra says:

original: mdo las dper na char gyi rgyun gnya' shing tsam 'bab pa na bar snang las chu'i rgyun 'bab pa rnams kyi mtshams sam bar med do //
analyzed: mdo las dper na char gyi rgyun gnya' shing tsam 'bab pa na bar snang las chu'i rgyun 'bab pa rnams kyi mtshams sam bar med do //
translated: Just as, when a rain falls in great torrents, there is no interval or discontinuity in the stream of water that falls from the sky, so too, with regard to the ten directions, there is no interval or discontinuity in the world-realms.

original: de bzhin du shar phyogs su 'jig rten gyi khams 'chags pa dang 'jig pa rnams kyi mtshams sam bar med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du shar phyogs su 'jig rten gyi khams 'chags pa dang 'jig pa rnams kyi mtshams sam bar med do //
translated: In the same way, there is no interval or limit between the world systems of the east that are in the process of creation and dissolution.🔽Just as in the east, so it is in the south, west and north.

original: shar phyogs su ji lta bar lho dang nub dang byang gi bar du yang de dang 'dra'o zhes gsungs kyi steng dang 'og ces ni ma gsungs so //🔽gzhan dag na re sde pa gzhan dag las byung ba'i phyir steng dang 'og dag na yang yod de /🔽'og min gyi gong na yang 'dod @111a * //🔽pa'i khams yod la /
analyzed: shar phyogs su ji lta bar lho dang nub dang byang gi bar du yang de dang 'dra'o zhes gsungs kyi steng dang 'og ces ni ma gsungs so // gzhan dag na re sde pa gzhan dag las byung ba'i phyir steng dang 'og dag na yang yod de / 'og min gyi gong na yang 'dod @111a * // pa'i khams yod la /
translated: But the sūtra does not say above or below.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'og na yang 'og min yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'og na yang 'og min yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the desire realm exists above Akaniṣṭha and Akaniṣṭha exists below the desire realm, because this is stated in other schools.

original: gang 'dod pa'i khams gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni thams cad las 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa'i khams gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni thams cad las 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no //
translated: But if one is free from attachment to one desire realm, one is free from attachment to all desire realms.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dag las kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dag las kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies to the form and formless realms.

original: gang zhig bsam gtan dang po la brten pa'i rdzu 'phrul skyed par byed pa de ni des 'jig rten gyi khams gang du skyes pa nas skyed par byed pa de kho na na yod pa'i tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du 'gro'i gzhan du ni ma yin no
analyzed: gang zhig bsam gtan dang po la brten pa'i rdzu 'phrul skyed par byed pa de ni des 'jig rten gyi khams gang du skyes pa nas skyed par byed pa de kho na na yod pa'i tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du 'gro'i gzhan du ni ma yin no
translated: One who generates supernormal knowledge based on the first absorption goes to the Brahma world of that realm in which he was born and generates it, but not elsewhere.

original: // khams gsum po dag bshad pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: // khams gsum po dag bshad pa gang yin pa //
translated: The three realms have been explained.

original: der ni dmyal sogs 'gro ba lnga //
analyzed: der ni dmyal sogs 'gro ba lnga //
translated: There, the five types of migration are hell beings, ghosts, animals,🔽gods, and humans.

original: rang gi ming gis bstan /
analyzed: rang gi ming gis bstan /
translated: They are taught by their own names.

original: de dag tu dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / lha dang mi zhes bya ba 'gro ba lnga po rang gi ming dag kho nas bstan te /
analyzed: de dag tu dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / lha dang mi zhes bya ba 'gro ba lnga po rang gi ming dag kho nas bstan te /
translated: In those realms, the five types of migration are hell beings, ghosts, animals, gods, and humans. They are taught by their own names.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na ni 'gro ba bzhi dang lnga pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na ni 'gro ba bzhi dang lnga pa'i phyogs so //
translated: In the desire realm, there are four types of migration and part of the fifth.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na ni lha'i 'gro ba gcig kho na'i phyogs so //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na ni lha'i 'gro ba gcig kho na'i phyogs so //
translated: In the form and formless realms, there is part of the fifth, the god migration.

original: gang gis na /
analyzed: gang gis na /
translated: By what are they distinguished?

original: de dag khams dag tu zhes bya ba ci 'gro ba las ma gtogs pa'i khams dag cig yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: de dag khams dag tu zhes bya ba ci 'gro ba las ma gtogs pa'i khams dag cig yod dam zhe na /
translated: Do the realms exist apart from the destinies?🔽The realms are virtuous, afflicted, and indeterminate.

original: yod de khams rnams ni dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / snod dang srid pa bar ma pa'i rang bzhin dag kyang yin gyi 'gro ba lnga po gang dag yin pa /
analyzed: yod de khams rnams ni dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / snod dang srid pa bar ma pa'i rang bzhin dag kyang yin gyi 'gro ba lnga po gang dag yin pa /
translated: The realms are also the nature of the intermediate existence, but the five destinies are not.

original: de dag nyon mongs can min lung bstan min //
analyzed: de dag nyon mongs can min lung bstan min //
translated: The destinies are not afflicted or indeterminate.

original: sems can zhes bya bar srid min //
analyzed: sems can zhes bya bar srid min //
translated: They are not called sentient beings.

original: 'gro ba rnams ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na'o //
translated: The destinies are only unobscured-indeterminate.

original: de lta ma yin na 'gro ba lnga 'chol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'gro ba lnga 'chol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, the five destinies would be confused.

original: sems can zhes bya ba kho na yin yang srid pa bar ma'i rang bzhin dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ba kho na yin yang srid pa bar ma'i rang bzhin dag ni ma yin no //
translated: Although they are called sentient beings, they are not the nature of intermediate existence.

original: btags pa las kyang /
analyzed: btags pa las kyang /
translated: The Lakṣaṇatīkā says:

original: skye gnas bzhis ni 'gro ba lnga bsdus kyi 'gro ba lngas ni skye gnas bzhi ma bsdus te /
analyzed: skye gnas bzhis ni 'gro ba lnga bsdus kyi 'gro ba lngas ni skye gnas bzhi ma bsdus te /
translated: The four birth processes include the five destinies, but the five destinies do not include the four birth processes.

original: gang zhig ma bsdus she na /
analyzed: gang zhig ma bsdus she na /
translated: What is not included?

original: srid pa bar ma'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Intermediate existence.

original: chos kyi phung po las kyang mig gi khams gang zhe na /🔽'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang ba gang yin pa dmyal ba 'am dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa dang yi dvags pa'i yul pa'am /
analyzed: chos kyi phung po las kyang mig gi khams gang zhe na / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang ba gang yin pa dmyal ba 'am dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa dang yi dvags pa'i yul pa'am /
translated: What is the eye element?

original: lha 'am mi 'am /
analyzed: lha 'am mi 'am /
translated: It is the clear form derived from the four great elements that is the eye, the eye sense faculty, the eye base, and the eye element of hell beings, animals, ghosts, gods, humans,

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba'am /🔽srid pa bar ma pa'i mig dang / mig gi dbang po dang / mig gi skye mched @111b dang ; mig gi khams so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba'am / srid pa bar ma pa'i mig dang / mig gi dbang po dang / mig gi skye mched @111b dang ; mig gi khams so zhes gsungs so //
translated: those arisen from meditation,🔽and intermediate beings.

original: mdo las kyang srid pa bar ma 'gro ba rnams las logs shig tu mdzad do //
analyzed: mdo las kyang srid pa bar ma 'gro ba rnams las logs shig tu mdzad do //
translated: Also, in the sutras, intermediate beings are considered to be a separate type of migrating being.🔽From which sutra?🔽The sutra states:

original: mdo gang las she na srid pa ni bdun te /
analyzed: mdo gang las she na srid pa ni bdun te /
translated: There are seven existences:

original: dmyal ba'i srid pa dang / dud 'gro'i srid pa dang / yi dvags kyi srid pa dang / lha'i srid pa dang / mi'i srid pa dang ; las kyi srid pa dang / srid pa bar ma'o zhes gsungs pa las te /
analyzed: dmyal ba'i srid pa dang / dud 'gro'i srid pa dang / yi dvags kyi srid pa dang / lha'i srid pa dang / mi'i srid pa dang ; las kyi srid pa dang / srid pa bar ma'o zhes gsungs pa las te /
translated: the existence of hell beings, the existence of animals, the existence of ghosts, the existence of gods, the existence of humans, the existence of karma, and the intermediate existence.

original: 'dir ni 'gro ba lnga po rgyu dang bcas pa dang 'gro ba dang bcas par bshad do //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'gro ba lnga po rgyu dang bcas pa dang 'gro ba dang bcas par bshad do //
translated: Here, the five destinies are explained as being the cause and the result of the destinies.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan par 'grub ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan par 'grub ste /
translated: Therefore, it is established that they are unobscured-non-defined.

original: de'i rgyu las de dag las logs shig tu mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu las de dag las logs shig tu mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are made separate from the cause of that.🔽The Kasmiri Vaibhasikas also say: The elder Sariputra said to the venerable one:

original: kha che ba rnams kyang gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa dmyal ba pa'i zag pa rnams mngon du gyur pa las dmyal ba myong bar 'gyur pa'i las rnams byed cing sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha che ba rnams kyang gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa dmyal ba pa'i zag pa rnams mngon du gyur pa las dmyal ba myong bar 'gyur pa'i las rnams byed cing sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The defilements of the hells manifest and you create and accumulate karma to be experienced in the hells.🔽The aggregates of form, feeling, discrimination, formation and consciousness of the body, speech and mind of the venerable one and the body, speech and mind of the venerable one are corrupt and degenerate.

original: tshe dang ldan pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi dkyil 'khor dang / lus dang ngag dang yid skyon dang / snyigs ma de dag gi rnam par smin pa gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni dmyal ba dag tu rnam par smin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi dkyil 'khor dang / lus dang ngag dang yid skyon dang / snyigs ma de dag gi rnam par smin pa gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni dmyal ba dag tu rnam par smin par 'gyur te /
translated: The maturation of those is the maturation of form, feeling, discrimination, formation and consciousness in the hells.

original: rnam par smin par grub nas dmyal bzhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin par grub nas dmyal bzhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
translated: and once it has matured, it is counted as a hell being.

original: tshe dang ldan pa de la chos de dag ma gtogs pa dmyal ba mi dmigs so zhes gsungs so zhes mdo 'don te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa de la chos de dag ma gtogs pa dmyal ba mi dmigs so zhes gsungs so zhes mdo 'don te /
translated: Venerable One, apart from those phenomena, I do not apprehend a hell being.

original: de'i phyir yang 'gro ba dag ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang 'gro ba dag ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, reincarnating beings are only unobscured neutral states.🔽But the Prajñapti states:

original: 'o na ni rab tu byed pa'i gzhung 'gro ba dag la phra rgyas thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i lan gdab par bya dgos so zhe na ;
analyzed: 'o na ni rab tu byed pa'i gzhung 'gro ba dag la phra rgyas thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i lan gdab par bya dgos so zhe na ;
translated: All negative tendencies increase in reincarnating beings.

original: 'gro ba rnams su nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i sems rnam pa lnga yod de /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams su nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i sems rnam pa lnga yod de /
translated: The five minds that link one to reincarnating beings exist.

original: de'i phyir 'jug pa dang bcas pa'i 'gro ba smos pas de ni nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jug pa dang bcas pa'i 'gro ba smos pas de ni nyes pa med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no error in stating that reincarnating beings possess entry because entry refers to the five minds that link one to reincarnating beings.

original: grong smos na grong gi nye 'khor yang smos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: grong smos na grong gi nye 'khor yang smos pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like stating that when a village is mentioned, its outskirts are also mentioned.

original: gzhan dag na re dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dag kyang yod do //
translated: Others say: There are also virtuous and afflicted minds.

original: las de dag las logs shig tu mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhes gang bshad pa ni tha dad du gsungs pa'i phyir logs shig tu mdzad pa yin par nges pa med de /
analyzed: las de dag las logs shig tu mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhes gang bshad pa ni tha dad du gsungs pa'i phyir logs shig tu mdzad pa yin par nges pa med de /
translated: Because they are stated separately, they are definitely not stated separately in order to make them distinct from karma.

original: dper na snyigs ma lnga po dag tu nyon mongs pa dang lta ba'i snyigs ma dag tha dad du gsungs kyang lta ba rnams nyon mongs pa dag ma yin pa yang @112a * //
analyzed: dper na snyigs ma lnga po dag tu nyon mongs pa dang lta ba'i snyigs ma dag tha dad du gsungs kyang lta ba rnams nyon mongs pa dag ma yin pa yang @112a * //
translated: For example, the afflictions and views are stated separately as the defilements of affliction and view among the five degenerations, but views are not distinct from the afflictions.

original: ma yin pa de bzhin du las kyi srid pa yang yin 'gro ba yang yin 'gro ba'i rgyu shes par bya ba'i phyir 'di tha dad du bstan pa yang yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ma yin pa de bzhin du las kyi srid pa yang yin 'gro ba yang yin 'gro ba'i rgyu shes par bya ba'i phyir 'di tha dad du bstan pa yang yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Similarly, karmic existence is also existence and is also stated separately in order to understand the cause of reincarnating beings.

original: 'di ni srid pa bar ma yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni srid pa bar ma yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But it would follow that the intermediate existence would also be a reincarnating being.

original: mi rung ba'i phyir ma yin te /🔽der 'gro bas na 'gro ba yin na srid pa bar ma ni 'gro bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rung ba'i phyir ma yin te / der 'gro bas na 'gro ba yin na srid pa bar ma ni 'gro bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not said that it is not a reincarnating being because it is not suitable.

original: 'chi 'pho ba'i yul nyid du skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba'i yul nyid du skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is a reincarnating being because it goes there, then the intermediate existence is not a reincarnating being because it is born in the very place where it dies.

original: gzugs med pa rnams kyang 'gro ba ma yin par 'gyur te 'chi 'pho ba'i yul nyid du skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams kyang 'gro ba ma yin par 'gyur te 'chi 'pho ba'i yul nyid du skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, the formless realm would not be a destination because one is born in the very place where one dies.

original: de lta na 'o na ni srid pa bar ma yin pa kho na'i phyir srid pa bar ma 'gro ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni srid pa bar ma yin pa kho na'i phyir srid pa bar ma 'gro ba ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, then an intermediate existence would not be a destination because it is an intermediate existence.

original: 'gro ba'i bar ma do yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bar ma do yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is an intermediate state between destinations.

original: gal te 'gro ba yin par gyur na ni srid pa bar ma zhes bya ba nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba yin par gyur na ni srid pa bar ma zhes bya ba nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were a destination, it would not be called an intermediate existence.

original: 'o na gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus rnam par smin pa grub nas dmyal ba zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes gang bshad pa ji ltar drang /
analyzed: 'o na gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus rnam par smin pa grub nas dmyal ba zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes gang bshad pa ji ltar drang /
translated: But how do you interpret the statement by the elder Śāriputra: “When the karmic maturation is established, it is counted as a hell being”?

original: rnam par smin pa grub nas zhes bshad kyi rnam par smin pa kho na'o zhes ni ma bshad pa ji ltar /
