analyzed: rnam par smin pa grub nas zhes bshad kyi rnam par smin pa kho na'o zhes ni ma bshad pa ji ltar /
translated: He said “when the karmic maturation is established,” but he did not say “it is only the karmic maturation.”

original: 'o na tshe dang ldan pa de la chos de dag ma gtogs pa dmyal ba mi dmigs so zhes gang bshad pa ji ltar drang /
analyzed: 'o na tshe dang ldan pa de la chos de dag ma gtogs pa dmyal ba mi dmigs so zhes gang bshad pa ji ltar drang /
translated: But how do you interpret the statement by the elder Ānanda: “Venerable One, apart from those phenomena, I do not observe a hell being”?

original: phung po dag las gzhan pa dmyal ba mi dmigs so zhes 'gro bar 'gro ba'i gang zag gi rdzas 'gog par byed pa yin gyi phung po gzhan 'gog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po dag las gzhan pa dmyal ba mi dmigs so zhes 'gro bar 'gro ba'i gang zag gi rdzas 'gog par byed pa yin gyi phung po gzhan 'gog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the person who goes to the plane of existence is not perceived as being other than the aggregates.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re 'gro ba rnams ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re 'gro ba rnams ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say that the planes of existence are morally neutral, not being either wholesome or unwholesome.

original: de dag kyang kha cig na re rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin dag kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang kha cig na re rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin dag kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that they are only of the nature of retribution.

original: gzhan dag na re rgyas pa las byung ba'i rang bzhin dag kyang yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rgyas pa las byung ba'i rang bzhin dag kyang yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that they are also of the nature of development.

original: 'gro ba lnga pa'i khams gsum pa 'di nyid du /
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga pa'i khams gsum pa 'di nyid du /
translated: These planes of existence are in the three realms of existence.🔽The seven abodes of consciousness should be understood in order, as follows:🔽1. those who differ in body and in ideation;🔽2. those who differ in body but are the same in ideation;

original: lus dang 'du shes tha dad dang / lus tha dad cing 'du shes gcig / bzlog dang lus dang 'du shes gcig / gzugs can ma yin gsum po dag / rnam shes gnas pa bdun rim bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang 'du shes tha dad dang / lus tha dad cing 'du shes gcig / bzlog dang lus dang 'du shes gcig / gzugs can ma yin gsum po dag / rnam shes gnas pa bdun rim bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: 3. those who are the same in body but differ in ideation;🔽4. those who are the same in body and the same in ideation;🔽5. those who are not the same in body but are the same in ideation;🔽6. those who are the same in body but not the same in ideation;🔽7. those who are not the same in body and are not the same in ideation.

original: mdo las sems can gzugs can lus tha dad cing 'du shes tha dad pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: mdo las sems can gzugs can lus tha dad cing 'du shes tha dad pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: The Sūtra says: There are sentient beings who have a material body and different discernments.

original: 'di la ste mi rnams dang lha kha cig go //
analyzed: 'di la ste mi rnams dang lha kha cig go //
translated: They are humans and certain gods.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas dang po'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas dang po'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: This is the first station of consciousness.

original: lha kha cig gang zhe na /
analyzed: lha kha cig gang zhe na /
translated: What gods?

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa @112b rnams dang / bsam gtan dang po pa dang por byung ba ma gtogs pa rnams so //🔽de dag gi lus tha dad pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa @112b rnams dang / bsam gtan dang po pa dang por byung ba ma gtogs pa rnams so // de dag gi lus tha dad pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Those who enjoy the pleasures of desire and those who have newly entered the first meditation, with the exception of the newly born.🔽They have different bodies,

original: de dag gi lus tha dad pa yin pas na lus tha dad pa dag ste /
analyzed: de dag gi lus tha dad pa yin pas na lus tha dad pa dag ste /
translated: or their bodies are different.

original: kha dog dang rtags dang dbyibs du ma'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog dang rtags dang dbyibs du ma'i phyir ro //
translated: They have many different colors, forms and shapes.

original: 'du shes du ma'i phyir ro //🔽'du shes du ma'i phyir 'du shes tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes du ma'i phyir ro // 'du shes du ma'i phyir 'du shes tha dad pa'o //
translated: They have many different discernments.🔽They have different discernments because they have many different discernments.

original: de 'di dag la yod pas 'du shes tha dad pa rnams te /
analyzed: de 'di dag la yod pas 'du shes tha dad pa rnams te /
translated: They have different discernments because they have many different discernments.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They have many different discernments because they have the discernment of pleasure, pain and neither pleasure nor pain.

original: sems can gzugs can lus tha dad cing 'du shes gcig pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: sems can gzugs can lus tha dad cing 'du shes gcig pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: There are sentient beings who have different bodies but the same ideation.

original: 'di lta ste tshangs ris kyi lha gang dag dang por byung ba de dag go ;
analyzed: 'di lta ste tshangs ris kyi lha gang dag dang por byung ba de dag go ;
translated: This refers to the Brahmakayika gods who arose first.

original: /'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa gnyis pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: /'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa gnyis pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: This is the second abode of consciousness.

original: dang por byung ba de dag thams cad ni 'di snyam du bdag cag ni tshangs pa 'dis phyung ngo snyam du 'du shes par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dang por byung ba de dag thams cad ni 'di snyam du bdag cag ni tshangs pa 'dis phyung ngo snyam du 'du shes par 'gyur la /
translated: All those who arose first have the ideation I was created by this Brahma.🔽And Brahma thinks I created these.

original: tshangs pa yang 'di snyam du 'di dag ni bdag gis phyung ngo snyam du sems pas 'du shes kyi rgyu ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir 'du shes gcig pa dag yin no //
analyzed: tshangs pa yang 'di snyam du 'di dag ni bdag gis phyung ngo snyam du sems pas 'du shes kyi rgyu ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir 'du shes gcig pa dag yin no //
translated: Since the movement of ideation is not different, they have the same ideation.

original: tshangs pa chen po'i chu zheng dang dbyibs kyi lus dang / tshig tu brjod pa dang / gos gyon pa yang gzhan yin la /
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po'i chu zheng dang dbyibs kyi lus dang / tshig tu brjod pa dang / gos gyon pa yang gzhan yin la /
translated: The body of Mahabrahma is different in size, shape, speech, clothing and so on from that of his retinue.

original: de'i 'khor gyi yang gzhan yin pas na lus tha dad pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'khor gyi yang gzhan yin pas na lus tha dad pa dag yin no //
translated: Since they are different, they have different bodies.

original: mdo las de dag 'di snyam du bdag cag gis sems can 'di tshe ring zhing dus ring por gnas par mthong la zhes bya ba nas sems can 'di yang sems la 'di snyam du kye ma sems can gzhan dag kyang 'dir bdag dang skral ba mnyam par skye🔽bar gyur cig snyam du smos la /
analyzed: mdo las de dag 'di snyam du bdag cag gis sems can 'di tshe ring zhing dus ring por gnas par mthong la zhes bya ba nas sems can 'di yang sems la 'di snyam du kye ma sems can gzhan dag kyang 'dir bdag dang skral ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig snyam du smos la /
translated: They think, We see that this sentient being has a long life and endures for a long time and so on up to this sentient being also thinks, Alas, may other sentient beings also be born here with me and equal me in terms of life force.

original: bdag cag kyang 'dir skyes pas zhes bya bar shes so zhes gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: bdag cag kyang 'dir skyes pas zhes bya bar shes so zhes gang gsungs pa /
translated: We also think, We have been born here.

original: de dag gis de ji ltar mthong zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gis de ji ltar mthong zhe na /
translated: How do they see this?

original: kha cig na re 'od gsal la gnas pa rnams kyis te /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'od gsal la gnas pa rnams kyis te /
translated: Some say: Those abiding in luminance see this.

original: de dag ni de nas shi 'phos pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de dag ni de nas shi 'phos pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: They die and transmigrate from that level.🔽If they do not obtain meditative attainment of the second absorption, how do they recollect past lives of that level?

original: de ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ma thob na ni ji ltar na de'i sa pa'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran 'on te thob na ni ji ltar na tshangs pa chen po la dmigs pa'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta
analyzed: de ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ma thob na ni ji ltar na de'i sa pa'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran 'on te thob na ni ji ltar na tshangs pa chen po la dmigs pa'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta
translated: If they do obtain it, how do they come to possess the view that holds inferior discipline and ritual to be supreme, which focuses on Mahabrahma?

original: ba la zhen pa dag yin /
analyzed: ba la zhen pa dag yin /
translated: They are attached to the cow.

original: gzhan dag na re srid pa bar ma la gnas pa dag gis mthong ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re srid pa bar ma la gnas pa dag gis mthong ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that they are seen by those who are in the intermediate existence.

original: de na yang bgegs byed pa med pa'i phyir dus ring por gnas @113a * //
analyzed: de na yang bgegs byed pa med pa'i phyir dus ring por gnas @113a * //
translated: But since there is no obstacle there, it is impossible to remain there for a long time.

original: pa mi srid na ji ltar na de dag 'di snyam du bdag cag gis sems can 'di tshe ring zhing dus ring por gnas pa mthong ngo snyam du shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: pa mi srid na ji ltar na de dag 'di snyam du bdag cag gis sems can 'di tshe ring zhing dus ring por gnas pa mthong ngo snyam du shes par 'gyur /
translated: How can they think, “We have seen that this sentient being has a long life and remains for a long time”?

original: de lta bas na de na gnas pa de dag kho nas de'i sngon gyi tshul rjes su dran zhing de ltar dus ring por gnas pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na de na gnas pa de dag kho nas de'i sngon gyi tshul rjes su dran zhing de ltar dus ring por gnas pa mthong ngo //
translated: Thus, those who are there remember the past of that sentient being and see that he remains for a long time.

original: mthong nas kyang phyis de dag mthong ngo snyam du shes pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong nas kyang phyis de dag mthong ngo snyam du shes pa yin no //
translated: And having seen him, they think, “We have seen him later.”

original: sems can gzugs can lus gcig cing 'du shes tha dad pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: sems can gzugs can lus gcig cing 'du shes tha dad pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: There are sentient beings who have one kind of body and one kind of ideation.

original: 'di lta ste 'od gsal gyi lha rnams so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'od gsal gyi lha rnams so //
translated: They are the Ābhāsvara gods.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa gsum pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa gsum pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: This is the third station of consciousness.

original: 'dir ni mtha' smos pas bsam gtan gnyis pa mtha' dag smos par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni mtha' smos pas bsam gtan gnyis pa mtha' dag smos par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, since the end is mentioned, it should be understood that the entire second absorption is mentioned.

original: de lta ma yin na 'od chung rnams dang / tshad med 'od rnams rnam par shes pa gnas pa gang du rnam par gzhag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'od chung rnams dang / tshad med 'od rnams rnam par shes pa gnas pa gang du rnam par gzhag par 'gyur la /
translated: If that were not so, then where would the gods of Lesser Light and Limitless Light be posited as the abodes of consciousness?

original: de la kha dog dang / rtags dang / dbyibs tha mi dad pa'i phyir lus gcig pa dag go //
analyzed: de la kha dog dang / rtags dang / dbyibs tha mi dad pa'i phyir lus gcig pa dag go //
translated: They are the same in body because they are undifferentiated in color, sign and shape.

original: bde bar 'du shes pa'i phyir dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin par 'du shes pa'i phyir 'du shes tha dad pa dag ste /🔽de dag ni dngos gzhi'i sa la yid bde ba'i dbang pos yongs su skyo nas nyer bsdogs las btang snyoms kyi dbang po mngon du byed la /
analyzed: bde bar 'du shes pa'i phyir dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin par 'du shes pa'i phyir 'du shes tha dad pa dag ste / de dag ni dngos gzhi'i sa la yid bde ba'i dbang pos yongs su skyo nas nyer bsdogs las btang snyoms kyi dbang po mngon du byed la /
translated: They are different in discernment because they have the discernment of pleasure and the discernment of neither pleasure nor pain.🔽They are different in motivation because they are motivated by the second absorption.

original: nyer bsdogs kyi btang snyoms kyi dbang po sa yongs su skyo nas ni yang dngos gzhi'i sa la yid bde ba'i dbang po mngon du byed de /
analyzed: nyer bsdogs kyi btang snyoms kyi dbang po sa yongs su skyo nas ni yang dngos gzhi'i sa la yid bde ba'i dbang po mngon du byed de /
translated: They are different in faculty because they are dominated by the faculty of pleasure and the faculty of equanimity.🔽They are different in realm because they belong to the form realm.

original: dper na dbang phyug dag 'dod pa'i dga' bas yongs su skyo nas chos kyi dga' ba nyams su myong bar byed la /
analyzed: dper na dbang phyug dag 'dod pa'i dga' bas yongs su skyo nas chos kyi dga' ba nyams su myong bar byed la /
translated: For example, it is like the case of the lord of gods who, being wearied of the delight of desire, experiences the delight of Dharma.

original: chos kyi dga' bas yongs su skyo nas ni yang 'dod pa'i dga' ba nyams su myong bar byed pa bzhin no zhes grag go //
analyzed: chos kyi dga' bas yongs su skyo nas ni yang 'dod pa'i dga' ba nyams su myong bar byed pa bzhin no zhes grag go //
translated: And, being wearied of the delight of Dharma, he experiences the delight of desire.

original: 'di dge rgyas pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dge rgyas pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn't it the case that this also applies to the gods of the Brhatphala heaven?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: de dag ni bde ba des yongs su skyo ba med do //
analyzed: de dag ni bde ba des yongs su skyo ba med do //
translated: They are not wearied by that pleasure.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bde ba ni zhi ba yin la /
analyzed: bde ba ni zhi ba yin la /
translated: Because pleasure is peace,

original: yid bde ba ni sems g-yo bar byed pa yin pas ma zhi ba yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: yid bde ba ni sems g-yo bar byed pa yin pas ma zhi ba yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: and mental satisfaction is not peace because it agitates the mind.

original: mdo sde pa rnams ni mdo las 'od gsal ba'i lha'i ris de na sems can gang dag skyes nas ring po ma lon pa 'jig rten 'di 'jig pa la mi mkhas shing 'chags pa la mi mkhas pa de dag me lce de mthong nas me lce de tshangs
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams ni mdo las 'od gsal ba'i lha'i ris de na sems can gang dag skyes nas ring po ma lon pa 'jig rten 'di 'jig pa la mi mkhas shing 'chags pa la mi mkhas pa de dag me lce de mthong nas me lce de tshangs
translated: The Sautrantikas say: In the Abhidharma it says that in the heaven of clear light, when the beings there see that flame, those who have been born there a long time are skilled in the destruction and evolution of the world. Those who have not been born there a long time are unskilled in the destruction and evolution of the world. Those who are skilled in the destruction and evolution of the world think:

original: pa'i gzhal med khang stong pa bsregs nas 'dir 'ong @113b bar 'gyur na mi rung ngo zhes skra gnas yi chad cing skyo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i gzhal med khang stong pa bsregs nas 'dir 'ong @113b bar 'gyur na mi rung ngo zhes skra gnas yi chad cing skyo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not suitable for them to come here after burning the empty celestial palaces of the Brahmas.🔽The beings who have been born in the Abhasvara class of gods for a long time, who are skilled in the destruction of this world and skilled in the formation of the world, they comfort those frightened beings, saying, Friends, do not be afraid!

original: 'od gsal ba'i lha'i ris de na sems can gang dag skyes nas ring du lon pa 'jig rten 'di 'jig pa la mkhas shing 'chags pa las mkhas pa la de dag sems can skrag pa de dag la grogs po dag ma 'jigs shig / grogs po dag ma
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i lha'i ris de na sems can gang dag skyes nas ring du lon pa 'jig rten 'di 'jig pa la mkhas shing 'chags pa las mkhas pa la de dag sems can skrag pa de dag la grogs po dag ma 'jigs shig / grogs po dag ma
translated: Friends, do not be afraid!🔽This fire of the end of the eon previously burned the empty celestial palaces of the Brahmas and disappeared there.

original: 'jigs shig / mi lce 'di ni sngon yang tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang stong pa bsregs nas de nyid du med par gyur to zhes dbugs 'byin par byed do zhes de dag ji ltar 'du shes tha dad pa dag yin par bshad de /
analyzed: 'jigs shig / mi lce 'di ni sngon yang tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang stong pa bsregs nas de nyid du med par gyur to zhes dbugs 'byin par byed do zhes de dag ji ltar 'du shes tha dad pa dag yin par bshad de /
translated: How are they explained to have different perceptions?

original: de lta bas na de dag me lce 'ong ba dang med par 'du shes pa'i phyir dang / skrag pa dang mi skrag par 'du shes pa'i phyir 'du shes tha dad pa dag yin gyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin par 'du shes pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag me lce 'ong ba dang med par 'du shes pa'i phyir dang / skrag pa dang mi skrag par 'du shes pa'i phyir 'du shes tha dad pa dag yin gyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin par 'du shes pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes 'chad do //
translated: Thus, they are said to have different ideations because they have the ideation of the approach and absence of flames, and the ideation of fear and absence of fear, but not because they have the ideation of pleasure, pain, or neither pleasure nor pain.

original: sems can gzugs can lus gcig 'du shes gcig pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: sems can gzugs can lus gcig 'du shes gcig pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: There are sentient beings with physical bodies and a single ideation.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: dge rgyas kyi lha rnams so //
analyzed: dge rgyas kyi lha rnams so //
translated: the gods of the Ābhāsvara class.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: This is the fourth realm of sentient beings.

original: 'du shes gcig pa dag ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'du shes gcig pa dag ces bya ba ni /
translated: They have a single ideation means

original: bde bar 'du shes pa dag go //
analyzed: bde bar 'du shes pa dag go //
translated: they have the ideation of pleasure.

original: de la bsam gtan dang po na ni nyon mongs pa can gyi 'du shes su 'du shes gcig pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po na ni nyon mongs pa can gyi 'du shes su 'du shes gcig pa dag yin no //
translated: In the first meditative absorption, they have a single ideation because they have afflicted ideation.

original: gnyis pa na ni dge ba'i 'du shes su 'du shes tha dad pa dag yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa na ni dge ba'i 'du shes su 'du shes tha dad pa dag yin no //
translated: In the second meditative absorption, they have different ideations because they have virtuous ideations.

original: gsum pa na ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i 'du shes su 'du shes gcig pa dag yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa na ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i 'du shes su 'du shes gcig pa dag yin no //
translated: On the third, they are of the same ideation, ideation of the ripened effect.

original: gzugs med pa gsum po ni mdo las ji skad 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa gsum po ni mdo las ji skad 'byung ba ste /
translated: The three formless meditative attainments are as described in the sutra.

original: de ltar na de dag gi ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag gi ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun yin no //
translated: Thus there are seven abodes of consciousness.

original: 'di la rnam par shes pa gnas pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la rnam par shes pa gnas pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the abode of consciousness?

original: ci rigs par de dag dang ldan pa'i phung po lnga dang bzhi yin no //
analyzed: ci rigs par de dag dang ldan pa'i phung po lnga dang bzhi yin no //
translated: It is the five aggregates or four aggregates, as is appropriate, that are associated with the abode of consciousness.

original: ci'i phyir lhag ma rnam par shes pa gnas pa ma yin zhe na /🔽'di ltar / lhag ma de 'joms byed ldan /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lhag ma rnam par shes pa gnas pa ma yin zhe na / 'di ltar / lhag ma de 'joms byed ldan /
translated: Why are the other realms not abodes of consciousness?🔽The other realms are not abodes of consciousness because they are destroyed by the destruction of the abode of consciousness.

original: lhag ma gnag zhig ce na /
analyzed: lhag ma gnag zhig ce na /
translated: What are the other realms?

original: ngan 'gro rnams dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'o //
analyzed: ngan 'gro rnams dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'o //
translated: The unfortunate realms, the fourth meditation, and the peak of cyclic existence.

original: 'di dag na rnam par shes pa 'joms par byed pa dag yod pas de'i phyir 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag na rnam par shes pa 'joms par byed pa dag yod pas de'i phyir 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the destruction of the abode of consciousness occurs in these realms, they are not abodes of consciousness.

original: 'joms par byed pa zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'joms par byed pa zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: What is the destruction of the abode of consciousness?

original: gang gis rnam par shes pa 'joms par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis rnam par shes pa 'joms par byed pa ste /
translated: It is the state that destroys consciousness.

original: de la ngan song @114a * //
analyzed: de la ngan song @114a * //
translated: In the unfortunate destinies,

original: dag na ni 'joms par byed pa sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba yin te /
analyzed: dag na ni 'joms par byed pa sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba yin te /
translated: painful feeling is the state that destroys consciousness,

original: gnod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the harm-doer.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa na ni 'du shes med pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa na ni 'du shes med pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
translated: In the fourth meditation, it is the attainment of non-perception and the attainment of the non-perceptual meditative attainment.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo na ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo na ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yin te /
translated: In the summit of existence, it is the attainment of cessation,

original: sems kyi rgyun gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it severs the stream of consciousness.

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: gang du 'di na gnas pa rnams na 'gro bar 'dod la /
analyzed: gang du 'di na gnas pa rnams na 'gro bar 'dod la /
translated: Where those who abide here desire to go,

original: de na gnas pa rnams ni bskyod par mi 'dod pa de rnam par shes pa gnas par bshad na /
analyzed: de na gnas pa rnams ni bskyod par mi 'dod pa de rnam par shes pa gnas par bshad na /
translated: and those who abide there do not desire to be moved, that is explained as a realm of consciousness.

original: ngan song dag na ni gnyi ga med do //
analyzed: ngan song dag na ni gnyi ga med do //
translated: In the unfortunate destinies, neither of these exist.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa na ni sems can rnams bskyod pa'i yid dang ldan pa dag yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa na ni sems can rnams bskyod pa'i yid dang ldan pa dag yin te /
translated: In the fourth meditation, sentient beings have minds that desire to be moved,

original: so so'i skye bo rnams ni 'du shes med par 'jug 'dod la /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams ni 'du shes med par 'jug 'dod la /
translated: because ordinary beings desire to enter the attainment of non-perception.

original: 'phags pa rnams ni gnas gtsang mar ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni gnas gtsang mar ro //
translated: The noble ones are in the Pure Abodes.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo ni rgyu ba mi gsal ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo ni rgyu ba mi gsal ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: The summit of cyclic existence is not a station of consciousness because the movement of consciousness there is unclear.🔽The seven stations of consciousness that have been explained,

original: rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun po ji skad bshad pa de dag dang / srid rtse dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun po ji skad bshad pa de dag dang / srid rtse dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams //
translated: the summit of cyclic existence, and the sentient beings who are nonpercipient

original: sems can gyi ni gnas dgur bshad //
analyzed: sems can gyi ni gnas dgur bshad //
translated: are explained as the nine stations of sentient beings.

original: 'di dag tu sems can rnams rang dgas kun tu gnas so //
analyzed: 'di dag tu sems can rnams rang dgas kun tu gnas so //
translated: Sentient beings dwell there spontaneously.

original: mi 'dod bzhin gnas phyir gzhan min //
analyzed: mi 'dod bzhin gnas phyir gzhan min //
translated: They are not other, because one dwells there unwillingly.

original: gzhan gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: ngan song rnams te /
analyzed: ngan song rnams te /
translated: The unfortunate realms.

original: de dag tu sems can rnams mi 'dod bzhin du las kyi srin po dag gis kun tu gnas su 'jug gi dga' ste gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag tu sems can rnams mi 'dod bzhin du las kyi srin po dag gis kun tu gnas su 'jug gi dga' ste gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Sentient beings are forced to dwell there unwillingly by the rākṣasas of karma. They do not dwell there willingly.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni sems can rnams kyi gnas pa ma yin te btson ra bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni sems can rnams kyi gnas pa ma yin te btson ra bzhin no //
translated: Therefore they are not stations of sentient beings, like a prison.

original: mdo gzhan las ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: mdo gzhan las ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun zhes gsungs so ;
translated: Other sūtras state that there are seven stations of consciousness.

original: / gzhan las ni gnas pa dag ni yang bzhi ste /🔽zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: / gzhan las ni gnas pa dag ni yang bzhi ste / zhes gsungs pa /
translated: There are four other abodes of consciousness.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: rnam par shes pa gnas pa gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba dang / tshor bar yang nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'du shes su nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'du byed du nye bar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas pa gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba dang / tshor bar yang nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'du shes su nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'du byed du nye bar 'gro ba'o //
translated: The abode of consciousness that is directed to form, the abode of consciousness that is directed to feeling, the abode of consciousness that is directed to perception, and the abode of consciousness that is directed to volitional formations.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin ci zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin ci zhe na /
translated: What is their intrinsic nature?

original: de dag ni go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag ni go rims bzhin du /
translated: They are, in order,

original: zag dang bcas pa'i phung po bzhi //
analyzed: zag dang bcas pa'i phung po bzhi //
translated: the four impure aggregates.

original: de dag kyang rang gi sa pa nyid /
analyzed: de dag kyang rang gi sa pa nyid /
translated: They are of the same level as the consciousness that is their basis.

original: sa gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sa gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not of another level.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gnas pa ni brten pa yin na /
analyzed: gnas pa ni brten pa yin na /
translated: An abode is a support.

original: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i sa pa'i phung po dag la ni rnam par shes pa sred pa'i dbang gis mi @114b brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i sa pa'i phung po dag la ni rnam par shes pa sred pa'i dbang gis mi @114b brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Consciousness does not adhere to the aggregates of another level through the power of craving.

original: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa la rnam par shes pa gnas pa zhes mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa la rnam par shes pa gnas pa zhes mi bya zhe na /
translated: Why is consciousness not called the abode of consciousness?

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re gnas pa po yongs su spangs nas gnas pa zhes bya ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re gnas pa po yongs su spangs nas gnas pa zhes bya ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: Because there is no abiding without an abiding being.

original: gnas pa po nyid la ni gnas pa zhes mi bya ste /
analyzed: gnas pa po nyid la ni gnas pa zhes mi bya ste /
translated: Abiding is not called abiding in the abiding being itself.

original: dper na rgyal po nyid rgyal po'i bstan ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rgyal po nyid rgyal po'i bstan ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a king is not called the subject of a king.

original: yang na chos gang dag la rnam par shes pa gnas nas gru dang mnyen pa'i tshul du 'gro bar byed pa'i chos de dag rnam par shes pa gnas pa dag ces bshad na /
analyzed: yang na chos gang dag la rnam par shes pa gnas nas gru dang mnyen pa'i tshul du 'gro bar byed pa'i chos de dag rnam par shes pa gnas pa dag ces bshad na /
translated: Or, if it is explained that those phenomena in which consciousness is said to abide are the abodes of consciousness because consciousness moves in the manner of a boat and its rudder,

original: rnam par shes pa nyid rnam par shes pa la gnas nas 'gro bar byed pa ni ma yin pas de'i phyir ma bshad do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid rnam par shes pa la gnas nas 'gro bar byed pa ni ma yin pas de'i phyir ma bshad do zhes zer ro //
translated: then consciousness does not move by abiding in consciousness itself, so it is not explained.

original: 'o na mdo las /🔽rnam par shes pa'i zas la dga' ba yang yod /
analyzed: 'o na mdo las / rnam par shes pa'i zas la dga' ba yang yod /
translated: Well then, what about the sutra that states:

original: 'dod chags kyang yod do //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyang yod do //
translated: There is delight in the food of consciousness and there is attachment.

original: gang la dga' ba yod cing 'dod chags yod pa de la rnam par shes pa brten cing gnas so zhes gang gsungs pa de ni ji lta bu /
analyzed: gang la dga' ba yod cing 'dod chags yod pa de la rnam par shes pa brten cing gnas so zhes gang gsungs pa de ni ji lta bu /
translated: Where there is delight and attachment, consciousness is supported and abides.

original: rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun phung po lnga'i rang bzhin dag yin no zhes bya ba de yang ji lta bu /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun phung po lnga'i rang bzhin dag yin no zhes bya ba de yang ji lta bu /
translated: The seven abodes of consciousness are of the nature of the five aggregates.

original: de lta na 'o na ni bye brag med par ni skye ba'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phung po dag la mngon par dga' ba dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa 'jug na rnam par shes pa la rnam par shes pa gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni bye brag med par ni skye ba'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phung po dag la mngon par dga' ba dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa 'jug na rnam par shes pa la rnam par shes pa gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: If that is so, then when consciousness enters the aggregates included in the place of rebirth, without distinction, and is accompanied by attachment, it is called the abode of consciousness.

original: so sor dbye ba ni ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa yin pa ltar rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: so sor dbye ba ni ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa yin pa ltar rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The individual distinctions are as follows: Form and so on are the afflictions of consciousness, but consciousness alone is not.

original: de lta bas na rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi dag tu /
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi dag tu /
translated: Therefore, in the four abodes of consciousness,

original: rnam shes 'ba' zhig gnas par ma bshad do //
analyzed: rnam shes 'ba' zhig gnas par ma bshad do //
translated: consciousness alone is not taught to be an abode.

original: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi ni zhing gi ngo bor bstan la /
analyzed: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi ni zhing gi ngo bor bstan la /
translated: Moreover, the four abodes of consciousness are taught by the Lord to be the nature of a field,🔽and the five aggregates are taught to be the nature of seeds.

original: nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa zag par ni sa bon gyi ngo bo kho nar bstan gyi /
analyzed: nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa zag par ni sa bon gyi ngo bo kho nar bstan gyi /
translated: The consciousness that is accompanied by appropriation is taught to be a contaminant only in the sense of being a seed.

original: sa bon nyid sa bon gyi zhing gi ngo bor rnam par gzhag par gyur pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa yongs su brtag go //
analyzed: sa bon nyid sa bon gyi zhing gi ngo bor rnam par gzhag par gyur pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa yongs su brtag go //
translated: But it is not that the seed itself is established as the field of the seed. This is the interpretation of the intended meaning.

original: chos gang dag rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba de dag ni 'di'i zhing gi ngo bor shin tu legs pa yin pas de dag nyid 'di'i gnas pa dag ces bshad do //
analyzed: chos gang dag rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba de dag ni 'di'i zhing gi ngo bor shin tu legs pa yin pas de dag nyid 'di'i gnas pa dag ces bshad do //
translated: The factors that occur simultaneously with consciousness are the most excellent in the sense of being its field. Therefore, they are called its stations.

original: yang ci rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun gyis bzhi bsdus sam /
analyzed: yang ci rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun gyis bzhi bsdus sam /
translated: Are the four stations subsumed by the seven stations of consciousness?

original: 'on te bzhis bdun bsdus she na /🔽bdun @115a * //
analyzed: 'on te bzhis bdun bsdus she na / bdun @115a * //
translated: Or are the seven subsumed by the four?

original: gyis bzhi yang ma yin la bzhis kyang bdun ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gyis bzhi yang ma yin la bzhis kyang bdun ma yin gyi /
translated: The four are not subsumed by the seven, nor are the seven subsumed by the four.

original: bsdu na mu ni bzhi yin no //
analyzed: bsdu na mu ni bzhi yin no //
translated: When subsumed, there are four alternatives.

original: bsdu ba dpyad na bdun gyis bsdus la bzhis ma yin pa yang yod de zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa mu bzhir rog par bya ste /
analyzed: bsdu ba dpyad na bdun gyis bsdus la bzhis ma yin pa yang yod de zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa mu bzhir rog par bya ste /
translated: When the subsumption is analyzed, there are four alternatives, such as the four that are subsumed by the seven but not by the four.

original: mu dang po ni bdun dag tu rnam par shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mu dang po ni bdun dag tu rnam par shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The first possibility is the consciousnesses of the seven abodes.

original: gnyis pa ni ngan song rnams dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo na rnam par shes pa ma gtogs pa'i phung po rnams so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ngan song rnams dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo na rnam par shes pa ma gtogs pa'i phung po rnams so //
translated: The second possibility is the aggregates, with the exception of consciousness, in the unfortunate realms, the fourth meditation, and the summit of existence.

original: gsum pa dag ni bdun dag tu phung po bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: gsum pa dag ni bdun dag tu phung po bzhi rnams so //
translated: The third possibility is the four aggregates in the seven abodes.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The fourth possibility is what is not included in these.

original: 'gro ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'i khams gsum bshad pa gang yin pa /🔽der ni sgo nga las skyes sogs //🔽sems can skye gnas bzhi dag tu //
analyzed: 'gro ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'i khams gsum bshad pa gang yin pa / der ni sgo nga las skyes sogs // sems can skye gnas bzhi dag tu //
translated: The three realms, which are differentiated by the distinctions of the destinies, etc.,🔽have been explained.

original: rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rig par bya ste /
translated: There, the sentient beings are to be known as being in four modes of birth.🔽The four modes of birth are:

original: sgo nga las skyes pa'i skye gnas dang / mngal nas skyes pa'i skye gnas dang / drod gsher las skyes pa'i skye gnas dang / rdzus te skyes pa'i skye gnas so //
analyzed: sgo nga las skyes pa'i skye gnas dang / mngal nas skyes pa'i skye gnas dang / drod gsher las skyes pa'i skye gnas dang / rdzus te skyes pa'i skye gnas so //
translated: birth from an egg, birth from the womb, birth from heat and moisture, and spontaneous birth.

original: skye gnas zhes bya ba ni skye ba yin te /
analyzed: skye gnas zhes bya ba ni skye ba yin te /
translated: Birth is the origination of sentient beings.

original: 'dir sems can rnams 'chol bar 'gyur zhing skye ba thun mong pa'i phyir 'dra bar 'gyur bas skye gnas so //
analyzed: 'dir sems can rnams 'chol bar 'gyur zhing skye ba thun mong pa'i phyir 'dra bar 'gyur bas skye gnas so //
translated: Here, beings are mixed and similar because they have a common birth.

original: sgo nga las skyes pa'i skye gnas gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgo nga las skyes pa'i skye gnas gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mode of birth of oviparous animals?

original: sems can gang dag sgo nga las skyes pa rnams te /
analyzed: sems can gang dag sgo nga las skyes pa rnams te /
translated: It is the birth of beings who are born by breaking out of the egg.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: ngang pa dang / khrung khrung dang / rma bya dang / ne tso dang / ri skegs la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ngang pa dang / khrung khrung dang / rma bya dang / ne tso dang / ri skegs la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: the goose, the duck, the parrot, the myna, etc.

original: mngal nas skyes pa'i skye gnas gang zhe na /
analyzed: mngal nas skyes pa'i skye gnas gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mode of birth of viviparous animals?

original: sems can gang dag mngal las skyes pa rnams te /
analyzed: sems can gang dag mngal las skyes pa rnams te /
translated: It is the birth of beings who are born through the breaking of the womb.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: glang po che dang / rta dang / ba lang dang / ma he dang / bong bu dang / phag la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: glang po che dang / rta dang / ba lang dang / ma he dang / bong bu dang / phag la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: the elephant, the horse, the cow, the buffalo, the ass, the pig, etc.

original: drod gsher las skyes pa'i skye gnas gang zhe na /
analyzed: drod gsher las skyes pa'i skye gnas gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mode of birth of beings born from moisture?

original: sems can gang dag 'byung ba'i drod gsher las skye ba rnams te /
analyzed: sems can gang dag 'byung ba'i drod gsher las skye ba rnams te /
translated: It is the birth of beings who are born from the fermentation of organic substances in the absence of a father and mother,

original: 'di lta ste srin bu dang / sbur pa dang / phye ma leb dang / sbrang bu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste srin bu dang / sbur pa dang / phye ma leb dang / sbrang bu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, insects, flies, butterflies, bees, etc.

original: rdzus te 'byung ba'i skye gnas gang zhe na /
analyzed: rdzus te 'byung ba'i skye gnas gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mode of birth of apparition?

original: sems can gang dag dbang po ma tshang ba ma yin zhing dman pa ma yin la /
analyzed: sems can gang dag dbang po ma tshang ba ma yin zhing dman pa ma yin la /
translated: It is the mode of birth of sentient beings who, not lacking any organs, not incomplete in any limb or joint,

original: yan lag dang nyid lag thams cad dang ldan par cig car du skye ba rnams so //
analyzed: yan lag dang nyid lag thams cad dang ldan par cig car du skye ba rnams so //
translated: are complete in all their major and minor body parts.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag skye ba la mdzes par byed pa'i phyir rdzus te 'bang ba rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag skye ba la mdzes par byed pa'i phyir rdzus te 'bang ba rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called apparitional because they are born in a complete and pleasing manner.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: lha dang / srid pa bar ma la @115b sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: lha dang / srid pa bar ma la @115b sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: gods, sentient beings in the intermediate existence, etc.

original: yang 'gro ba gang na skye gnas du zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: yang 'gro ba gang na skye gnas du zhig yod ce na /
translated: In which mode of existence are the different modes of birth found?

original: smras pa / mi dang dud 'gro rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: smras pa / mi dang dud 'gro rnam pa bzhi //
translated: Humans and animals are of four types.

original: mi rnams ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: mi rnams ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Humans are of four types.

original: re zhig sgo nga las skyes pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: re zhig sgo nga las skyes pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: First, there are apparitional humans:

original: khrung khrung mo las skyes pa brag dang nye brag dang ri dvags 'dzin gyi ma'i bu sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / rgyal po lnga len gyi bu lnga brgya rnams so //
analyzed: khrung khrung mo las skyes pa brag dang nye brag dang ri dvags 'dzin gyi ma'i bu sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / rgyal po lnga len gyi bu lnga brgya rnams so //
translated: The thirty-two sons of the mother of Śarabhaṅga, the king of Kāśi, were born from eggs.

original: mngal na skyes pa ni ji ltar da ltar gyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: mngal na skyes pa ni ji ltar da ltar gyi lta bu'o //
translated: The five hundred sons of the king of Pañcāla were born from the womb.

original: drod gsher las skyes pa ni 'di lta ste /🔽da las nu ba dang / mdzes pa dang / nye mdzes dang / thi ba'i phreng ba can dang / aa mra skyong ma la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: drod gsher las skyes pa ni 'di lta ste / da las nu ba dang / mdzes pa dang / nye mdzes dang / thi ba'i phreng ba can dang / aa mra skyong ma la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The beings of the intermediate existence are born supernaturally.

original: rdzus te skye ba ni bskal pa dang po pa rnams kho na'o //
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba ni bskal pa dang po pa rnams kho na'o //
translated: The beings of the beginning of the cosmic age are born supernaturally.

original: dud 'gro yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dud 'gro yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Animals are of four types.

original: rnam pa gsum ni snang ba kho nar zad do //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ni snang ba kho nar zad do //
translated: The other three types are obvious.

original: rdzus te skye ba rnams ni klu dang / 'dab bzangs la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba rnams ni klu dang / 'dab bzangs la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The supernaturally born animals are the nāgas, Garuḍas, etc.

original: dmyal ba rnams dang lha rnams dang // srid pa bar ma rdzus te skye //
analyzed: dmyal ba rnams dang lha rnams dang // srid pa bar ma rdzus te skye //
translated: Hell beings, gods, and those in the intermediate existence are supernaturally born.

original: dmyal ba dang / srid pa bar ma pa dang / lha thams cad ni rdzus te skye ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: dmyal ba dang / srid pa bar ma pa dang / lha thams cad ni rdzus te skye ba kho na yin no //
translated: Hell beings, intermediate beings, and all gods are apparitional beings.

original: yi dvags mngal nas skye ba yang yin /
analyzed: yi dvags mngal nas skye ba yang yin /
translated: Pretas are born from a womb.

original: 'di zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rdzus te skye ba dag yin no zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rdzus te skye ba dag yin no zhes bya ste /
translated: The word “also” indicates that they are apparitional beings.

original: tshe dang ldan pa mod gal gyi bu chen po la yi dvags mo zhig na re /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa mod gal gyi bu chen po la yi dvags mo zhig na re /
translated: A certain preta said to the venerable Mahakausthila:🔽“Every night I give birth to five sons,🔽and every morning at dawn,

original: bdag gis mtshan mo bu lnga dang // de bzhin nyi na mo gzhan lnga dag / bskyed nas de dag za mod kyi //
analyzed: bdag gis mtshan mo bu lnga dang // de bzhin nyi na mo gzhan lnga dag / bskyed nas de dag za mod kyi //
translated: I eat them,

original: 'on kyang bdag ni tshim pa med //🔽ces smras pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag ni tshim pa med // ces smras pa'o //
translated: but I am not satisfied.

original: skye gnas thams cad kyi nang na bzang ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: skye gnas thams cad kyi nang na bzang ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the best of the modes of birth?

original: rdzus te skye ba yin no //
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba yin no //
translated: Apparitional birth is the best.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir srid pa tha ma pa'i byang chub sems dpa' skye ba la dbang thob pa yang mngal nas skye ba'i skye gnas la brten ce na ;
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir srid pa tha ma pa'i byang chub sems dpa' skye ba la dbang thob pa yang mngal nas skye ba'i skye gnas la brten ce na ;
translated: Why does the Bodhisattva in his last existence, who has obtained mastery over births, take birth from a womb?

original: de ltar mdzad na don chen po gzigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar mdzad na don chen po gzigs pa yin te /
translated: He sees great benefit in this,

original: nye du dang 'brel bas sh'akya'i rigs chen po chos la gzud pa'i phyir dang / 'di ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rigs yin no zhes gzhan dag rim gro bskyed du gzhug pa'i phyir dang / mir gyur pa dag gis kyang grub pa 'di thob bo zhes gdul bya rnams spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye du dang 'brel bas sh'akya'i rigs chen po chos la gzud pa'i phyir dang / 'di ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rigs yin no zhes gzhan dag rim gro bskyed du gzhug pa'i phyir dang / mir gyur pa dag gis kyang grub pa 'di thob bo zhes gdul bya rnams spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and in order to inspire enthusiasm in those to be trained, for they will think, “Even a human being attained this enlightenment.”

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were otherwise,

original: rigs dang gdung med na /
analyzed: rigs dang gdung med na /
translated: if he had no family or clan,🔽others would think, “Who is this?

original: ji ltar gzhan mu stegs can na re bskal pa brgyar 'das nas sgyu ma mkhan 'di lta bu zhig 'jig rten du byung nas sgyu mas 'jig rten za'o zhes kha zer ba ltar 'di su zhig yin /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan mu stegs can na re bskal pa brgyar 'das nas sgyu ma mkhan 'di lta bu zhig 'jig rten du byung nas sgyu mas 'jig rten za'o zhes kha zer ba ltar 'di su zhig yin /
translated: Is he a magician who has appeared in the world after a hundred eons and devours the world with his magic?

original: sgyu ma'i skyes @116a * //🔽bu'am / 'on te sha za zhig ces de snyam du yongs su rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes @116a * // bu'am / 'on te sha za zhig ces de snyam du yongs su rtog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Is he a phantom man or a piśāca?”

original: gzhan dag na re gang dag la mi rnams dang / gzhan dag gis mchod pa byas nas /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gang dag la mi rnams dang / gzhan dag gis mchod pa byas nas /
translated: Others again say that the Bodhisattva was born in a family that was worshipped by both humans and nonhumans.

original: stong phrag gis mtho ris dang byang grol 'thob pa ring bsrel sku gdung rnams bzhag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: stong phrag gis mtho ris dang byang grol 'thob pa ring bsrel sku gdung rnams bzhag pa'i phyir te /
translated: The relics of the Buddha are the bones of the Buddha, and the relics of disciples are the bones of disciples.

original: rdzus te skye ba'i sems can rnams la ni phyi'i sa bon med pa'i phyir shi ba rnams kyi lus mi gnas te /
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba'i sems can rnams la ni phyi'i sa bon med pa'i phyir shi ba rnams kyi lus mi gnas te /
translated: The bodies of beings born supernaturally do not remain after death, because they do not have external seeds.

original: tho rangs kyi til mar gyi mar me shi bar gyur pa bzhin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: tho rangs kyi til mar gyi mar me shi bar gyur pa bzhin no zhes zer te /
translated: They are like the flame of a lamp that is extinguished.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi byin gyi rlabs las byung ba'i rdzu 'phrul yin par 'dod pa rnams la ni lan de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi byin gyi rlabs las byung ba'i rdzu 'phrul yin par 'dod pa rnams la ni lan de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: This response is not logical for those who assert that the relics are a magical creation of the Buddha.

original: dri ba las dri ba gzhan 'byung ste /
analyzed: dri ba las dri ba gzhan 'byung ste /
translated: Another question arises from this question:

original: gal te rdzus te skye ba rnams kyi lus zhig pa med na /
analyzed: gal te rdzus te skye ba rnams kyi lus zhig pa med na /
translated: If the bodies of supernaturally born beings do not disintegrate,

original: ji ltar mdo las rdzus te skye ba'i nam mkha' lding gis rdzus te skye ba'i klu bza' ba'i phyir 'byin to zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar mdo las rdzus te skye ba'i nam mkha' lding gis rdzus te skye ba'i klu bza' ba'i phyir 'byin to zhes gsungs she na /
translated: how does a supernatural garuḍa take a supernatural nāga to eat it, as stated in the sutras?

original: za'o zhes ni ma gsungs pas ma shes nas bza' ba'i phyir 'byin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: za'o zhes ni ma gsungs pas ma shes nas bza' ba'i phyir 'byin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: The sutra does not say that it eats it, but that it takes it to eat it. There is no fault.

original: yang na ji srid ma shi'i bar du za bar byed kyi shi pa de'i tshim par 'gyur pa ni ma yin no //🔽skye gnas thams cad kyi nang nas mang ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang na ji srid ma shi'i bar du za bar byed kyi shi pa de'i tshim par 'gyur pa ni ma yin no // skye gnas thams cad kyi nang nas mang ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: Or else, as long as it is not dead, it eats it, but it is not satisfied.🔽Which of the modes of birth is the most numerous?

original: rdzus te skye ba yin te /
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba yin te /
translated: Apparitional beings are the most numerous.

original: de ni 'gro ba gnyis dang gsum gyi phyogs dang / srid pa bar ma thams cad yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'gro ba gnyis dang gsum gyi phyogs dang / srid pa bar ma thams cad yin no //
translated: In fact, they exist in two realms, in three of the four modes of birth, and in all the planes of existence.

original: srid pa bar ma zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is an intermediate existence?

original: 'dir gang 'chi dang skye ba yin //
analyzed: 'dir gang 'chi dang skye ba yin //
translated: It is that which, after death and before rebirth,

original: srid pa'i bar du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i bar du 'byung ba'o //
translated: goes to the place of rebirth.

original: lus gang yul gzhan du skye ba thob par bya ba'i phyir 'chi ba'i srid pa dang skye ba'i srid pa'i bar du mngon par 'grub pa de ni srid pa bar ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lus gang yul gzhan du skye ba thob par bya ba'i phyir 'chi ba'i srid pa dang skye ba'i srid pa'i bar du mngon par 'grub pa de ni srid pa bar ma zhes bya ste /
translated: The intermediate existence, which is projected by the same type of action that projects the prior existence, is that which, after death and before rebirth, goes to the place of rebirth.

original: 'gro ba'i bar ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bar ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called intermediate because it is not the first of these two.

original: ji ltar na 'di skye ba yang yin la byung ba yang ma yin zhe na /🔽bgrod pa'i yul du ma phyin phyir //
analyzed: ji ltar na 'di skye ba yang yin la byung ba yang ma yin zhe na / bgrod pa'i yul du ma phyin phyir //
translated: How can it be born and not be arisen?

original: srid pa bar ma byung ba min //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma byung ba min //
translated: It is not arisen because it has not yet reached the place where it should go.🔽It is born because it has arisen from the womb or the egg, etc.

original: son pa ni byung ba yin na srid pa bar ma 'di ni bgrod par bya ba'i yul du son pa ma yin te /
analyzed: son pa ni byung ba yin na srid pa bar ma 'di ni bgrod par bya ba'i yul du son pa ma yin te /
translated: If it were to arrive, it would be born. But this intermediate existence does not arrive at the place where it should go.

original: de lta bas na byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not born.

original: bgrod par bya ba'i yul de gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: bgrod par bya ba'i yul de gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is the place where it should go?

original: gang du rnam par smin pas 'phangs pa mngon zhing rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang du rnam par smin pas 'phangs pa mngon zhing rdzogs pa'o //
translated: It is the place where the projected ripening will be manifested and completed.

original: sde pa gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: sde pa gzhan dag na re /
translated: Other schools maintain that

original: 'chi ba'i srid pa chad pa kho na las skye ba'i srid pa 'byung ngo zhes zer te /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i srid pa chad pa kho na las skye ba'i srid pa 'byung ngo zhes zer te /
translated: the intermediate existence arises immediately after death existence.

original: de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: But this is unacceptable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rigs pa dang lung las te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rigs pa dang lung las te /
translated: Why is it unacceptable?🔽Because of reasoning and because of the scriptures.

original: re zhig @116b rigs pa la brten nas /
analyzed: re zhig @116b rigs pa la brten nas /
translated: As for reasoning,

original: 'bru'i rgyun dang chos mthun phyir //
analyzed: 'bru'i rgyun dang chos mthun phyir //
translated: because it is similar to a stream,

original: srid pa chad las 'byung ba min //
analyzed: srid pa chad las 'byung ba min //
translated: existence does not arise from the interruption of existence.

original: rgyun gyi 'jug pa'i chos rnams ni rgyun mi 'chad par yul gzhan dag tu 'byung ba mthong ste /
analyzed: rgyun gyi 'jug pa'i chos rnams ni rgyun mi 'chad par yul gzhan dag tu 'byung ba mthong ste /
translated: We see that factors that are in a stream arise in another place without being interrupted.

original: dper na 'bru'i rgyun lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'bru'i rgyun lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the stream of rice.

original: de lta bas na sems can gyi sems kyi rgyun 'di yang mi 'chad par yul gzhan du 'byung ba'i chos can yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sems can gyi sems kyi rgyun 'di yang mi 'chad par yul gzhan du 'byung ba'i chos can yin no //
translated: Thus, the stream of the mind of sentient beings is not interrupted; it is a phenomenon that occurs in another place.

original: chad nas 'byung ba yang mthong ste /
analyzed: chad nas 'byung ba yang mthong ste /
translated: But it is also seen that a phenomenon occurs after having been interrupted.

original: dper na me long la sogs pa dag gi nang du gzugs las gzugs brnyan lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na me long la sogs pa dag gi nang du gzugs las gzugs brnyan lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a reflection arises from a form in a mirror, etc.

original: de bzhin du 'chi ba'i srid pa las kyang skye ba'i srid pa rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'chi ba'i srid pa las kyang skye ba'i srid pa rung ngo zhe na /
translated: In the same way, the existence at death and the existence at birth are possible.🔽The example is not established,

original: gzugs brnyan ma grub phyir ba dang // mi 'dra'i phyir na dpe ma yin //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ma grub phyir ba dang // mi 'dra'i phyir na dpe ma yin //
translated: because the reflection is not established, and because it is not similar.

original: gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba kha dog gi khyad par gzhan kho na zhig 'byung ngo zhes bya ba de ni ma grub bo //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba kha dog gi khyad par gzhan kho na zhig 'byung ngo zhes bya ba de ni ma grub bo //
translated: The reflection is a particular color that arises as another entity.

original: grub tu zin kyang mi 'dra ba'i phyir dpe ma yin no //
analyzed: grub tu zin kyang mi 'dra ba'i phyir dpe ma yin no //
translated: Even if it were established, the example is not established, because it is not similar.

original: re zhig ji ltar ma grub ce na /
analyzed: re zhig ji ltar ma grub ce na /
translated: In what way is it not established?

original: gcig na lhan cig gnyis med phyir //🔽yul de nyid na me long gi gzugs kyang snang /
analyzed: gcig na lhan cig gnyis med phyir // yul de nyid na me long gi gzugs kyang snang /
translated: Because two things do not exist in the same place at the same time.🔽In the place occupied by the mirror image, the form is not found.

original: gzugs brnyan yang snang ste /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan yang snang ste /
translated: In the place occupied by the form, the mirror image is not found.

original: rten gyi 'byung ba tha dad pa'i phyir yul gcig tu gzugs gnyis lhan cig 'byung ba ni med do //
analyzed: rten gyi 'byung ba tha dad pa'i phyir yul gcig tu gzugs gnyis lhan cig 'byung ba ni med do //
translated: But two material forms do not occur together in the same place, because their bases, the primary elements, are different.

original: de bzhin du phyogs tha dad pa na gnas pa rnams kyi mtshe'u'i chu yul gcig na rang gi mdun rol gyi yul na gnas pa'i gzugs rnams kyi gzugs brnyan phan tshun dmigs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs tha dad pa na gnas pa rnams kyi mtshe'u'i chu yul gcig na rang gi mdun rol gyi yul na gnas pa'i gzugs rnams kyi gzugs brnyan phan tshun dmigs te /
translated: Similarly, when the water of a pond is present in different directions, the reflections of forms present in the place in front of each direction are mutually observed in the water of the pond.

original: gzugs gcig la lta ba po gnyis kyis lhan cig mi mthong ba ni ma yin pas der gzugs gzhan zhig 'byung bar rigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs gcig la lta ba po gnyis kyis lhan cig mi mthong ba ni ma yin pas der gzugs gzhan zhig 'byung bar rigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that two observers do not see a single form together, so it is not logical that another form arises there.

original: grib ma dang nyi ma gnyis kyang lhan cig 'byung ba ma mthong ba na grib ma na 'dug pa'i me long gi nang na nyi ma'i gzugs brnyan yang dmigs pas der de 'byung bar rigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: grib ma dang nyi ma gnyis kyang lhan cig 'byung ba ma mthong ba na grib ma na 'dug pa'i me long gi nang na nyi ma'i gzugs brnyan yang dmigs pas der de 'byung bar rigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Also, since the sun and its shadow are not seen to occur together, and since the reflection of the sun is observed in a mirror held near the shadow, it is not logical that the sun arises there.🔽Or else, the two are:

original: yang na / gcig na lhan cig gnyis med phyir //
analyzed: yang na / gcig na lhan cig gnyis med phyir //
translated: Because two do not occur together in one place.

original: zhes bya ba gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: me long gi ngos dang zla ba'i gzugs brnyan te /
analyzed: me long gi ngos dang zla ba'i gzugs brnyan te /
translated: The surface of a mirror and the reflection of the moon.

original: me long gi ngos kyang gzhan kho na la yod la /
analyzed: me long gi ngos kyang gzhan kho na la yod la /
translated: The surface of the mirror is one thing,

original: zla ba'i gzugs brnyan nang du song ba yang khron pa'i chu bzhin du gzhan kho na na snang ngo //
analyzed: zla ba'i gzugs brnyan nang du song ba yang khron pa'i chu bzhin du gzhan kho na na snang ngo //
translated: and the reflection of the moon, which is seen as if it were in the well, is seen as another.

original: de yang de'i nang du 'byung na ni gzhan na dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang de'i nang du 'byung na ni gzhan na dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were to arise in the mirror, it would not be perceived as being elsewhere, as in the well.

original: de lta bas na de ni cung zad kyang med kyi gang phyir de ltar snang ba de ni tshogs la de'i mthu de 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de ni cung zad kyang med kyi gang phyir de ltar snang ba de ni tshogs la de'i mthu de 'dra ba yin te /
translated: Thus, it does not exist at all. The power of the collection of causes is such that it appears in this way.

original: chos rnams kyi mthu'i bye brag ni bsam gyis mi khyab po //🔽re zhig @117a * //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mthu'i bye brag ni bsam gyis mi khyab po // re zhig @117a * //
translated: The specific power of things is inconceivable.

original: ma grub pa'i phyir ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pa'i phyir ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: The example of the reflection is not established.

original: ji ltar na mi 'dra ba'i phyir dpe ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mi 'dra ba'i phyir dpe ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the example is not established?

original: rgyun min phyir /
analyzed: rgyun min phyir /
translated: Because it is not a continuum.

original: ji ltar 'chi ba'i srid pa skye ba'i srid pa lta bur gzugs brnyan ni gzugs kyi rgyun du gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'chi ba'i srid pa skye ba'i srid pa lta bur gzugs brnyan ni gzugs kyi rgyun du gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: A reflection is not a continuum of form, as is the case with the life-stream from death to rebirth.

original: me long gi rgyud dang 'brel pa'i phyir dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me long gi rgyud dang 'brel pa'i phyir dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is related to the continuum of the mirror and because it arises simultaneously with the mirror.

original: rgyun la mi 'chad par yul gzhan dag tu 'byung bar brjod kyi rgyun ma yin pa la ni ma yin pas dpe mi 'dra ba yin no //🔽gzugs brnyan ni /
analyzed: rgyun la mi 'chad par yul gzhan dag tu 'byung bar brjod kyi rgyun ma yin pa la ni ma yin pas dpe mi 'dra ba yin no // gzugs brnyan ni /
translated: The example is not similar.

original: gnyis las 'byung phyir /
analyzed: gnyis las 'byung phyir /
translated: A reflection arises from two

original: gzugs brnyan ni gzugs dang me long dang rgyu gnyis las 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ni gzugs dang me long dang rgyu gnyis las 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: A reflection arises from two causes: a form and a mirror.

original: gtso bo'i rgyu gang yin pa de la brten nas 'byung na /
analyzed: gtso bo'i rgyu gang yin pa de la brten nas 'byung na /
translated: If it arises in dependence on a principal cause,

original: skye ba'i srid pa yang de ltar 'chi ba'i srid pa dang / gtso bo'i rgyu gang yang rung ba zhig dang rgyu gnyis las 'byung ba ni med do //
analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa yang de ltar 'chi ba'i srid pa dang / gtso bo'i rgyu gang yang rung ba zhig dang rgyu gnyis las 'byung ba ni med do //
translated: then birth existence does not arise from two causes, a principal cause and any other cause, as death existence does.

original: de'i phyir yang de'i 'di ni mi 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang de'i 'di ni mi 'dra ba yin no //
translated: Therefore the example is not similar.

original: phyi'i khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa sems pa med pa gtso bo'i rgyu yin pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi'i khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa sems pa med pa gtso bo'i rgyu yin pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also illogical that external semen, blood, etc., which are without mind, are the principal cause.

original: gang du rdzus te skye ba rnams nam mkha' kho na la 'byung ba der ci zhig yongs su brtag / de ltar re zhig rigs pa las 'chi ba'i srid pa 'byung bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gang du rdzus te skye ba rnams nam mkha' kho na la 'byung ba der ci zhig yongs su brtag / de ltar re zhig rigs pa las 'chi ba'i srid pa 'byung bar mi 'dod do //
translated: Thus, according to reason, the existence at death does not exist.

original: de lta bas na srid pa bar ma ni yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na srid pa bar ma ni yod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore the intermediate existence exists.

original: mgur nas gsungs phyir yod ;
analyzed: mgur nas gsungs phyir yod ;
translated: It exists because it is taught in the scriptures.

original: mdo las / srid pa ni bdun te /
analyzed: mdo las / srid pa ni bdun te /
translated: A sūtra says: There are seven existences:

original: dmyal ba'i srid pa dang / dud 'gro'i srid pa dang / yi dags kyi srid pa dang / lha'i srid pa dang / mi'i srid pa dang / las kyi srid pa dang / srid pa bar ma'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dmyal ba'i srid pa dang / dud 'gro'i srid pa dang / yi dags kyi srid pa dang / lha'i srid pa dang / mi'i srid pa dang / las kyi srid pa dang / srid pa bar ma'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: the existence of hell beings, the existence of animals, the existence of ghosts, the existence of gods, the existence of humans, the existence of action, and the intermediate existence.

original: mdo 'di ni de dag mi 'don to zhe na /
analyzed: mdo 'di ni de dag mi 'don to zhe na /
translated: If you say that this sūtra is not authoritative,

original: 'o na / dri za zhes bya ba 'di las te /
analyzed: 'o na / dri za zhes bya ba 'di las te /
translated: then it is taught in the sūtra called Gandavyūha:

original: gnas gsum mngon du gyur pas ma'i mngal du bu chags par gyur te /
analyzed: gnas gsum mngon du gyur pas ma'i mngal du bu chags par gyur te /
translated: When three conditions are present, the gandharva enters the womb.

original: ma rung zhing zla mtshan dang ldan pa dang / pha ma chags par gyur cing phrad pa dang / dri za yang nye bar gnas par gyur na'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: ma rung zhing zla mtshan dang ldan pa dang / pha ma chags par gyur cing phrad pa dang / dri za yang nye bar gnas par gyur na'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: and the mother is in season, and the parents are united, and a gandharva is present.

original: srid pa bar ma ma gtogs par dri za gzhan gang zhig yin /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma ma gtogs par dri za gzhan gang zhig yin /
translated: What other gandharva is there apart from the intermediate beings?

original: 'di yang de dag 'di skad du mi 'don to //
analyzed: 'di yang de dag 'di skad du mi 'don to //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas do not read the Sūtra in this way.

original: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How then do they read it?

original: phung po zhig pa nye bar gnas par gyur na'o zhes 'don to //
analyzed: phung po zhig pa nye bar gnas par gyur na'o zhes 'don to //
translated: They read: “When the dissolution of the aggregates is imminent.

original: gal te de lta na lnga len gyi bu'i mdo //🔽khyod kyi dri za nye bar gnas pa gang yin pa 'di rgyal rigs sam /🔽bram ze 'am /🔽rje'u rigs @117b sam ;
analyzed: gal te de lta na lnga len gyi bu'i mdo // khyod kyi dri za nye bar gnas pa gang yin pa 'di rgyal rigs sam / bram ze 'am / rje'u rigs @117b sam ;
translated: ” If this is the case, how do you interpret the following Sūtra?

original: dmangs rigs sam /🔽'on te shar phyogs nas 'ongs pa zhig gam /
analyzed: dmangs rigs sam / 'on te shar phyogs nas 'ongs pa zhig gam /
translated: “Do you know, O Vatsagotra, whether the gandharva that is present is of the kṣatriya caste, or the brāhmaṇa caste, or the vaiśya caste, or the śūdra caste?

original: 'on te lho dang nub dang / byang nas 'ongs pa zhig shes sam zhes bya ba ji ltar drang /
analyzed: 'on te lho dang nub dang / byang nas 'ongs pa zhig shes sam zhes bya ba ji ltar drang /
translated: Do you know whether it comes from the east, the south, the west, or the north?

original: phung po zhig pa ni 'ong bar rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po zhig pa ni 'ong bar rung ba ma yin no //
translated: ” The dissolution of the aggregates is not suitable to come from somewhere.

original: 'on te 'di yang mi 'don to zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di yang mi 'don to zhe na /
translated: If the Vaibhāṣikas do not read the Sūtra in this way,

original: 'o na / sngar gsungs /
analyzed: 'o na / sngar gsungs /
translated: But it was said before:🔽

original: zhes bya ba 'di las te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di las te /
translated: But the following passage from scripture contradicts your position:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis phyir mi 'ong ba ni lnga ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis phyir mi 'ong ba ni lnga ste /
translated: “The nonreturners are fivefold:

original: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang /
analyzed: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang /
translated: those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state, those who attain nirvana as soon as they are born, those who attain nirvana without application, those who attain nirvana with application, and those who migrate to a higher level.”

original: gong du 'pho ba'o zhes gsungs pa srid pa bar ma med na ji ltar bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba'o zhes gsungs pa srid pa bar ma med na ji ltar bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya bar 'gyur /
translated: If there is no intermediate existence, how could there be nonreturners who attain nirvana in the intermediate state?

original: kha cig na re bar ma dor zhes bya ba'i lha dag cig yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re bar ma dor zhes bya ba'i lha dag cig yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: There are gods called “intermediate existence.”

original: de lta na skyes ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang lha dag cig yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na skyes ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang lha dag cig yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it would follow that those called “born” and so on would also be gods.

original: de lta bas na rtog pa 'di ni bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rtog pa 'di ni bzang po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore this theory is not good.

original: 'gro mdo zhes bya ba 'di las kyang 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'gro mdo zhes bya ba 'di las kyang 'grub ste /
translated: This is also established by the sutra called the Sutra on the Seven Destinations of the Noble Person.

original: skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun zhes bya ba'i mdo las kyang dus dang yul gyi khyad par gyi bye brag gis bar mdor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gsum du bshad de /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun zhes bya ba'i mdo las kyang dus dang yul gyi khyad par gyi bye brag gis bar mdor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gsum du bshad de /
translated: The Sutra on the Seven Destinations of the Noble Person also explains three types of parinirvāṇa in the intermediate state, based on distinctions of time and place.

original: dper na zhog ma'i me chung du mngon par 'grub bzhin du 'chi bar 'gyur ba de lta bu ni dang po yin no //
analyzed: dper na zhog ma'i me chung du mngon par 'grub bzhin du 'chi bar 'gyur ba de lta bu ni dang po yin no //
translated: The first is like a small firebrand burning as it is thrown, for one dies as soon as one is born there.

original: dper na lcags kyi tsha tsha gnam du yar ba bzhin du 'chi bar 'gyur ba de lta bu ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: dper na lcags kyi tsha tsha gnam du yar ba bzhin du 'chi bar 'gyur ba de lta bu ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is like an iron spark thrown into the sky, for one dies in the intermediate state.

original: dper na lcags kyi tsha tsha gnam du yar nas sa la ma lhung ba nyid du 'chi bar 'gyur ba de lta bu ni gsum pa'o zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: dper na lcags kyi tsha tsha gnam du yar nas sa la ma lhung ba nyid du 'chi bar 'gyur ba de lta bu ni gsum pa'o zhes gsungs la /
translated: The third is like an iron spark thrown into the sky that dies before it hits the ground, for one dies before descending to a place of rebirth.

original: bar mdo zhes bya ba'i lha ni yul dang dus kyi khyad par gyi tha dad pa rnam pa gsum pa de lta bu med pas 'di ni rtog pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: bar mdo zhes bya ba'i lha ni yul dang dus kyi khyad par gyi tha dad pa rnam pa gsum pa de lta bu med pas 'di ni rtog pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: But the gods called antarāparinirvāyins do not have three types that differ in terms of place and time. Therefore this is mere speculation.

original: gzhan dag na re gang zhig tshe'i tshad kyi bar du'am /🔽lha dang nye ba'i bar du nyon mongs pa rnams spong bar byed pa gang yin pa der ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gang zhig tshe'i tshad kyi bar du'am / lha dang nye ba'i bar du nyon mongs pa rnams spong bar byed pa gang yin pa der ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yin te /
translated: Others say: One who abandons afflictions up to the limit of life expectancy or🔽up to the limit of the gods is an intermediate nirvana.

original: de yang khams kyi gnas skabs pa'am /🔽'du shes kyi gnas skabs pa'am /
analyzed: de yang khams kyi gnas skabs pa'am / 'du shes kyi gnas skabs pa'am /
translated: That is also nirvana in the state of the element,🔽in the state of discernment,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i gnas skabs pa zhig yongs su @118a * //🔽mya ngan las 'da' ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i gnas skabs pa zhig yongs su @118a * // mya ngan las 'da' ste /
translated: or in the state of conception.

original: des na rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: Therefore there are three types.

original: yang na dang po ni gzugs kyi khams su ris mthun pa yongs su blangs nas mya ngan las 'da' ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na dang po ni gzugs kyi khams su ris mthun pa yongs su blangs nas mya ngan las 'da' ba yin no //
translated: Or, the first is one who attains nirvana after taking rebirth in the form realm.

original: gnyis pa ni lha rnams kyi 'byor ba nyams su myong nas so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni lha rnams kyi 'byor ba nyams su myong nas so //
translated: The second is one who attains nirvana after experiencing the resources of the gods.

original: gsum pa ni lha rnams kyi chos yang dag par 'gro ba'i nang du zhugs nas so //
analyzed: gsum pa ni lha rnams kyi chos yang dag par 'gro ba'i nang du zhugs nas so //
translated: The third is one who attains nirvana after entering the assembly of gods who are correctly practicing Dharma.

original: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni yang dag par 'gro ba mchog tu ldan pa'i nang du zhugs nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'am /
analyzed: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni yang dag par 'gro ba mchog tu ldan pa'i nang du zhugs nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'am /
translated: Those who attain nirvana after birth enter the supreme abode of right action and then attain nirvana.

original: skyes pa tsam kho nar ma yin gyi tshe phal cher bcom nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: skyes pa tsam kho nar ma yin gyi tshe phal cher bcom nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o zhes zer te /
translated: They do not attain nirvana merely through birth, but after destroying most of the lifespan.

original: de dag thams cad kyang yul du 'gro ba'i bye brag med pa'i phyir zhog ma la sogs pa'i dpe dag dang / mi 'byor ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang yul du 'gro ba'i bye brag med pa'i phyir zhog ma la sogs pa'i dpe dag dang / mi 'byor ro //
translated: But all of these examples such as the seed of the sugarcane plant and so on are not appropriate because they do not distinguish the place of birth.

original: tshe'i tshad kyi bar du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir gzugs med pa dag tu yang bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar gsungs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: tshe'i tshad kyi bar du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir gzugs med pa dag tu yang bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar gsungs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
