translated: Since they attain nirvana after the measure of lifespan is exhausted, it would follow that intermediate nirvana would be stated for the formless realm.

original: bsam gtan dag gi bcu tshan bzhi //
analyzed: bsam gtan dag gi bcu tshan bzhi //
translated: The four sets of ten are the absorptions.

original: gzugs med dag gi bdun tshan gsum //
analyzed: gzugs med dag gi bdun tshan gsum //
translated: The three sets of seven are the formless states.

original: 'du shes kyi ni drug tshan du //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi ni drug tshan du //
translated: The six sets are the discriminations.

original: mdzad nas tshoms su yang dag bsdeb //
analyzed: mdzad nas tshoms su yang dag bsdeb //
translated: They are compiled in a chapter.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa 'di las kyang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa 'di las kyang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: This verse is not found in the sutra.

original: de lta bas na de dag thams cad kyang rtog pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag thams cad kyang rtog pa tsam du zad do //
translated: Therefore all of these are mere conjecture.

original: 'on te de dag ni mdo de dag kyang mi 'don to zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de dag ni mdo de dag kyang mi 'don to zhe na /
translated: But if you do not recite those sutras,

original: ston pa gang yin pa ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das /
analyzed: ston pa gang yin pa ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das /
translated: then the Teacher has passed into nirvana,

original: bstan pa 'di'i 'dren pa ni med /
analyzed: bstan pa 'di'i 'dren pa ni med /
translated: there is no leader for this teaching,

original: rnam pa mang po ni tha dad kyi steng du da dung yang tshig dang don la dga' dgur byed na go / da ci zhig byar yod de re zhig gang dag la lung 'di tshad ma yin pa de dag la ni lung las kyang srid pa bar ma
analyzed: rnam pa mang po ni tha dad kyi steng du da dung yang tshig dang don la dga' dgur byed na go / da ci zhig byar yod de re zhig gang dag la lung 'di tshad ma yin pa de dag la ni lung las kyang srid pa bar ma
translated: and when there are many different sects and there is still disagreement about the words and meanings of the scriptures, what can be done?🔽Those for whom this scripture is valid have already established that an intermediate existence exists on the basis of scripture.

original: grub bo // 'o na mdo las /
analyzed: grub bo // 'o na mdo las /
translated: But a sutra states:

original: de nas bdud sun 'byin byed rang gi lus kho nas mnar med pa'i dmyal pa chen por lhung do zhes gang gsungs pa ji ltar drang 'dir dgos pa ni de gson po kho nar dmyal ba'i me dag gis bskor te shi nas srid pa bar mas mnar med
analyzed: de nas bdud sun 'byin byed rang gi lus kho nas mnar med pa'i dmyal pa chen por lhung do zhes gang gsungs pa ji ltar drang 'dir dgos pa ni de gson po kho nar dmyal ba'i me dag gis bskor te shi nas srid pa bar mas mnar med
translated: Then Mara, the evil one, fell into the great Avici hell with his own body.🔽How should this be interpreted?

original: par song do snyam du dgongs pa yin no //🔽las shin tu drag po yongs su rdzogs pa rnams ni lus 'dor ba la mi sdod pas de'i phyir 'di'i mthong ba'i chos la myang @118b bar 'gyur ba'i las ni dang por smin la /
analyzed: par song do snyam du dgongs pa yin no // las shin tu drag po yongs su rdzogs pa rnams ni lus 'dor ba la mi sdod pas de'i phyir 'di'i mthong ba'i chos la myang @118b bar 'gyur ba'i las ni dang por smin la /
translated: The intention is that he was surrounded by the fires of hell while still alive and that he died and went to Avici through the intermediate existence.🔽Karma that is extremely strong and complete does not wait to cast off the body.

original: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni phyis smin te /
analyzed: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni phyis smin te /
translated: Therefore, karma to be experienced in the current life ripens first and karma to be experienced after rebirth ripens later.🔽Now, how should this statement be interpreted:

original: da ni mtshams med pa lnga'i las gang dag byas shing bsags nas de ma thag tu dmyal ba dag tu skye'o zhes gsungs pa 'di ji ltar drang /
analyzed: da ni mtshams med pa lnga'i las gang dag byas shing bsags nas de ma thag tu dmyal ba dag tu skye'o zhes gsungs pa 'di ji ltar drang /
translated: Those who commit and accumulate the five heinous actions are born in hell immediately after death?

original: dgongs pa ni 'gro ba gzhan du mi 'gro bar zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'gro ba gzhan du mi 'gro bar zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The intention is that they do not go to other reincarnating beings.

original: der ni skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las su gsungs so //
analyzed: der ni skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las su gsungs so //
translated: Here, it is said to be karma to be experienced after rebirth.

original: 'on te sgra ji bzhin du brtags na ni lnga kho na byas nas yin gyi gcig ces bya bar yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on te sgra ji bzhin du brtags na ni lnga kho na byas nas yin gyi gcig ces bya bar yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: But if it is taken literally, then it would be only five who are reborn, not one.

original: byas ma thag tu yin gyi dus gzhan gyi bar du gson por 'dug nas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: byas ma thag tu yin gyi dus gzhan gyi bar du gson por 'dug nas kyang ma yin no //
translated: And it would be only those who die immediately after committing the act, not those who live for a while.

original: srid pa bar ma skye ba nyid yin par go su zhig mi 'dod de /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma skye ba nyid yin par go su zhig mi 'dod de /
translated: Who would deny that the intermediate being is in the process of arising?

original: 'di 'chi ba'i srid pa'i mjug thogs su skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir srid pa bar ma kho nas dmyal ba dag tu skye ba yin gyi skyes pa yin no zhes ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: 'di 'chi ba'i srid pa'i mjug thogs su skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir srid pa bar ma kho nas dmyal ba dag tu skye ba yin gyi skyes pa yin no zhes ni mi smra'o //
translated: We do not say that the intermediate being is born in hell, but that it is reborn there, because it is directed toward birth.🔽But if the intermediate being is not born, how can it be said that it is in the process of arising?

original: 'o na / bram ze na tshod khyer zin rga ba dang // na ba yin te gshin rje'i drung du phyen //
analyzed: 'o na / bram ze na tshod khyer zin rga ba dang // na ba yin te gshin rje'i drung du phyen //
translated: The Sūtra says, “The young brahman is old age and death, and he goes to the presence of Yama.”

original: bar na khyod kyi gnas kyang yod min zhing //
analyzed: bar na khyod kyi gnas kyang yod min zhing //
translated: The Sūtra says, “There is no place for you to stay in between,

original: khyod kyi lam brgyags kyang ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: khyod kyi lam brgyags kyang ni yod ma yin //
translated: and you have no provisions for the road.”

original: zhes gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di ji ltar drang /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di ji ltar drang /
translated: How do you interpret this Sūtra?

original: 'dir yang dgongs pa ni mi dag gi nang na gnas su med do snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang dgongs pa ni mi dag gi nang na gnas su med do snyam pa yin no //
translated: The intention here is that it does not exist among humans.

original: yang na skye ba'i yul du phyin par bya ba'i phyir dang 'gro ba la bgegs byed pa med pa'i phyir srid pa bar ma na yang 'di gnas pa med do snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na skye ba'i yul du phyin par bya ba'i phyir dang 'gro ba la bgegs byed pa med pa'i phyir srid pa bar ma na yang 'di gnas pa med do snyam pa yin no //
translated: Or else, the intention is that it does not exist in the intermediate existence, because it has to go to the place of rebirth and there is no obstacle to its going.

original: 'di la 'di ni dgongs pa yin gyi 'di ni dgongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las brtags pa 'di ni khyod la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'di la 'di ni dgongs pa yin gyi 'di ni dgongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las brtags pa 'di ni khyod la yang mtshungs te /
translated: You should not say that this is the intention and that is not the intention, because this is the same for you.

original: de lta bas na gnyi ga'i phyogs la yang ji skad gsungs pa'i mdo mi 'gal ba'i phyir 'di ni srid pa bar ma med pa'i khungs ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gnyi ga'i phyogs la yang ji skad gsungs pa'i mdo mi 'gal ba'i phyir 'di ni srid pa bar ma med pa'i khungs ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is no contradiction in the sutra statement for both parties, this is not a source for the existence of the intermediate existence.

original: khungs zhes bya ba ni shes par byed pa gzhan du shes par mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: khungs zhes bya ba ni shes par byed pa gzhan du shes par mi byed pa yin no //
translated: A source is that which causes understanding, not that which causes misunderstanding.

original: yang 'gro ba gang du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i srid pa bar ma'i sha tshugs ji lta bu zhig mngon par 'grub ce na /
analyzed: yang 'gro ba gang du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i srid pa bar ma'i sha tshugs ji lta bu zhig mngon par 'grub ce na /
translated: What is the form of the intermediate existence that goes to the destination of the next birth?

original: de ni 'phen pa gcig pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ni 'phen pa gcig pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they are projected by the same action.

original: sngon dus srid 'byung sha tshugs can //
analyzed: sngon dus srid 'byung sha tshugs can //
translated: The intermediate existence of the being of the intermediate state is similar to the form of the being that it will be.

original: las gang gis 'gro ba 'phen pa de nyid kyi der phyin par bya ba'i phyir sred pa bar ma yang 'phen te /
analyzed: las gang gis 'gro ba 'phen pa de nyid kyi der phyin par bya ba'i phyir sred pa bar ma yang 'phen te /
translated: The action that projects the realm of rebirth also projects the intermediate existence that goes there.

original: de'i phyir de ni 'gro ba gang du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i 'gro bde dus snga ma'i srid pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba @119a * //🔽gang yin pa de'i sha tshugs lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni 'gro ba gang du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i 'gro bde dus snga ma'i srid pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba @119a * // gang yin pa de'i sha tshugs lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the intermediate existence of the being of the intermediate state is similar to the form of the being that will be born in the realm of rebirth where it will be reborn.

original: de lta na 'o na khyi mo la sogs pa'i mngal gcig tu 'gro ba lnga pa'i srid pa bar ma mngon par 'grub pas dmyal ba'i srid pa bar mas ma'i mngal tshig par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na khyi mo la sogs pa'i mngal gcig tu 'gro ba lnga pa'i srid pa bar ma mngon par 'grub pas dmyal ba'i srid pa bar mas ma'i mngal tshig par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then since the intermediate existence of a being of the five types of migration is formed in the womb of a dog, for example, the intermediate existence of a hell being would burn the mother's womb.

original: re zhig srid pa snga ma la yang dmyal ba pa rnams lhag pa dag na 'phyan pa na rtag tu 'bar ba ma yin na srid pa bar ma pa rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: re zhig srid pa snga ma la yang dmyal ba pa rnams lhag pa dag na 'phyan pa na rtag tu 'bar ba ma yin na srid pa bar ma pa rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: Since hell beings are not always burning in the previous existence, what need is there to mention the intermediate existence?

original: yang na 'bar du chug na yang de ni lus shin tu dang ba'i phyir ji lta ba bltar mi nus pa de ltar reg pa yang mi nus pas 'di ni klan kar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yang na 'bar du chug na yang de ni lus shin tu dang ba'i phyir ji lta ba bltar mi nus pa de ltar reg pa yang mi nus pas 'di ni klan kar mi rung ngo //
translated: Or else, even if it were to burn, it would not be able to be touched, just as it cannot be seen, because the body is very transparent.

original: srid pa bar ma rnams kyang mngal na phan tshun mi reg pa'i phyir dang / las la rag lus pa'i phyir mi tshig go //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma rnams kyang mngal na phan tshun mi reg pa'i phyir dang / las la rag lus pa'i phyir mi tshig go //
translated: Also, the intermediate beings do not burn each other in the womb, because they are not in mutual contact and because they depend on action.

original: bong tshod ni /
analyzed: bong tshod ni /
translated: As for their size,

original: dper na byis pa lo lnga 'am drug lon pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na byis pa lo lnga 'am drug lon pa lta bu ste /
translated: they are like a child of five or six years of age.

original: de yang dbang po gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang dbang po gsal ba yin no //
translated: But they have clear faculties.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni dper na gzhon nu thor bu lta bu mtshan dang dpe byad dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni dper na gzhon nu thor bu lta bu mtshan dang dpe byad dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The Bodhisattva in his intermediate existence is like a youth of sixteen years, endowed with the major and minor marks.

original: de nyid kyi phyir srid pa bar ma la gnas pa yum gyi lhums su zhugs pas gling bzhi pa bye ba phrag brgya snang bar mdzad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir srid pa bar ma la gnas pa yum gyi lhums su zhugs pas gling bzhi pa bye ba phrag brgya snang bar mdzad do //
translated: That is why, when he entered his mother’s womb, he illuminated a thousand universes with their four continents.

original: 'o na gang byang chub sems dpa'i yum gyi rmi lam na lhums su glang po che'i phru gu dkar po zhugs par gzigs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang byang chub sems dpa'i yum gyi rmi lam na lhums su glang po che'i phru gu dkar po zhugs par gzigs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: But what about the dream of the Bodhisattva’s mother, in which she saw a white elephant enter her side?

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas bzlog nas yun ring du lon pa'i phyir de ni mtshan ma tsam du zad de /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas bzlog nas yun ring du lon pa'i phyir de ni mtshan ma tsam du zad de /
translated: This is merely a sign, because a long time had passed since she had been in the animal realm.

original: dper na rgyal po kri kis glang po dang / khron pa dang / phye dang / tsan dan dang / tshal dang / glang po che'i phru gu dang / spre'u gnyis dang / ras yug dang / 'thab mo zhes bya ba rmi lam bcu mthong ba lta bu'o//
analyzed: dper na rgyal po kri kis glang po dang / khron pa dang / phye dang / tsan dan dang / tshal dang / glang po che'i phru gu dang / spre'u gnyis dang / ras yug dang / 'thab mo zhes bya ba rmi lam bcu mthong ba lta bu'o//
translated: For example, King Kṛkī had ten dreams: an elephant, a well, flour, sandalwood, a grove, a young elephant, two monkeys, a cloth, and a fight.

original: srid pa bar ma ni lto ba brtol te 'jug pa ma yin gyi skye gnas kyi sgo nas 'jug ste /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma ni lto ba brtol te 'jug pa ma yin gyi skye gnas kyi sgo nas 'jug ste /
translated: The intermediate beings do not enter the womb by splitting open the side, but by the door of birth.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mtshe ma las gang phyis byung ba de ni nu bo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mtshe ma las gang phyis byung ba de ni nu bo zhes bya'o //
translated: For this reason, when twins are born, the one that comes out first is called the elder brother.

original: gang sngar byung ba de ni phu bo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang sngar byung ba de ni phu bo zhes bya'o //
translated: The one that comes out second is called the younger brother.

original: 'o na chos ldan rab 'byor gyis //
analyzed: 'o na chos ldan rab 'byor gyis //
translated: But Dharmadinnā said:

original: glang chen dkar po mche ba drug ldan pa //
analyzed: glang chen dkar po mche ba drug ldan pa //
translated: six-tusked,

original: rkang bzhi mdzes dang ldan par zhal bzhes nas //
analyzed: rkang bzhi mdzes dang ldan par zhal bzhes nas //
translated: with four pretty legs.

original: drang srong gnas zhes pa ni ji bzhin du //
analyzed: drang srong gnas zhes pa ni ji bzhin du //
translated: “Just as the sage entered the hermitage,

original: yum gyi lams kyi gnas su zhugs par gyur //
analyzed: yum gyi lams kyi gnas su zhugs par gyur //
translated: so he entered the womb of his mother.

original: ces bshad pa 'di ji ltar drang zhe na /
analyzed: ces bshad pa 'di ji ltar drang zhe na /
translated: How can this be interpreted?

original: 'di ni gdon mi za bar drang bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gdon mi za bar drang bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: It cannot be interpreted without doubt.

original: 'di ni mdo sde yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ni mdo sde yang ma yin /
translated: This is not a sūtra,

original: 'dul ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'dul ba yang ma yin /
translated: it is not the Vinaya,

original: @119b chos mngon pa yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: @119b chos mngon pa yang ma yin gyi /
translated: it is not the Abhidharma.

original: 'di ni rang bzo yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rang bzo yin te /
translated: This is a personal composition.

original: rang bzo mkhan rang bzo sbyor ba rnams kyi bsam pa kha cig ni sgro 'dogs par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzo mkhan rang bzo sbyor ba rnams kyi bsam pa kha cig ni sgro 'dogs par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: The intention of those who compose personal compositions is sometimes to exaggerate.

original: 'on te gdon mi za bar drang bar bya'o zhe na yang ji ltar yum gyi rmi lam na de zhugs par gzigs pa ltar des kyang tshigs su bcad pa 'di ltar byas so zhes de ltar drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te gdon mi za bar drang bar bya'o zhe na yang ji ltar yum gyi rmi lam na de zhugs par gzigs pa ltar des kyang tshigs su bcad pa 'di ltar byas so zhes de ltar drang bar bya'o //
translated: But if it must be interpreted, it should be interpreted like this: Just as his mother saw him enter the womb in a dream, so he composed this verse.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i srid pa bar ma yang bong tshod rdzogs pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa'i shas che ba'i phyir gos dang bcas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i srid pa bar ma yang bong tshod rdzogs pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa'i shas che ba'i phyir gos dang bcas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The intermediate beings who will have a form realm birth are complete in size and clothed, because they are ashamed.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i yang gos dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yang gos dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The intermediate beings of Bodhisattvas are clothed.

original: dge slong ma dkar mo'i yang gos dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong ma dkar mo'i yang gos dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: The intermediate beings of the nun Kṛṣṇā were clothed.

original: smon lam gyi dbang gis de nyid kyis dkris nas bsregs pa'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: smon lam gyi dbang gis de nyid kyis dkris nas bsregs pa'i bar du yin no //
translated: By the power of her vow, she was wrapped in it and cremated.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na ngo tsha med pa'i shas che ba'i phyir gzhan ni gcer bu yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na ngo tsha med pa'i shas che ba'i phyir gzhan ni gcer bu yin no //
translated: In the desire realm, intermediate beings are naked, because shamelessness is strong.

original: yang srid pa snga ma zhes bya ba 'di gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang srid pa snga ma zhes bya ba 'di gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the former existence?

original: de ni 'chi ba'i sngon rol te //
analyzed: de ni 'chi ba'i sngon rol te //
translated: It is prior to death

original: skye ba'i skad cig phan chad do //
analyzed: skye ba'i skad cig phan chad do //
translated: and subsequent to conception.

original: srid pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag med par nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag go //
analyzed: srid pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag med par nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag go //
translated: Existence is the five aggregates of attachment, without distinction.

original: da ni rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
analyzed: da ni rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
translated: Now, it is divided into four types:

original: srid pa bar ma ni ji skad bshad pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma ni ji skad bshad pa'o //
translated: intermediate existence, as explained above;

original: skye ba'i srid pa ni 'gro ba rnams su nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma'o /
analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa ni 'gro ba rnams su nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma'o /
translated: The intermediate existence of birth is the moment when the sentient being is inserted into the womb.

original: de phan chad 'chi ba'i skad cig ma ma gtogs pa'i srid pa gzhan thams cad ni dus snga ma'i srid pa yin no //
analyzed: de phan chad 'chi ba'i skad cig ma ma gtogs pa'i srid pa gzhan thams cad ni dus snga ma'i srid pa yin no //
translated: All the other existences, with the exception of the existence at death, are prior to this moment.

original: skad cig ma tha ma ni 'chi ba'i srid pa yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma tha ma ni 'chi ba'i srid pa yin te /
translated: The last moment of the intermediate existence is the existence at death.

original: gal te sems can gzugs can dag gi nang du skye na gang gi 'og tu srid pa bar ma 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te sems can gzugs can dag gi nang du skye na gang gi 'og tu srid pa bar ma 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If the sentient being is to be reborn in a realm of form, the intermediate existence is followed by the existence in the womb.

original: srid pa bar ma de yang /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma de yang /
translated: The intermediate existence is seen

original: ris mthun lha mig dag pas mthong //
analyzed: ris mthun lha mig dag pas mthong //
translated: by those of its own class and by the pure divine eye.

original: srid pa bar ma ris mthun pa dag gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma ris mthun pa dag gis mthong ngo //
translated: The intermediate existence of a sentient being of such and such a class is seen by the intermediate existence of a sentient being of the same class.🔽Those who possess the divine eye, pure and arisen from meditation, also see it.

original: gang dag la lha'i mig shin tu rnam par dag pa mngon par shes pa las byung ba yod pa de dag gis 'di mthong gi / shin tu dang ba'i phyir skyes nas thob pa'i mig gis ni mi mthong ngo /
analyzed: gang dag la lha'i mig shin tu rnam par dag pa mngon par shes pa las byung ba yod pa de dag gis 'di mthong gi / shin tu dang ba'i phyir skyes nas thob pa'i mig gis ni mi mthong ngo /
translated: But the divine eye obtained through birth, even though it is pure, does not see it, because it is too subtle.

original: gzhan dag na re lha'i srid ba bar ma pas ni thams cad mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re lha'i srid ba bar ma pas ni thams cad mthong ngo //
translated: According to other masters, the intermediate existence of a god sees the intermediate existence of a god, and so on.

original: mi dang ; yi dags dang / dud 'gro dang / dmyal ba'i srid pa bar ma rnams kyis ni gong ma ma gtogs pa'o zhes zer ro //🔽las kyi rdzu 'phrul shugs dang ldan //
analyzed: mi dang ; yi dags dang / dud 'gro dang / dmyal ba'i srid pa bar ma rnams kyis ni gong ma ma gtogs pa'o zhes zer ro // las kyi rdzu 'phrul shugs dang ldan //
translated: The intermediate beings of humans, hungry ghosts, animals and hell beings are endowed with the speed of the wind.🔽They are endowed with the speed of the wind.

original: rdzu 'phrul ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba'o //
translated: Rddhi is movement through space.

original: las kyi rdzu 'phrul byed pas na las kyi rdzu 'phrul lo //🔽de'i shugs ni las @120a * //🔽kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi shugs de mgyogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: las kyi rdzu 'phrul byed pas na las kyi rdzu 'phrul lo // de'i shugs ni las @120a * // kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi shugs de mgyogs pa nyid do //
translated: They are endowed with the speed of the wind, because they are endowed with the speed of the wind.🔽The speed of the wind is the swiftness of the wind.

original: de 'di la yod pas na las kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi shugs dang ldan pa'o /
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas na las kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi shugs dang ldan pa'o /
translated: They are endowed with the speed of the wind, because they are endowed with that speed.

original: des na 'di ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang dgag par mi spyod de /
analyzed: des na 'di ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang dgag par mi spyod de /
translated: The Buddhas themselves cannot stop them,

original: las stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //🔽dbang po kun tshang /
analyzed: las stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro // dbang po kun tshang /
translated: because their action is powerful.🔽They are endowed with all the organs.

original: dbang po lnga char tshang pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga char tshang pa'o //
translated: They are endowed with all five organs.

original: thogs med ldan /
analyzed: thogs med ldan /
translated: They are endowed with nonobstruction.

original: thogs pa ni rdugs pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa ni rdugs pa'o //
translated: Obstruction is impediment.

original: de 'di la yod pas thogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas thogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: They are endowed with obstruction, because they have that.

original: thogs pa med pa dang ldan pas na thogs med ldan te /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa dang ldan pas na thogs med ldan te /
translated: They are endowed with nonobstruction, because they are endowed with nonobstruction.

original: rdo rje la sogs pas kyang mi zlogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje la sogs pas kyang mi zlogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it cannot be turned back by any weapon such as an arrow.

original: 'di ltar lcags kyi thu lum 'bar ba gshegs nas de'i nang nas byung ba'i srin bu dmigs so zhes grag go //🔽de 'gro ba gang du skye bar 'gyur ba de las rnam pa thams cad du mi zlogs te /🔽mi'i srid pa bar ma med par gyur nas lha'i srid pa bar ma'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar lcags kyi thu lum 'bar ba gshegs nas de'i nang nas byung ba'i srin bu dmigs so zhes grag go // de 'gro ba gang du skye bar 'gyur ba de las rnam pa thams cad du mi zlogs te / mi'i srid pa bar ma med par gyur nas lha'i srid pa bar ma'am /
translated: It is said that one can see worms coming out of the burning iron.🔽It is impossible for the intermediate beings of one destiny to be turned back and to enter the womb of another destiny.🔽It is impossible for the intermediate beings of the human destiny to enter the womb of the divine destiny or vice versa.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba ni nam yang med kyi 'di 'gro ba gang gi dbang du byas nas mngon par 'grub pa de kho nar skye bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba ni nam yang med kyi 'di 'gro ba gang gi dbang du byas nas mngon par 'grub pa de kho nar skye bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: It is certain that the intermediate beings of a certain destiny will be born in this very destiny and nowhere else.

original: yang ci 'dod pa na spyod pa'i srid pa bar ma yang kham gyi zas za'am zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci 'dod pa na spyod pa'i srid pa bar ma yang kham gyi zas za'am zhe na /
translated: Do the intermediate beings of the realm of desire eat solid food?

original: smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: smras pa de bzhin te /
translated: Yes, they eat odors.

original: rags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But not coarse odors.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /🔽de ni dri za'o //
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na / de ni dri za'o //
translated: What then?🔽They eat subtle odors.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dri za zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dri za zhes bya'o //
translated: This is why they are called gandharva, “those who eat odors.”

original: dbang chung bar grags pa ni dri mi zhim pa za ba'o //
analyzed: dbang chung bar grags pa ni dri mi zhim pa za ba'o //
translated: Those of little power are those who eat foul odors.

original: dbang che bar grags pa ni dri zhim po za ba'o //
analyzed: dbang che bar grags pa ni dri zhim po za ba'o //
translated: Those of great power are those who eat sweet odors.

original: dus ji srid kyi bar du gnas she na /
analyzed: dus ji srid kyi bar du gnas she na /
translated: For how long do they remain?

original: btsun pa na re nges pa med de /
analyzed: btsun pa na re nges pa med de /
translated: The Venerable Ghosaka says:

original: ji srid du skye ba'i tshogs pa ma rnyed kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: ji srid du skye ba'i tshogs pa ma rnyed kyi bar du'o //
translated: They remain for an unspecified time, until the collection of conditions for birth is complete.

original: de'i tshe 'phen pa logs shig na med de /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'phen pa logs shig na med de /
translated: At that time, they do not have a separate projecting force,

original: ris mthun pa gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ris mthun pa gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are of the same type.

original: de lta ma yin na de'i tshe zad pas 'chi ba'i srid par yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de'i tshe zad pas 'chi ba'i srid par yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro /
translated: If that were not so, then at that time they would die due to the exhaustion of their life force.

original: gal te sha'i phung po ri rab tsam du gyur la de dag thams cad srin bu rnams kyis gang bar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te sha'i phung po ri rab tsam du gyur la de dag thams cad srin bu rnams kyis gang bar gyur na /
translated: If a heap of flesh the size of Mount Meru were to appear and all of it were filled with worms,

original: de ci de dag gi srid pa bar ma rnams der sdod pa kho nar gyur tam /
analyzed: de ci de dag gi srid pa bar ma rnams der sdod pa kho nar gyur tam /
translated: would the intermediate existences of those worms remain there?

original: de dag ga las 'ongs pa brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ga las 'ongs pa brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: Or from where did they come?

original: 'di mdo 'am bstan bcos dag las ni mi 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di mdo 'am bstan bcos dag las ni mi 'byung mod kyi /
translated: This is not mentioned in the sutras or the treatises.

original: 'di ltar dri dang ro la mngon par chags pa'i skye bo phra mo tshe thung du rnams mtha' med pas de dag dri tshor nas dri dang ro la mngon par chags pa rnams 'chi ba na srin bu'i ngo bor 'gyur ba'i las sang par byas nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar dri dang ro la mngon par chags pa'i skye bo phra mo tshe thung du rnams mtha' med pas de dag dri tshor nas dri dang ro la mngon par chags pa rnams 'chi ba na srin bu'i ngo bor 'gyur ba'i las sang par byas nas /
translated: Thus, those who are attached to smell and taste are born as small creatures with short lives.

original: srid @120b pa des srin bu'i nad dag tu skye bar 'gyur bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: srid @120b pa des srin bu'i nad dag tu skye bar 'gyur bar mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable that they are born as worms due to the karma of being attached to smell and taste at the time of death.

original: yang na gdon mi za bar de'i rkyen mang po kho na'i dus su der 'gyur ba'i las rnams rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub par bya ba la 'jug pa rnyed kyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /🔽'di ltar 'khor los sgyur pa'i las yod du zin kyang skye dgu'i tshe lo brgyad khri 'am /
analyzed: yang na gdon mi za bar de'i rkyen mang po kho na'i dus su der 'gyur ba'i las rnams rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub par bya ba la 'jug pa rnyed kyi gzhan du ni ma yin te / 'di ltar 'khor los sgyur pa'i las yod du zin kyang skye dgu'i tshe lo brgyad khri 'am /
translated: Or else, it is certain that at the time of many conditions for that, karma to be born there engages in establishing the fruition of karma, but not otherwise.

original: tshe lo ches mang ba na 'khor los sgyur ba 'byung gi gzhan du ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshe lo ches mang ba na 'khor los sgyur ba 'byung gi gzhan du ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, even though the karma of a universal monarch exists, a universal monarch arises when the lifespan of beings is eighty thousand years or more,🔽but not otherwise.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab bo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab bo zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is why the Fortunate One said: “The effects of action are inconceivable.🔽”

original: btsun pa dbyig bshes na re zhag bdun du gnas so //
analyzed: btsun pa dbyig bshes na re zhag bdun du gnas so //
translated: Bhadanta Vasumitra says: “The intermediate being can last seven days;🔽if the complex of causes necessary for reincarnation has not been realized at the end of this period, then the intermediate being dies and is reborn.

original: gal te da srid kyi tshogs pa ma rnyed na shi 'phos shing shi 'phos nas yang de nyid du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gal te da srid kyi tshogs pa ma rnyed na shi 'phos shing shi 'phos nas yang de nyid du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: If the present collection of components is not found, he dies and having died, he is born again in that very place.

original: gzhan dag na re zhag bdun phrag bdun du'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re zhag bdun phrag bdun du'o zhes zer ro //
translated: According to other masters, the intermediate being can last seven weeks.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re de ni srid pa tshol ba yin pa'i phyir myur ba kho nas song ste nyid mtshams sbyor bas na dus thung ngur gnas so //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re de ni srid pa tshol ba yin pa'i phyir myur ba kho nas song ste nyid mtshams sbyor bas na dus thung ngur gnas so //
translated: According to the Vaibhāṣikas, the intermediate being lasts only a short time, for, seeking birth, it is in haste to get there.🔽When the complex of causes necessary for reincarnation is realized, then the intermediate being dies and reincarnates.

original: gang gi tshe rkyen tshogs pa yang ma yin la 'di nges par yul der skye bar 'gyur pa yang yin no de'i tshe las rnams kho nas rkyen dag tshogs pa 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rkyen tshogs pa yang ma yin la 'di nges par yul der skye bar 'gyur pa yang yin no de'i tshe las rnams kho nas rkyen dag tshogs pa 'dren par byed do //
translated: If the complex of causes is not realized, then the intermediate being dies and is reborn, but in order to be reborn, it is necessary that three conditions be realized.

original: 'on te ma des na ni de las gzhan pa'i yul du skye ba der skye bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //🔽gzhan dag na re de 'dra bar skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te ma des na ni de las gzhan pa'i yul du skye ba der skye bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro // gzhan dag na re de 'dra bar skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: If not, then he will be reborn in another place.

original: 'di lta ste ba lang dag ni dbyar rnams su 'khrig pa mang la /🔽khyi rnams ni ston kar ro //🔽dom rnams ni dgun kar ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste ba lang dag ni dbyar rnams su 'khrig pa mang la / khyi rnams ni ston kar ro // dom rnams ni dgun kar ro //
translated: According to another opinion, the intermediate being is born in the place where the copulation of the parents takes place.🔽The cow is in heat in the rainy season;🔽the bitch, in the autumn;

original: rta rnams ni sos kar ro //
analyzed: rta rnams ni sos kar ro //
translated: the bear, in the winter;🔽the mare, in the spring.

original: ba men dang / ce spyang dang / bong bu dang / dred mo rnams la ni dus med pas dus gzhan pa ba lang rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni ba men rnams kyi nang du skye'o //
analyzed: ba men dang / ce spyang dang / bong bu dang / dred mo rnams la ni dus med pas dus gzhan pa ba lang rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni ba men rnams kyi nang du skye'o //
translated: The buffalo, the jackal, the ass, the cat, are not subject to seasons; but the intermediate being of a buffalo, etc. , who should be born a buffalo, will enter the womb of a female buffalo when she is in heat.

original: khyi rnams kyi nang du gang yin pa de ni ce spyang rnams kyi nang du'o //🔽rta rnams kyi nang du gang yin pa de ni bong bu rnams kyi nang du'o //
analyzed: khyi rnams kyi nang du gang yin pa de ni ce spyang rnams kyi nang du'o //🔽rta rnams kyi nang du gang yin pa de ni bong bu rnams kyi nang du'o //
translated: The same for the other animals.🔽The intermediate being of a horse will enter the womb of a mare when she is in heat, and so on.

original: dom rnams kyi nang du gang yin pa de ni dred mo rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dom rnams kyi nang du gang yin pa de ni dred mo rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Those who were bears become bears.

original: 'phen pa gcig pa'i phyir ris gzhan gyi srid pa bar mas ris mthun pa gzhan du skye bar mi nus pas de ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phen pa gcig pa'i phyir ris gzhan gyi srid pa bar mas ris mthun pa gzhan du skye bar mi nus pas de ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: But it is not possible for an intermediate being of one realm to be born in another realm, because the projecting force is the same.

original: yang 'gro ba'i yul du phyin par bya ba'i phyir 'byung ba'i srid pa bar ma de ni /
analyzed: yang 'gro ba'i yul du phyin par bya ba'i phyir 'byung ba'i srid pa bar ma de ni /
translated: The intermediate beings of the realm of desire go to the place of their plane of existence,

original: blo ni phyin ci log gyur pas //
analyzed: blo ni phyin ci log gyur pas //
translated: because their thought is mistaken.

original: rtse dgas 'gro ba'i yul du 'gro //🔽da ni las kyi mthu @121a * //
analyzed: rtse dgas 'gro ba'i yul du 'gro // da ni las kyi mthu @121a * //
translated: They go to the place of their plane of existence through desire for sex.

original: las byung ba'i mig gis rang gi skye ba'i yul thag ring po na 'dug kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: las byung ba'i mig gis rang gi skye ba'i yul thag ring po na 'dug kyang mthong ngo //
translated: Now, through the power of action, they see with the divine eye that they possess, their future place of birth, even though it may be far away.🔽If they are to be reborn from the womb, they see their future parents in sexual union.

original: des de na pha ma nyal pa byed pa de mthong nas pa zhig yin na ni des ma la pho'i 'dod chags skye'o //
analyzed: des de na pha ma nyal pa byed pa de mthong nas pa zhig yin na ni des ma la pho'i 'dod chags skye'o //
translated: If they are to be reborn as males, they have the desire of a male for the mother;

original: mo zhig yin na ni pha la mo'i 'dod chags skye'o //🔽bzlog pa ni khong khro ba skye ba ste ;
analyzed: mo zhig yin na ni pha la mo'i 'dod chags skye'o //🔽bzlog pa ni khong khro ba skye ba ste ;
translated: if they are to be reborn as females, they have the desire of a female for the father.🔽The opposite desire arises if they are to be reborn as females or males.

original: btags pa las 'di skad du de'i che dri za la sems gnyis las rjes su chags pa dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: btags pa las 'di skad du de'i che dri za la sems gnyis las rjes su chags pa dang ldan pa'am /
translated: The Pratītyasamutpādavyākhyā says,🔽“At that time, the gandharva has two thoughts: one of attachment and one of anger.

original: khong khro ba dang ldan pa'i sems gang yang rung ba'i mngon du gyur pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: khong khro ba dang ldan pa'i sems gang yang rung ba'i mngon du gyur pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: One of these two thoughts is present in the gandharva.🔽”

original: de ni gnyis kyi phyin ci log tu gyur pas yul der phyin pa dang / dga' bar 'dod pa'i gnas skabs der bdag nyid mos so //
analyzed: de ni gnyis kyi phyin ci log tu gyur pas yul der phyin pa dang / dga' bar 'dod pa'i gnas skabs der bdag nyid mos so //
translated: Since the gandharva is mistaken about the two, it goes to the place and is attracted to the place where it desires to enjoy sex.

original: mngal gyi gnas mi gtsang ba der phyin nas dga' ba skyes nas gnas so //
analyzed: mngal gyi gnas mi gtsang ba der phyin nas dga' ba skyes nas gnas so //
translated: Having gone to that impure place of the womb, it is born there and remains.

original: de nas de'i phung po mkhrang por 'gyur la srid pa bar ma yang 'gag par 'gyur bas na skyes pa yin no //🔽gal te de pho zhig yin na ni ma'i lto'i g-yas phyogs su snyes nas rgyab rol du kha bltas te tsog tsog por skye'o //
analyzed: de nas de'i phung po mkhrang por 'gyur la srid pa bar ma yang 'gag par 'gyur bas na skyes pa yin no // gal te de pho zhig yin na ni ma'i lto'i g-yas phyogs su snyes nas rgyab rol du kha bltas te tsog tsog por skye'o //
translated: Then its aggregates become solid and the intermediate existence ceases.🔽If it is a male, it sits in the mother’s womb with its back to the right side of the womb and its face to the front.

original: gal te mo zhig yin na ni de ma'i lto'i g-yon phyogs su snyes nas lto'i mdun rol du kha lta'o //
analyzed: gal te mo zhig yin na ni de ma'i lto'i g-yon phyogs su snyes nas lto'i mdun rol du kha lta'o //
translated: If it is a female, it sits in the mother’s womb with its back to the left side of the womb and its face to the front.

original: 'on te de ma ning zhig yin na ni de 'dod chags gang dang ldan pa de bzhin du gnas so //
analyzed: 'on te de ma ning zhig yin na ni de 'dod chags gang dang ldan pa de bzhin du gnas so //
translated: If it is a eunuch, it remains as it is, that is, with the attachment that it had.

original: srid pa bar ma'i dbang po thams cad tshang ba yin pa'i phyir dbang po ma tshang ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma'i dbang po thams cad tshang ba yin pa'i phyir dbang po ma tshang ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is not incomplete in faculties, because the faculties of the intermediate beings are complete.

original: de'i phyir mor gyur pa dang / phor gyur pa zhugs nas gnas pa'i lta ba bzhin du gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mor gyur pa dang / phor gyur pa zhugs nas gnas pa'i lta ba bzhin du gnas so //
translated: Thus, it remains as it is, like a man or a woman who has entered a house.

original: phyis lus skye zhing ma ning du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyis lus skye zhing ma ning du 'gyur ro //
translated: Later, it will be born with a body and will be a eunuch.

original: da ni 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Now, we must examine this matter.

original: ci las kyi dbang gis khu chu dang / khrag gi 'byung ba chen po dag kho na 'di'i dbang po'i rten du 'gyur ram /🔽'on te las rnams las /
analyzed: ci las kyi dbang gis khu chu dang / khrag gi 'byung ba chen po dag kho na 'di'i dbang po'i rten du 'gyur ram / 'on te las rnams las /
translated: By the power of action, are the great elements of blood and semen of the parents transformed into the faculties of the embryo?

original: de dag la brten nas 'byung ba kho na zhig skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de dag la brten nas 'byung ba kho na zhig skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Or rather, do the elements which are the cause of the faculties arise from actions?

original: kha cig na re de dag kho na yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re de dag kho na yin te /
translated: Some say: The great elements of blood and semen are the faculties.

original: khu chu dang khrag dbang po med pa na ni 'gag la /
analyzed: khu chu dang khrag dbang po med pa na ni 'gag la /
translated: For, when the blood and semen are without faculties, they perish.

original: sa bon dang myu gu 'gag pa dang / skye ba'i tshul du dbang po dang bcas pa nur nur po zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni skye'o //
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu 'gag pa dang / skye ba'i tshul du dbang po dang bcas pa nur nur po zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni skye'o //
translated: The embryo endowed with sense faculties, which is called kalala, arises in the manner in which a seed arises and perishes.

original: de ltar bshad na pha ma'i nur nur po mi gtsang ba las skyes pa zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du dge slong dag khyed kyis ni yun ring po nas ngur khrod skyed do //
analyzed: de ltar bshad na pha ma'i nur nur po mi gtsang ba las skyes pa zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du dge slong dag khyed kyis ni yun ring po nas ngur khrod skyed do //
translated: If this is the case, then the expression, The embryo arises from the semen and blood of the parents, is well founded, as is the expression, Monks, you have been carrying around this corpse for a long time.

original: khrag gi thigs pa blangs so zhes gsungs pa'i mdo'i tshig legs pa yin no zhes @121b zer ro //
analyzed: khrag gi thigs pa blangs so zhes gsungs pa'i mdo'i tshig legs pa yin no zhes @121b zer ro //
translated: You have taken up this drop of blood.

original: gzhan dag na re 'byung ba gzhan dag kho na yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'byung ba gzhan dag kho na yin te /
translated: Other masters say: The embryo is formed from other primary elements.

original: dper na lo ma'i srin bu lta bu yin la /
analyzed: dper na lo ma'i srin bu lta bu yin la /
translated: It is like the insect that is born in the leaf of a tree.

original: mi gtsang ba la brten nas skye ba la dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir mdo dang yang mi 'gal lo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba la brten nas skye ba la dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir mdo dang yang mi 'gal lo zhes zer ro //
translated: The Sūtra does not contradict this explanation, for the Sūtra intends to say that the embryo arises in dependence on impure substances.

original: re zhig sgo nga las skye ba dang / mngal nas skye ba'i skye gnas su 'jug pa ni de lta bu'o //
analyzed: re zhig sgo nga las skye ba dang / mngal nas skye ba'i skye gnas su 'jug pa ni de lta bu'o //
translated: This is how the entry into the wombs of the egg-born and of the womb-born takes place.

original: gzhan la ni ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan la ni ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes zer te /
translated: The other two are as appropriate.

original: de la rigs pa ni 'di yin par snang ngo //
analyzed: de la rigs pa ni 'di yin par snang ngo //
translated: This is the way it appears.

original: dri dang gnas la mngon 'dod gzhan //
analyzed: dri dang gnas la mngon 'dod gzhan //
translated: Others desire smell and place.

original: drod gsher las skye ba'i skye gnas su skye ba ni las ji lta ba bzhin du skye ba'i gnas gtsang ma'am mi gtsang bar dri 'dod pas 'gro'o //
analyzed: drod gsher las skye ba'i skye gnas su skye ba ni las ji lta ba bzhin du skye ba'i gnas gtsang ma'am mi gtsang bar dri 'dod pas 'gro'o //
translated: Beings born from moisture desire smell and go to their birthplace, whether pure or impure, in accordance with their karma.

original: rdzus te skye ba'i skye gnas su skye ba ni gnas 'dod pas so //
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba'i skye gnas su skye ba ni gnas 'dod pas so //
translated: Beings supernaturally born desire place and go there.

original: ji ltar na dmyal ba dag tu gnas 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dmyal ba dag tu gnas 'dod ce na /
translated: How can they desire a place in hell?

original: blo phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: blo phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because their minds are distorted.

original: de ni bdag nyid rlung dang char pa shin tu grang mo dag gis btab nas nyen pa dang dmyal ba dag na me 'bar ba mthong ste /
analyzed: de ni bdag nyid rlung dang char pa shin tu grang mo dag gis btab nas nyen pa dang dmyal ba dag na me 'bar ba mthong ste /
translated: They see a blazing fire in hell and are tormented by a cold wind and rain.

original: de'i phyir dro bar 'dod de rgyug go //
analyzed: de'i phyir dro bar 'dod de rgyug go //
translated: Thus, desiring warmth, they run there.

original: yang bdag nyid rlung tsha ba dang nyi ma dang me'i gdung ba dag gis nyen pa dang dmyal ba dag na bsil ba mthong bas bsil ba 'dod pas rgyug go //
analyzed: yang bdag nyid rlung tsha ba dang nyi ma dang me'i gdung ba dag gis nyen pa dang dmyal ba dag na bsil ba mthong bas bsil ba 'dod pas rgyug go //
translated: Moreover, when one is tormented by hot winds, the sun, and fire, and when one sees the coolness in the hells, one runs there, desiring coolness.

original: sngon gyi slob dpon dag na re bdag nyid gnas skabs gang gis der skye bar 'gyur ba'i las byas pa'i gnas skabs de yin pa dang / sems can de dag kyang mthong nas rgyug go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi slob dpon dag na re bdag nyid gnas skabs gang gis der skye bar 'gyur ba'i las byas pa'i gnas skabs de yin pa dang / sems can de dag kyang mthong nas rgyug go zhes zer ro //
translated: Former masters say: One runs there because one sees the sentient beings who are in the condition in which one will be born there, and one sees oneself in that condition.

original: de la lha'i srid pa bar ma ni stan las ldang ba bzhin du gyen du 'gro'o //
analyzed: de la lha'i srid pa bar ma ni stan las ldang ba bzhin du gyen du 'gro'o //
translated: The intermediate existence of a god moves upward, like someone rising from a seat.

original: mi dang dud 'gro dang / yi dags rnams kyi ni mi la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mi dang dud 'gro dang / yi dags rnams kyi ni mi la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The intermediate existence of a human, animal, or ghost moves as humans, etc., do.

original: dmyal ba yi ni spyi'u tshugs yin //🔽yang dag sdom dang dka' thub can //
analyzed: dmyal ba yi ni spyi'u tshugs yin // yang dag sdom dang dka' thub can //
translated: The intermediate existence of a hell being moves headfirst.🔽Those who slander the pure🔽and ascetics,

original: drang srong rnams la skur 'debs pa //🔽de dag spyi'u tshugs dag tu ni //
analyzed: drang srong rnams la skur 'debs pa // de dag spyi'u tshugs dag tu ni //
translated: those who slander the sages,

original: dmyal ba kho nar ltung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dmyal ba kho nar ltung bar 'gyur //
translated: fall headfirst into hell.

original: zhes tshigs su bcad de 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad de 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is stated in a verse.

original: blo ni phyin ci log gyur pas //🔽rtse dgas 'gro ba'i yul du 'gro //
analyzed: blo ni phyin ci log gyur pas // rtse dgas 'gro ba'i yul du 'gro //
translated: Because their minds are distorted,

original: zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa /
translated: they go to the place of their birth with joy.

original: ci nges par srid pa bar ma pa thams cad ma'i mngal du de ltar 'jug gam zhe na /
analyzed: ci nges par srid pa bar ma pa thams cad ma'i mngal du de ltar 'jug gam zhe na /
translated: Do all intermediate beings enter the womb in this way?

original: smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ma yin no //
translated: No, they do not.

original: 'on kyang mdo las mngal du 'jug pa ni bzhi zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang mdo las mngal du 'jug pa ni bzhi zhes gsungs te /
translated: The Sūtra says that there are four ways of entering the womb:

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: gcig ni shes bzhin du 'jug go //
analyzed: gcig ni shes bzhin du 'jug go //
translated: One enters consciously,

original: gnas pa dang 'byung ba ni shes bzhin du ma yin no //🔽gzhan ni gnas pa yang shes bzhin du zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: gnas pa dang 'byung ba ni shes bzhin du ma yin no // gzhan ni gnas pa yang shes bzhin du zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: but abides and emerges unconsciously.

original: yang @122a * //
analyzed: yang @122a * //
translated: Another abides consciously,

original: zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'jug pa yang ngo //🔽gzhan ni / 'byung ba'ang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'jug pa yang ngo // gzhan ni / 'byung ba'ang /
translated: but enters and emerges unconsciously.

original: shes bzhin du ste /
analyzed: shes bzhin du ste /
translated: Another enters and abides consciously,🔽but emerges unconsciously.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa dang / gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa dang / gnas pa'o //
translated: Another enters, abides, and emerges consciously.

original: gzhan ni thams cad rmongs /
analyzed: gzhan ni thams cad rmongs /
translated: The fourth is confused in all three stages.

analyzed: rnam par myags pa / rul pa ; rnags pa /
translated: It is completely putrid.🔽It is rotten, festering, and oozing.

original: 'gred pa / mthong na 'jigs su rung ba pags pa rdol ba srab mos g-yogs pa /
analyzed: 'gred pa / mthong na 'jigs su rung ba pags pa rdol ba srab mos g-yogs pa /
translated: It is covered with thin, cracked skin.

original: sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa lus kyi rma 'khyims pa chen po der lag pa bcug ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa lus kyi rma 'khyims pa chen po der lag pa bcug ste /
translated: It is a great, festering wound on the body, arisen from the ripening of former karma.

original: yan lag dang nying lag bcad nas 'byin to //
analyzed: yan lag dang nying lag bcad nas 'byin to //
translated: Having inserted his hand into that, he cuts the fetus limb by limb and pulls it out.

original: de yang sngon gyi las lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur bas shed du khrid par byed do //
analyzed: de yang sngon gyi las lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur bas shed du khrid par byed do //
translated: Moreover, he is led to the place where he will experience the results of other former karma.

original: 'on te bde bar btsa' bar 'gyur na ni de nas 'di bu 'dod pa'i ma'am /
analyzed: 'on te bde bar btsa' bar 'gyur na ni de nas 'di bu 'dod pa'i ma'am /
translated: If the birth is easy, then the mother or

original: de'i g-yog bu med rnams kyis btsas ma thag pa'i lus rma sar pa lta bu mtshon dang thal ba'i sman lta bu'i reg pa dang ldan pa'i lag pa gnyis kyis blangs nas 'khru bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i g-yog bu med rnams kyis btsas ma thag pa'i lus rma sar pa lta bu mtshon dang thal ba'i sman lta bu'i reg pa dang ldan pa'i lag pa gnyis kyis blangs nas 'khru bar byed do //
translated: The newborn body, like an open wound, is sensitive to contact with such things as weapons and ashes.

original: nu zho dang mar sar gyis skyed par byed cing rim gyis kha zas rags pa bza' bar goms par yang byed do //
analyzed: nu zho dang mar sar gyis skyed par byed cing rim gyis kha zas rags pa bza' bar goms par yang byed do //
translated: It is nourished by milk and butter, and gradually it becomes accustomed to eating coarse food.

original: de skye ba'i rgyus dbang po rnams longs su smin nas ni yang nyon mongs pa rnams kun tu spyod cing /
analyzed: de skye ba'i rgyus dbang po rnams longs su smin nas ni yang nyon mongs pa rnams kun tu spyod cing /
translated: As it grows, the faculties mature and the afflictions become active.

original: las rnams kyang stsogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las rnams kyang stsogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And one accumulates karma.

original: de dag gi lus zhig nas yang snga ma bzhin du srid pa bar ma'i rgyun gyis 'jig rten pha rol tu 'gro ste /
analyzed: de dag gi lus zhig nas yang snga ma bzhin du srid pa bar ma'i rgyun gyis 'jig rten pha rol tu 'gro ste /
translated: When the body disintegrates, one goes to another world through the intermediate state, just as before.

original: srid pa'i 'khor lo thog ma med //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'khor lo thog ma med //
translated: The wheel of existence has no beginning.

original: rnam pa des na las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i skye ba dang / yang de las byung ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa rnams dang / yang de las skye ba rnams yin pas na srid pa'i 'khor lo thog ma med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa des na las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i skye ba dang / yang de las byung ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa rnams dang / yang de las skye ba rnams yin pas na srid pa'i 'khor lo thog ma med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, birth arises from the cause of action and affliction, and from that, action and affliction arise, and from that, birth arises. Therefore, the wheel of existence is without beginning.

original: thog ma zhig brtags na ni de'i rgyu med pa nyid du thal par 'gyur ro //🔽rgyu med pa nyid gcig yin na ni 'di thams cad kyang rgyu @124a * //
analyzed: thog ma zhig brtags na ni de'i rgyu med pa nyid du thal par 'gyur ro // rgyu med pa nyid gcig yin na ni 'di thams cad kyang rgyu @124a * //
translated: If a beginning were imagined, it would follow that it would be without cause.

original: med pa kho nar 'gyur ba zhig na yul dang dus so sor nges pa las myu gu la sogs pa la sa bon la sogs pa dang / chos pa la sogs pa la me la sogs pa'i nus pa yang mthong bas rgyu med pa las 'byung ba ni med do //
analyzed: med pa kho nar 'gyur ba zhig na yul dang dus so sor nges pa las myu gu la sogs pa la sa bon la sogs pa dang / chos pa la sogs pa la me la sogs pa'i nus pa yang mthong bas rgyu med pa las 'byung ba ni med do //
translated: If it were without cause, then everything would be without cause. But the power of seeds, etc. with regard to sprouts, etc. and the power of fire, etc. with regard to cooking, etc. is seen to be restricted to particular places and times. Therefore, there is no arising without cause.

original: rgyu rtog pa yod par smra ba ni sngar bsal zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu rtog pa yod par smra ba ni sngar bsal zin pa nyid do //
translated: The assertion of a cause that is imagined has already been refuted.

original: de lta bas na 'khor ba'i thog ma ni med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'khor ba'i thog ma ni med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the beginning of cyclic existence is definitely nonexistent.

original: skye ba ni rgyu la rag lus pa'i phyir rgyu zad pa las mtha' dang ldan par ni rigs te /
analyzed: skye ba ni rgyu la rag lus pa'i phyir rgyu zad pa las mtha' dang ldan par ni rigs te /
translated: Since birth is dependent on a cause, it is reasonable that it has an end due to the exhaustion of the cause,

original: sa bon zad bas myu gu bzhin no //
analyzed: sa bon zad bas myu gu bzhin no //
translated: like the exhaustion of the seed.

original: de ltar phung po'i rgyun skye ba'i gnas skabs gsum pa bstan pa gang yin pa /🔽de ni rten cing 'brel 'byung ba'i //
analyzed: de ltar phung po'i rgyun skye ba'i gnas skabs gsum pa bstan pa gang yin pa / de ni rten cing 'brel 'byung ba'i //
translated: Thus, the three phases of the continuum of the aggregates have been taught.🔽The twelve members

original: yan lag bcu gnyis cha gsum mo //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis cha gsum mo //
translated: are distributed into three phases.

original: de la yan lag bcu gnyis ni ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang /
analyzed: de la yan lag bcu gnyis ni ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang /
translated: The twelve members are ignorance, the conditioning factors, consciousness, name and form, the six sense spheres, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming,🔽birth, and old age and death.

original: skye ba dang / rga shi dang / cha gsum ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / bar dag ste /
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga shi dang / cha gsum ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / bar dag ste /
translated: The three phases are the prior limit, the subsequent limit, and the middle.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i skye ba dag yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i skye ba dag yin no //
translated: They are birth in the past, the future, and the present.

original: cha gsum po 'di dag tu yan lag bcu gnyis ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: cha gsum po 'di dag tu yan lag bcu gnyis ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: How are the twelve members distributed into these three phases?

original: sngon dang phyi mtha'i gnyis gnyis pa //
analyzed: sngon dang phyi mtha'i gnyis gnyis pa //
translated: The first and last are two by two.

original: ma rig pa dang / 'du byed rnams ni sngon gyi mthar ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / 'du byed rnams ni sngon gyi mthar ro //
translated: Ignorance and formations are at the beginning.

original: skye ba dang / rga shi ni phyi ma'i mthar ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga shi ni phyi ma'i mthar ro //
translated: Birth and aging-death are at the end.

original: lhag ma brgyad ni bar du'o //
analyzed: lhag ma brgyad ni bar du'o //
translated: The remaining eight are in the middle.

original: yang ci thams cad kyi skye ba 'di la yan lag brgyad po 'di dag yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci thams cad kyi skye ba 'di la yan lag brgyad po 'di dag yod dam zhe na /
translated: Do all beings have these eight members in this birth?

original: smras pa ; ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ; ma yin no //
translated: No, they do not.

original: 'o na su la yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na su la yod ce na /
translated: Then who has them?

original: yongs rdzogs ldan no //
analyzed: yongs rdzogs ldan no //
translated: Those who possess the complete.

original: 'di la yongs su rdzogs pa yod pas na yongs su rdzogs ldan no //
analyzed: 'di la yongs su rdzogs pa yod pas na yongs su rdzogs ldan no //
translated: One who possesses the complete is one who possesses the complete.

original: 'dir ni gang zag gang zhig gnas skabs kyi bye brag 'di thams cad la reg pa de la dgongs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir ni gang zag gang zhig gnas skabs kyi bye brag 'di thams cad la reg pa de la dgongs pa yin gyi /
translated: Here, the one who touches all of these specific states is intended.

original: gang bar ma do kho nar 'chi ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gang bar ma do kho nar 'chi ba yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not one who dies in the intermediate state,

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: nor one who is in the form or formless realms.

original: 'di ltar gleng gzhi chen po'i rnam grangs kyi mdo las kun dga' bo gal te rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du zhugs par ma gyur na zhes gsungs pa'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gang zag kho nar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gleng gzhi chen po'i rnam grangs kyi mdo las kun dga' bo gal te rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du zhugs par ma gyur na zhes gsungs pa'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gang zag kho nar bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in the Sūtra on the Categories of the Great Foundation of Mindfulness, it says, “Ānanda, if consciousness does not enter the mother’s womb,” and it is taught that it is only a person who moves in the desire realm.

original: gang gi tshe rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sngon gyi mtha' ba dang / phyi ma'i mtha' pa zhes rnam pa @124b gnyis su brjod pa de'i tshe ni tshor ba la thug pa'i bar yan lag bdun ni sngon gyi mtha' pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sngon gyi mtha' ba dang / phyi ma'i mtha' pa zhes rnam pa @124b gnyis su brjod pa de'i tshe ni tshor ba la thug pa'i bar yan lag bdun ni sngon gyi mtha' pa yin la /
translated: When dependent origination is described in two parts, the part that is prior and the part that is posterior, then the seven members up to feeling are the part that is prior.

original: lnga ni phyi ma'i mtha' pa yin te /
analyzed: lnga ni phyi ma'i mtha' pa yin te /
translated: The five are the part that is posterior,

original: sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang 'bras bu dang rgyu dang bcas pa dag smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang 'bras bu dang rgyu dang bcas pa dag smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the prior and posterior parts are mentioned along with their effects and causes.

original: yang ma rig pa la sogs pa 'di dag gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ma rig pa la sogs pa 'di dag gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are ignorance and so on?

original: ma rig nyon mongs sngon gnas skabs //
analyzed: ma rig nyon mongs sngon gnas skabs //
translated: Ignorance is the affliction in the prior state.

original: tshe snga ma la nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de ni 'di la ma rig pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshe snga ma la nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de ni 'di la ma rig pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is the state of affliction in a former lifetime is ignorance here.

original: lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir dang / de'i dbang gis de dag kun tu 'byung ba'i phyir rgyal po gshegs so zhes byas na de'i zha 'bring pa yang 'ong bar 'grub pa bzhin no //
analyzed: lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir dang / de'i dbang gis de dag kun tu 'byung ba'i phyir rgyal po gshegs so zhes byas na de'i zha 'bring pa yang 'ong bar 'grub pa bzhin no //
translated: Because they coexist and because they occur due to its power, just as when it is said that the king is coming, it is understood that his retinue is coming.

original: 'du byed dag ni sngon las kyi //🔽gnas skabs zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'du byed dag ni sngon las kyi // gnas skabs zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Formations are the state of former karma.🔽The state of former karma is formations.

original: che snga ma la bsod nams la sogs pa'i las kyi gnas skabs gang yin pa de ni 'di la 'du byed rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: che snga ma la bsod nams la sogs pa'i las kyi gnas skabs gang yin pa de ni 'di la 'du byed rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is the state of meritorious and other karma in a former lifetime is called formations here,

original: las gang gis 'dir rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: las gang gis 'dir rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: because it is karma that ripens here.

original: rnam shes mtshams sbyor phung po yin //
analyzed: rnam shes mtshams sbyor phung po yin //
translated: Consciousness is the aggregates at conception.

original: ma'i mngal du nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma la phung po lnga ni rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: ma'i mngal du nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma la phung po lnga ni rnam par shes pa yin no //
translated: The five aggregates at the moment of conception in the mother’s womb is consciousness.

original: ming dang gzugs ni de phan chad //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni de phan chad //
translated: Name and form are from that

original: skye mched drug dong tshun chad do //
analyzed: skye mched drug dong tshun chad do //
translated: until the six sense bases arise.🔽Name and form are from the moment of conception until the six sense bases arise.

original: mtshams sbyor ba'i sems phan chad nas ji srid du skye mched drug ma dod kyi bar gyi gnas skabs de ni ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba'i sems phan chad nas ji srid du skye mched drug ma dod kyi bar gyi gnas skabs de ni ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: The period of time from the moment of the linking of consciousness until the six sense spheres have developed is called name-and-form.

original: skye mched bzhi dod tshun chad do zhes brjod pa bya ba yin pa las skye mched drug ces brjod pa ni de'i tshe de rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched bzhi dod tshun chad do zhes brjod pa bya ba yin pa las skye mched drug ces brjod pa ni de'i tshe de rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The four sense spheres are developed, but it should be said that the six sense spheres are developed because they are posited at that time.

original: de ni gsum 'dus tshun chad do //
analyzed: de ni gsum 'dus tshun chad do //
translated: That is until the three meet.

original: skye mched drug dong nas ji srid du dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa dang gsum ma 'dus pa de srid kyi gnas skabs de ni skye mched drug ces bya'o zhes reg pa bde sdug la sogs kyi rgyu shes nus pa tshun chad do //
analyzed: skye mched drug dong nas ji srid du dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa dang gsum ma 'dus pa de srid kyi gnas skabs de ni skye mched drug ces bya'o zhes reg pa bde sdug la sogs kyi rgyu shes nus pa tshun chad do //
translated: The period of time from the development of the six sense spheres until the three, the faculty, object, and consciousness, meet is called the six sense spheres.

original: reg pa ni gsum 'dus te des ji srid du tshor ba gsum gyi rgyu yongs su gcod par ma nus pa'i gnas skabs de ni reg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: reg pa ni gsum 'dus te des ji srid du tshor ba gsum gyi rgyu yongs su gcod par ma nus pa'i gnas skabs de ni reg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Contact is the meeting of the three. The period of time from that until the cause of the three feelings is able to be known is called contact.

original: yongs su gcod nus nas ni /
analyzed: yongs su gcod nus nas ni /
translated: When it is able to be known,🔽it is called the sixfold base.

original: tshor 'khrig tshun chad ;
analyzed: tshor 'khrig tshun chad ;
translated: up to the stage of sexual union.

original: tshor ba'i gnas skabs ni ji srid du 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags kun tu mi spyod pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: tshor ba'i gnas skabs ni ji srid du 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags kun tu mi spyod pa'i bar ro //
translated: The stage of sensation is the period during which one does not yet engage in sexual union out of lust.

original: sred pa ni /
analyzed: sred pa ni /
translated: Craving is:

original: longs spyod 'khrig pa'i chags can gyi /🔽'dod pa'i yon tan dang / 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags kun tu spyod pa'i gnas skabs ji srid du yul yongs su tshol ba la ma @125a * //
analyzed: longs spyod 'khrig pa'i chags can gyi / 'dod pa'i yon tan dang / 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags kun tu spyod pa'i gnas skabs ji srid du yul yongs su tshol ba la ma @125a * //
translated: The craving of one who is attached to enjoyment and sexual union.

original: zhugs pa ni srid pa zhes bya'o //🔽nye bar len pa longs spyod rnams //
analyzed: zhugs pa ni srid pa zhes bya'o // nye bar len pa longs spyod rnams //
translated: The stage during which one engages in sexual union out of lust for the objects of desire and sexual union, but has not yet begun to seek out objects is called “existence.”🔽Grasping is:

original: thob par bya phyir yongs rgyug pa'i //
analyzed: thob par bya phyir yongs rgyug pa'i //
translated: The running around in order to obtain enjoyments.

original: gnas skabs gang du yul thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su tshol ba la zhugs nas thams cad du rgyug pa de ni len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs gang du yul thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su tshol ba la zhugs nas thams cad du rgyug pa de ni len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The stage during which one engages in seeking out objects in order to obtain them and runs around everywhere is called “grasping.”

original: de ltar yongs su rgyug pa na //🔽de srid 'bras bu 'byung 'gyur ba'i //
analyzed: de ltar yongs su rgyug pa na // de srid 'bras bu 'byung 'gyur ba'i //
translated: Thus, running around in this way,🔽One creates karma that will produce an effect.

original: las byed de ni srid pa yin //
analyzed: las byed de ni srid pa yin //
translated: This is called “existence.”

original: de yul rnams thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su rgyug pa na yang srid pa la sogs pa de ni de'i srid pa yin no //
analyzed: de yul rnams thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su rgyug pa na yang srid pa la sogs pa de ni de'i srid pa yin no //
translated: When it runs around in order to obtain the objects, this is its existence.

original: las des yang 'di nas shi 'phos nas tshe phyi mar nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: las des yang 'di nas shi 'phos nas tshe phyi mar nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur te /
translated: By this action, it is reborn in the next life after having died here.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba de ni skye ba yin /
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba de ni skye ba yin /
translated: This rebirth is birth.

original: 'di la rnam par shes pa'i yan lag gang yin pa de ni tshe gzhan du skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di la rnam par shes pa'i yan lag gang yin pa de ni tshe gzhan du skye ba yin no //
translated: The member which is consciousness in this life is birth in the next life.

original: de phan chad tshor ba'i bar ni rga shi yin /
analyzed: de phan chad tshor ba'i bar ni rga shi yin /
translated: From this moment on, the rest, up to sensation, is aging-and-death.

original: skye ba phan chad tshor ba'i gnas skabs kyi bar ni rga shi ste /
analyzed: skye ba phan chad tshor ba'i gnas skabs kyi bar ni rga shi ste /
translated: From the moment of rebirth, up to the moment of sensation, there is aging-and-death.

original: 'di la yan lag bzhi po ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba gang dag yin pa de dag nyid gzhan dag tu rga shi yin no //
analyzed: 'di la yan lag bzhi po ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba gang dag yin pa de dag nyid gzhan dag tu rga shi yin no //
translated: The four members, name-and-form, the six sense spheres, contact, and sensation, which are in this life, are aging-and-death in the next life.

original: de ltar na de dag ni yan lag bcu gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni yan lag bcu gnyis yin no //
translated: Thus there are twelve members.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de ni rnam pa bzhir brjod do //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de ni rnam pa bzhir brjod do //
translated: Dependent origination is explained in four ways:

original: skad cig pa dang / rgyun chags pa dang / 'brel pa can dang ; gnas skabs pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig pa dang / rgyun chags pa dang / 'brel pa can dang ; gnas skabs pa'o //
translated: momentary, continuous, related, and circumstantial.

original: skad cig ma ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig ma ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the momentary?

original: skad cig ma gcig la yan lag bcu gnyis yod pa ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig la yan lag bcu gnyis yod pa ste /
translated: In one moment there are twelve members.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: chags pa'i dbang gis srog gcod pa'i rmongs pa gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa'i dbang gis srog gcod pa'i rmongs pa gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: The delusion by which one kills through the influence of passion is ignorance.

original: sems pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni 'du byed rnams so //🔽dngos po so sor rnam par rig pa ni rnam par shes pa'o /
analyzed: sems pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni 'du byed rnams so // dngos po so sor rnam par rig pa ni rnam par shes pa'o /
translated: The volitions are the actions of body, speech, and mind.🔽The consciousness is the four aggregates associated with consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phung po bzhi ni ming dang gzugs so //🔽ming dang gzugs la rnam par gnas pa'i dbang po rnams ni skye mched drug go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phung po bzhi ni ming dang gzugs so // ming dang gzugs la rnam par gnas pa'i dbang po rnams ni skye mched drug go //
translated: Name-and-form is the four aggregates associated with name.🔽The six sense bases are the six sense faculties that are based on name-and-form.

original: skye mched drug 'dus pa ni rig pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug 'dus pa ni rig pa'o //
translated: Contact is the meeting of three.

original: reg pa nyams su myong ba ni tshor ba'o //🔽chags pa gang yin pa de ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa nyams su myong ba ni tshor ba'o //🔽chags pa gang yin pa de ni sred pa'o //
translated: Feeling is the experience of contact.🔽Craving is the desire for the experience of feeling.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i kun nas dkris pa rnams ni len pa'o //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i kun nas dkris pa rnams ni len pa'o //
translated: The entanglements associated with it are grasping.

original: des kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang / ngag gi las ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: des kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang / ngag gi las ni srid pa'o //
translated: The action of body and speech that it instigates is becoming.

original: las de rnams skye ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: las de rnams skye ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: The birth of these actions is birth.

original: yongs su smin pa ni @125b rga ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa ni @125b rga ba'o //
translated: Their maturity is old age.

original: zhig pa ni shi ba'o //
analyzed: zhig pa ni shi ba'o //
translated: Their destruction is death.

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: skad cig pa dang / 'brel pa can ni rab tu byed pa dag las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: skad cig pa dang / 'brel pa can ni rab tu byed pa dag las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: Momentary and continuous, as explained in the treatises.

original: rab tu byed pa dag las ji skad du 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa dag las ji skad du 'byung zhe na /
translated: How are they explained in the treatises?

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is dependent origination?

original: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad do //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad do //
translated: It is all conditioned things.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the things that originate in dependence?

original: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: They are all conditioned things.🔽The momentary is the five aggregates at the time of the three lifetimes, without interruption.

original: gnas skabs pa ni bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i phung po lnga'i gnas skabs tshe gsum bar chad med par 'brel ba dag yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs pa ni bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i phung po lnga'i gnas skabs tshe gsum bar chad med par 'brel ba dag yin no //
translated: The continuous is the five aggregates with their continuity.

original: de nyid rgyun chags pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de nyid rgyun chags pa yang yin no //
translated: and it is also a continuum.

original: de rnams las bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di gang las dgongs she na /
analyzed: de rnams las bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di gang las dgongs she na /
translated: From among these, what did the Bhagavat intend when he said, “Conditioned by nescience, the karmic formative forces”?

original: 'di ni gnas skabs par 'dod lo //
analyzed: 'di ni gnas skabs par 'dod lo //
translated: It is said to be the state.

original: gal te yan lag dang yan lag la phung po lnga char yod na ci'i phyir ma rig pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams kho nar bsgrags she na /
analyzed: gal te yan lag dang yan lag la phung po lnga char yod na ci'i phyir ma rig pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams kho nar bsgrags she na /
translated: If all five aggregates exist in each member, why are the members announced as the members of nescience, etc.?

original: gtso bo'i phyir na yan lag bsgrags //
analyzed: gtso bo'i phyir na yan lag bsgrags //
translated: The members are announced because of predominance.

original: ma rig pa gtso bo yin pa'i gnas skabs su ni ma rig par bshad la /
analyzed: ma rig pa gtso bo yin pa'i gnas skabs su ni ma rig par bshad la /
translated: In the state in which nescience is predominant, it is explained as nescience.

original: 'du byed gtso bo yin par ni 'du byed nas rga shi gtso bo yin pa'i bar du ni rga shi kho na bshad pas nyis pa med do //
analyzed: 'du byed gtso bo yin par ni 'du byed nas rga shi gtso bo yin pa'i bar du ni rga shi kho na bshad pas nyis pa med do //
