translated: In the state in which the formative forces are predominant, it is explained as the formative forces. In the state in which aging and death are predominant, it is explained as aging and death.

original: yang ci'i phyir mdo sde las ni yan lag bcu gnyis su gsungs la /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir mdo sde las ni yan lag bcu gnyis su gsungs la /
translated: Again, why are twelve members taught in the sutras?

original: rab tu byed pa dag las ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa dag las ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: In the Prajñapti it is said, “What is dependent origination?

original: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad do zhes gzhan du 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad do zhes gzhan du 'byung zhe na /
translated: It is all conditioned things.”

original: mdo las gsungs pa ni dgongs pa can yin no //
analyzed: mdo las gsungs pa ni dgongs pa can yin no //
translated: The Sūtra is of interpretable meaning.

original: chos mngon pa las ni mtshan nyid pa yin te /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las ni mtshan nyid pa yin te /
translated: The Abhidharma is of explicit meaning.

original: de bzhin du gnas skabs pa dang / skad cig pa dang / rgyun chags pa dang / 'brel pa can dang / sems can du ston pa dang / sems can ma yin par ston pa zhes bya ba tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas skabs pa dang / skad cig pa dang / rgyun chags pa dang / 'brel pa can dang / sems can du ston pa dang / sems can ma yin par ston pa zhes bya ba tha dad pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the Sūtra teaches the aggregates, etc., as being of duration, of moment, of series, of connection, of sentient beings, of non-sentient beings.

original: yang ci'i phyir mdo las sems can du ston pa kho na gsungs she na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir mdo las sems can du ston pa kho na gsungs she na /
translated: Why does the Sūtra teach only the aggregates as being sentient beings?🔽In order to counteract the idea that the sentient being is the owner and the enjoyer.🔽The Abhidharma teaches the aggregates, etc., as being of three types:

original: sngon dang phyi mtha' bar dag la //🔽rmongs pa rnam par bzlog phyir ro //🔽de nyid kyi phyir cha gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon dang phyi mtha' bar dag la // rmongs pa rnam par bzlog phyir ro // de nyid kyi phyir cha gsum pa yin no //
translated: of duration, of moment, and of series.🔽The aggregates, bases and elements are of three types: of duration, of moment, and of series.

original: de la sngon gyi mtha' la rmongs pa la ne 'di ji ltar bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur tam /
analyzed: de la sngon gyi mtha' la rmongs pa la ne 'di ji ltar bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur tam /
translated: The aggregates of duration are the aggregates of the past, future and present.🔽The aggregates of moment are the aggregates of a single moment.

original: 'on te byung bar ma gyur bdag ci zhig tu ni byung bar gyur /
analyzed: 'on te byung bar ma gyur bdag ci zhig tu ni byung bar gyur /
translated: The aggregates of series are the aggregates of many moments.

original: bdag ji ltar na ni byung bar gyur snyam pa'i the tshom 'di skye'o //🔽phyi ma'i mtha' @126a * //
analyzed: bdag ji ltar na ni byung bar gyur snyam pa'i the tshom 'di skye'o //🔽phyi ma'i mtha' @126a * //
translated: The bases and elements should be understood in the same way.

original: la rmongs pa la ni 'di ltar ci ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ram snyam pa rgyas par the tshom 'di skye'o //🔽bar du rmongs pa la ni 'di ltar ci zhig yin /🔽'di ji ltar yin /🔽yod pa ni ci zhig yin /
analyzed: la rmongs pa la ni 'di ltar ci ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ram snyam pa rgyas par the tshom 'di skye'o // bar du rmongs pa la ni 'di ltar ci zhig yin / 'di ji ltar yin / yod pa ni ci zhig yin /
translated: In the case of confusion with regard to the future, doubt arises in this way: “Will it arise in the future?”🔽In the case of confusion with regard to the present, doubt arises in this way: “What is it?”🔽“How is it?”🔽“What is its existence?”🔽

original: 'gyur ba ni ci zhig yin snyam pa'i the tshom 'di skye'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni ci zhig yin snyam pa'i the tshom 'di skye'o //
translated: In the case of confusion about the middle, one wonders what it is, how it is, what it exists as, and what it becomes.

original: de ltar na rmongs pa rnam pa gsum po 'di bzlog pa'i phyir mdo las rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba sems can du ston pa kho na cha gsum du bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar na rmongs pa rnam pa gsum po 'di bzlog pa'i phyir mdo las rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba sems can du ston pa kho na cha gsum du bstan te /
translated: Thus, in order to counteract these three types of confusion, the Sūtra teaches the three sections of dependent origination that reveal sentient beings:

original: ma rig pa dang / 'du byed rnams dang / skye ba dang / rga shi dang / rnam par shes pa nas srid pa'i bar dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / 'du byed rnams dang / skye ba dang / rga shi dang / rnam par shes pa nas srid pa'i bar dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: ignorance, the formative forces, birth, aging and death, and consciousness up to becoming.

original: 'di ltar mdo nyid las dge slong dag dge slong gis gang phan chad rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba de ni ci bdag 'das
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo nyid las dge slong dag dge slong gis gang phan chad rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba de ni ci bdag 'das
translated: The sutra itself states:

original: pa'i dus na byung bar gyur tam snyam du sngon gyi mtha' la 'brang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: pa'i dus na byung bar gyur tam snyam du sngon gyi mtha' la 'brang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: Monks, when a monk sees dependent origination and the phenomena that arise dependently with correct wisdom in this way and in just this manner, he does not pursue the prior limit, thinking, “Did I exist in the past?”

original: gzhan dag na re phyi ma'i mtha' la rmongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dag kyang bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re phyi ma'i mtha' la rmongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dag kyang bstan te /
translated: Others say: Craving, grasping, and existence are taught in order to stop confusion about the future.

original: 'di dag ni de kho na'i rgyu yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni de kho na'i rgyu yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: They are the causes of that alone.

original: yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis pa de ni nyon mongs pa dang / las dang bzhi ngag dang / gsum gyi rang bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis pa de ni nyon mongs pa dang / las dang bzhi ngag dang / gsum gyi rang bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: Again, it should be understood that the twelve factors of dependent origination have the nature of three: affliction, action, and a basis.

original: de la nyon mongs gsum mo //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs gsum mo //
translated: Three are affliction.

original: yan lag gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin can te /
analyzed: yan lag gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin can te /
translated: Three members are of the nature of defilement:

original: ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / len pa rnams so //🔽las gnyis so //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / len pa rnams so // las gnyis so //
translated: ignorance, craving, and grasping.

original: yan lag gnyis ne las kyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: yan lag gnyis ne las kyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: Two members are of the nature of action:

original: 'du byed dang / srid pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed dang / srid pa'o //
translated: volitions and becoming.🔽Seven members are of the nature of a basis:

original: gzhi bdun / yan lag bdun po rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / skye ba dang / rga shi rnams ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir gzhi'i yan lag yin no //🔽ji ltar yan lag bdun gzhi yin pa de bzhin 'bras bu yin /
analyzed: gzhi bdun / yan lag bdun po rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / skye ba dang / rga shi rnams ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir gzhi'i yan lag yin no // ji ltar yan lag bdun gzhi yin pa de bzhin 'bras bu yin /
translated: consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense-spheres, contact, feeling, birth, and old-age-and-death.🔽Just as the seven members are a basis, so they are a result.

original: yan lag bdun po nyid 'bras bur gyur pa dag yin no //
analyzed: yan lag bdun po nyid 'bras bur gyur pa dag yin no //
translated: The seven members are a result.

original: lhag ma lnga ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin yin ba'i phyir rgyur gyur pa dag yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma lnga ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin yin ba'i phyir rgyur gyur pa dag yin no //
translated: The remaining five members are a cause, because they are of the nature of action and defilement.

original: yang @126b ci'i phyir gzhi rnam pa lnga dang nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis tha dad pa'i phyir dbus su ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag rgya cher bskyed la /
analyzed: yang @126b ci'i phyir gzhi rnam pa lnga dang nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis tha dad pa'i phyir dbus su ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag rgya cher bskyed la /
translated: Why is the cause extensively explained in the middle, because the five bases and two kinds of affliction are distinct?

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su ni rnam pa gnyis tha dad pa'i phyir 'bras bu mdor bsdus /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su ni rnam pa gnyis tha dad pa'i phyir 'bras bu mdor bsdus /
translated: Why is the result briefly explained in the future, because the two kinds are distinct?

original: 'das pa'i dus su ni nyon mongs pa sgo gcig tu bstan pa'i phyir rgyu mdor bsdus she na /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus su ni nyon mongs pa sgo gcig tu bstan pa'i phyir rgyu mdor bsdus she na /
translated: Why is the cause briefly explained in the past, because the affliction is taught as one door?

original: gnyis kyi rgyu 'bras mdor bsdus pa //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rgyu 'bras mdor bsdus pa //
translated: The cause and result of the two are briefly explained.

original: bar ma'i rjes su dpag pa las //
analyzed: bar ma'i rjes su dpag pa las //
translated: From the inference of the middle,

original: bar ma kho nas sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyas par rjes su dpag par nus pas ma bshad de /
analyzed: bar ma kho nas sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyas par rjes su dpag par nus pas ma bshad de /
translated: the cause and result of the beginning and end are inferred only by the middle, so they are not explained.

original: yang don med pa'i 'bad pa ma byas so //
analyzed: yang don med pa'i 'bad pa ma byas so //
translated: One should not make useless effort.

original: gal te yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis kho na yin na de lta na go / ma rig pa'i rgyu ma bstan pa'i phyir 'khor ba thog ma can du yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis kho na yin na de lta na go / ma rig pa'i rgyu ma bstan pa'i phyir 'khor ba thog ma can du yang 'gyur la /
translated: If dependent origination consists of only twelve members, then samsara would have a beginning, because the cause of ignorance is not indicated.

original: rga shi'i 'bras bu ma bstan pa'i phyir mtha' dang ldan par yang 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rga shi'i 'bras bu ma bstan pa'i phyir mtha' dang ldan par yang 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Or, samsara would have an end, because the effect of aging and death is not indicated.

original: yang na ni yan lag gzhan gyis kha bskang dgos so //
analyzed: yang na ni yan lag gzhan gyis kha bskang dgos so //
translated: Or, it would be necessary to add other members.

original: de la yang gzhan zhig yod na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang gzhan zhig yod na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If there were others, there would be an infinite regress.

original: kha bskang bar bya mi dgos te /
analyzed: kha bskang bar bya mi dgos te /
translated: It is not necessary to add other members.

original: 'di ltar 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Because the Lord has already taught:

original: nyon mongs pa las nyon mongs dang // bya ba nyid do de las gzhi //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las nyon mongs dang // bya ba nyid do de las gzhi //
translated: From the afflictions arise the afflictions and karma. From that arises the basis.

original: de las gzhi dang nyon mongs skyes//
analyzed: de las gzhi dang nyon mongs skyes//
translated: From that arises the basis and the afflictions.

original: 'di ni srid pa'i yan lag lugs //🔽zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'di ni srid pa'i yan lag lugs // zhes bstan zin to //
translated: This is the system of the members of existence.

original: nyon mongs pa las nyon mongs pa skye ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las nyon mongs pa skye ste /
translated: From the afflictions arise the afflictions.

original: sred pa las len pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa las len pa'o //
translated: From craving arises grasping.

original: nyon mongs pa las las te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las las te /
translated: From the afflictions arises karma.

original: len pa las ni srid pa dang / ma rig pa las 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: len pa las ni srid pa dang / ma rig pa las 'du byed rnams so //
translated: From grasping comes existence, and from ignorance come the formations.

original: las las gzhi ste /
analyzed: las las gzhi ste /
translated: From action comes the basis.

original: 'du byed rnams las rnam par shes pa dang / srid pa las skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams las rnam par shes pa dang / srid pa las skye ba'o //
translated: From the formations comes consciousness, and from existence comes birth.

original: gzhi las gzhi ste /
analyzed: gzhi las gzhi ste /
translated: From the basis comes the basis.

original: rnam par shes pa las ming dang gzugs nas reg pa las tshor ba'i bar dang / skye ba las rga shi'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las ming dang gzugs nas reg pa las tshor ba'i bar dang / skye ba las rga shi'o //
translated: From consciousness comes name-and-form, and from name-and-form, in order, come the six sense spheres, contact, and feeling. From birth comes aging-and-death.

original: gzhi las nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhi las nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: From the basis comes the defilement.

original: tshor ba las srid pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba las srid pa'o //
translated: From feeling comes craving.

original: gang gi phyir srid pa'i yan lag rnams kyi lugs de ltar rnam par gzhag pa de'i phyir ma rig pa nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin yang gzhi 'am nyon mongs pa las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir srid pa'i yan lag rnams kyi lugs de ltar rnam par gzhag pa de'i phyir ma rig pa nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin yang gzhi 'am nyon mongs pa las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin la /
translated: Since the order of the members of existence is established in this way, it is shown that ignorance, which has the nature of defilement, arises from the basis or from defilement.

original: rga shi ni tshor ba la thug pa'i gzhi las kyang nyon mongs pa 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa yin pas yang 'di la kha bskang bar bya ba cung zad @127a * //
analyzed: rga shi ni tshor ba la thug pa'i gzhi las kyang nyon mongs pa 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa yin pas yang 'di la kha bskang bar bya ba cung zad @127a * //
translated: And it is shown that from the basis, up to feeling, defilement arises again.

original: kyang med de ;
analyzed: kyang med de ;
translated: Therefore, there is not the slightest need to supplement this explanation.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig yang dag par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig yang dag par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, this great mass of suffering comes into being.

original: de lta ma yin na 'di'i nus pa ci zhig yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'di'i nus pa ci zhig yod par 'gyur /
translated: If it were not so, what would be the point of this statement?

original: gzhan dag na re mdo gzhan las ma rig pa yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mdo gzhan las ma rig pa yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
translated: Other masters say: In another Sūtra, it is said that ignorance has incorrect mental application as its cause,

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yang ma rig pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //🔽zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yang ma rig pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no // zhes gsungs la /
translated: and incorrect mental application has ignorance as its cause.

original: de ni 'dir yang len pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir bshad pa yin no zhes zer te /🔽tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa /
analyzed: de ni 'dir yang len pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir bshad pa yin no zhes zer te / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa /
translated: Since this is also included in grasping, it is not mentioned separately here.

original: len pa'i nang du ji ltar 'dus /
analyzed: len pa'i nang du ji ltar 'dus /
translated: How is incorrect mental application included in grasping?

original: gal te mtshungs par ldan pa las yin no zhe na ni srid pa dang ma rig pa dag gi nang du yang de 'dus par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mtshungs par ldan pa las yin no zhe na ni srid pa dang ma rig pa dag gi nang du yang de 'dus par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is included by association, then existence and ignorance would also be included in grasping.

original: nang du 'dus pa yin du chug na yang ji ltar 'dir ma rig pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes bya bar bstan pa yin /
analyzed: nang du 'dus pa yin du chug na yang ji ltar 'dir ma rig pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes bya bar bstan pa yin /
translated: Even if it were included, how could it be demonstrated that ignorance arises from the cause of non-accurate attention?

original: gal te nang du 'dus pa kho nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por shes par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te nang du 'dus pa kho nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por shes par 'gyur na /
translated: If the relationship of cause and effect were understood merely through inclusion,

original: 'o na ni sred pa dang ma rig pa dag kyang de'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir yan lag gzhan nyid du mi bya bar nus so //
analyzed: 'o na ni sred pa dang ma rig pa dag kyang de'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir yan lag gzhan nyid du mi bya bar nus so //
translated: then craving and ignorance would also be included and it would be impossible to posit them as separate limbs.

original: gzhan dag na re mdo gzhan las ma rig pa'i rgyu tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin par gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mdo gzhan las ma rig pa'i rgyu tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin par gsungs te /
translated: Others say: A different sūtra declares that the cause of ignorance is non-accurate attention.

original: de yang mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas gti mug las skyes pa'i yid la byed pa'i rnyog pa skye'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir reg pa'i dus su bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas gti mug las skyes pa'i yid la byed pa'i rnyog pa skye'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir reg pa'i dus su bstan pa yin la /
translated: It is said that the turbidity of attention that arises from delusion arises in dependence on the eye and form.

original: mdo gzhan las ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba la brten nas sred pa skye'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir tshor ba'i dus su yang ma rig pa gdon mi za bar yod do /
analyzed: mdo gzhan las ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba la brten nas sred pa skye'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir tshor ba'i dus su yang ma rig pa gdon mi za bar yod do /
translated: Because another sutra declares, “Craving arises in dependence on feeling that arises from contact that is accompanied by ignorance,” ignorance definitely exists at the time of feeling.

original: de lta bas na reg pa'i dus na yod pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni tshor ba dang lhan cig 'jug pa'i ma rig pa'i rkyen gyi ngo bor grub pas ma rig pa rgyu med pa nyid kyang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de lta bas na reg pa'i dus na yod pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni tshor ba dang lhan cig 'jug pa'i ma rig pa'i rkyen gyi ngo bor grub pas ma rig pa rgyu med pa nyid kyang ma yin zhing /
translated: Thus, incorrect attention that exists at the time of contact is established as the cause of ignorance that occurs simultaneously with feeling. Therefore ignorance is not causeless.

original: yan lag gzhan gyis kha bskang bar yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag gzhan gyis kha bskang bar yang mi bya'o //
translated: Nor is it necessary to supplement this with other factors.

original: thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that this would lead to an infinite regress,

original: gti mug las skyes pa'i yid la byed pa rnyog pa zhes 'byung bas tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa de yang gti mug las skyes par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gti mug las skyes pa'i yid la byed pa rnyog pa zhes 'byung bas tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa de yang gti mug las skyes par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because incorrect attention is said to arise from delusion, since it is said, “Attention born from delusion is turbid.”

original: 'o na ni de ni gzhan du gsungs pas 'dir @127b yang brjod par bya dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni de ni gzhan du gsungs pas 'dir @127b yang brjod par bya dgos so zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, since it is stated elsewhere, it must be mentioned here as well.

original: brjod par bya mi dgos so //
analyzed: brjod par bya mi dgos so //
translated: It need not be mentioned.

original: ma brjod bzhin du ji ltar go zhe na rigs pa las so //
analyzed: ma brjod bzhin du ji ltar go zhe na rigs pa las so //
translated: How is it understood without being mentioned? By reasoning.

original: rigs pa gang gis she na /
analyzed: rigs pa gang gis she na /
translated: By what reasoning?

original: dgra bcom pa rnams kyi tshor ba ma rig pa med pa ni sred pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams kyi tshor ba ma rig pa med pa ni sred pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
translated: The feeling of arhats, which is devoid of ignorance, is not a condition for craving.

original: phyin ci log med pa'i srid pa yang nyon mongs pa can gyi tshor ba'i rkyen ma yin la /
analyzed: phyin ci log med pa'i srid pa yang nyon mongs pa can gyi tshor ba'i rkyen ma yin la /
translated: And craving that is not distorted is not a condition for afflicted feeling.🔽And the contact of arhats, which is devoid of ignorance, is not distorted.

original: dgra bcom pa ma rig pa med pa'i reg pa yang phyin ci log ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pa 'dis so //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ma rig pa med pa'i reg pa yang phyin ci log ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pa 'dis so //
translated: This is the reasoning.

original: ji snyed rigs pas 'thad pa de snyed ma bshad bzhin du yang go bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: ji snyed rigs pas 'thad pa de snyed ma bshad bzhin du yang go bar 'gyur na /
translated: If it is understood by reasoning, then it need not be mentioned.

original: de lta na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if that is so, then there is the fault of overextension.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni lan ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni lan ma yin no //
translated: Therefore this is not a proper response.

original: ma rig pa dang / rga shi dag las gzhan ma bstan pa'i phyir 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma dang ldan par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni klan kar mi rung ba kho na yin la ma tshang bar bstan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / rga shi dag las gzhan ma bstan pa'i phyir 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma dang ldan par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni klan kar mi rung ba kho na yin la ma tshang bar bstan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: This is an improper objection, and it is not the case that the teaching is incomplete.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na //🔽'dir ni ji ltar na 'jig rten pha rol nas 'jig rten 'dir /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na // 'dir ni ji ltar na 'jig rten pha rol nas 'jig rten 'dir /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jig rten 'di nas yang 'jig rten pha rol du 'brel snyam du 'jug pa la rmongs pa'i gdul ba rnams la de tsam zhig brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di nas yang 'jig rten pha rol du 'brel snyam du 'jug pa la rmongs pa'i gdul ba rnams la de tsam zhig brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir la /
translated: Here, the Teacher wishes to explain just this much to disciples who are confused about how to connect this world to the next world and the next world to this world.

original: de ni // sngon dang phyi mtha'i bar dag la //
analyzed: de ni // sngon dang phyi mtha'i bar dag la //
translated: And that is stated in the following:

original: rmongs pa rnam par bzlog phyir ro //
analyzed: rmongs pa rnam par bzlog phyir ro //
translated: In order to reverse confusion🔽about the beginning and end and the middle.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis sngar bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis sngar bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is explained above.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag khyed la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams kyang bstan par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag khyed la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams kyang bstan par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: The Fortunate One said: “Monks, I will teach you dependent origination and the factors that are dependently originated.

original: yang de dag la khyad par ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: yang de dag la khyad par ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between these two?

original: re zhig bsnyan  bcos las ni khyad par cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: re zhig bsnyan  bcos las ni khyad par cung zad kyang med de /
translated: In the treatises, there is no difference between the two.

original: gnyi ga yang 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad yin par gsungs so //🔽da ni ji ltar na ma 'ongs pa ma byung ba rnams rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dag ces bya /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad yin par gsungs so // da ni ji ltar na ma 'ongs pa ma byung ba rnams rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dag ces bya /
translated: Both refer to all conditioned factors.🔽But how can future factors, which are not yet come into existence, be dependently originated?

original: re zhig ma 'ongs pa ma byas pa rnams kho na yang ji ltar na 'dus byas dag ces bya /
analyzed: re zhig ma 'ongs pa ma byas pa rnams kho na yang ji ltar na 'dus byas dag ces bya /
translated: How can future factors, which are not yet produced, be conditioned?

original: mngon par 'du byed pa'i sems pas bsams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa'i sems pas bsams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are intended by the volition that produces them.

original: zag pa med pa rnams ji ltar /
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams ji ltar /
translated: But how can unconditioned factors be dependently originated?

original: de dag kyang thob par bya ba'i phyir sems pa dge bas bsams pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang thob par bya ba'i phyir sems pa dge bas bsams pa dag yin no //
translated: Because they are intended by the wholesome volition that seeks to acquire them.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And nirvana would also be a link.

original: de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir de kho na bzhin du mthun par bsgres pa yin te /
analyzed: de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir de kho na bzhin du mthun par bsgres pa yin te /
translated: It is applied in the same way, because it is similar to that.

original: dper na re zhig gzugs su ni rung ba yang @128a * //
analyzed: dper na re zhig gzugs su ni rung ba yang @128a * //
translated: For example, something that is suitable as form is called form,

original: de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir gzugs zhes bya ba bzhin pas de ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir gzugs zhes bya ba bzhin pas de ni nyes pa med do //
translated: because it is similar to that. Therefore there is no fault.

original: mdo'i dgongs pa ni /
analyzed: mdo'i dgongs pa ni /
translated: The intention of the sutra is this:

original: 'dir ni 'byung ba rgyu yin te //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'byung ba rgyu yin te //
translated: Here, the cause is the link,

original: byung ba 'bras bu yin par 'dod //
analyzed: byung ba 'bras bu yin par 'dod //
translated: and the effect is the link.

original: ces pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: ces pa 'di yin te /
translated: This is the intention of the sutra.

original: rgyur gyur pa'i yan lag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa'i yan lag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The link that is a cause is dependent origination,

original: 'di las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises from this.

original: 'bras bur gyur pa'i yan lag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa'i yan lag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ste /
translated: The link that is an effect is dependent origination,

original: de ltar na yan lag thams cad kyang rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i phyir gnyi gar 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yan lag thams cad kyang rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i phyir gnyi gar 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: because it arises from that. Thus all links are established as both cause and effect.

original: de lta yin yang ltos pa'i bye brag gis rnam par gzhag pa med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin yang ltos pa'i bye brag gis rnam par gzhag pa med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that they are not posited through the distinctions of dependence.

original: gang la ltos nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa yin pa de nyid la ltos nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la ltos nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa yin pa de nyid la ltos nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de ma yin te /
translated: That which is dependent origination in dependence on one thing is not dependent origination in dependence on another thing.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu bzhin dang pha dang bu bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu bzhin dang pha dang bu bzhin no //
translated: For example, a cause and its result and a father and his son.

original: gnas brtan bsam rdzogs na re /🔽rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: gnas brtan bsam rdzogs na re / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin la /
translated: The elder Samghabhadra says:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos dag ma yin pa yang yod do zhes bya ba mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos dag ma yin pa yang yod do zhes bya ba mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four possibilities: that which is dependent origination but is not a dependently arisen phenomenon,🔽and so on.

original: mu dang po ni chos ma 'ongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: mu dang po ni chos ma 'ongs pa rnams so //
translated: The first possibility is future phenomena.

original: gnyis pa ni dgra bcom pa'i chos tha ma 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dgra bcom pa'i chos tha ma 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams so //
translated: The second is past and present phenomena of arhats.

original: gsum pa ni de las gzhan pa'i chos 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: gsum pa ni de las gzhan pa'i chos 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams so //
translated: The third is past and present phenomena other than that.

original: bzhi pa ni chos 'dus ma byas rnams so zhes zer ro zhes grag go //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni chos 'dus ma byas rnams so zhes zer ro zhes grag go //
translated: The fourth is unconditioned phenomena.

original: 'dir mdo sde pa rnams rgol bar bye de /
analyzed: 'dir mdo sde pa rnams rgol bar bye de /
translated: Here the Sautrantikas object:

original: ci 'di dag gang zhig gang 'dod pa'i 'dod rgyal du 'chad pa zhig gam /
analyzed: ci 'di dag gang zhig gang 'dod pa'i 'dod rgyal du 'chad pa zhig gam /
translated: Are these explanations of the twelve factors of dependent origination in terms of the three times and so on just the personal opinions of the Vaibhasikas?

original: 'on te mdo'i don yin /
analyzed: 'on te mdo'i don yin /
translated: Or are they the meaning of the sutras?

original: smras pa / mdo'i don yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / mdo'i don yin no //
translated: They are the meaning of the sutras.

original: gal te mdo'i don yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mdo'i don yin no zhe na /
translated: If they are the meaning of the sutras,

original: 'di ni mdo'i don ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mdo'i don ma yin no //
translated: then they are not the meaning of the sutras.

original: ji ltar zhe na re zhig gnas skabs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di ni bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i phung po lnga'i gnas skabs kyi yan lag bcu gnyis pa dag yin no zhes gang smras pa ni mdo dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na re zhig gnas skabs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di ni bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i phung po lnga'i gnas skabs kyi yan lag bcu gnyis pa dag yin no zhes gang smras pa ni mdo dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: How so? First, the statement that the twelve factors of dependent origination in terms of the present are the twelve factors of the present five aggregates is contradicted by the sutras.🔽The sutra states:

original: mdo las ni ma rig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mdo las ni ma rig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is ignorance?

original: smras pa / sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa gang yin pa'o zhes rgyas par gsungs te /
analyzed: smras pa / sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa gang yin pa'o zhes rgyas par gsungs te /
translated: It is not knowing the former and latter ends.

original: nges pa'i don gang yin pa de ni drang ba'i don ma yin pas 'di ni mdo'i don ma yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i don gang yin pa de ni drang ba'i don ma yin pas 'di ni mdo'i don ma yin no //
translated: Since that which is of definitive meaning is not of provisional meaning, this is not the meaning of the sutra.

original: bstan pa'i sgo nas thams cad nges pa'i don kho na yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bstan pa'i sgo nas thams cad nges pa'i don kho na yang ma yin gyi /
translated: Not all teachings are of definitive meaning.

original: gtso bo ji lta bar bstan par yang mdzad de /🔽dper na glang po che'i rjes lta bu las /
analyzed: gtso bo ji lta bar bstan par yang mdzad de / dper na glang po che'i rjes lta bu las /
translated: The root text also teaches the principal elements.🔽For example, the passage beginning “What is the earth element?”

original: sa'i @128b khams gang zhe na zhes bya ba'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sa'i @128b khams gang zhe na zhes bya ba'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di lta ste /
translated: is like the simile of the elephant’s footprint.

original: skra dang kha spu dag go zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: skra dang kha spu dag go zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: Hair and body hair are said to be the earth element.

original: de dag la ni gzugs la sogs pa gzhan yang yod de /
analyzed: de dag la ni gzugs la sogs pa gzhan yang yod de /
translated: But other forms and so on also exist in hair and body hair.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang gtso bo ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang gtso bo ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the root text teaches the principal elements here.

original: 'di ni dpe ma yin te /🔽de las ni gang gis na de dag ma rdzogs par bstan par 'gyur ba sa'i khams kyi skra la sogs pa ston pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang de las ni skra la sogs pa dag kho nas sa'i khams ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni dpe ma yin te / de las ni gang gis na de dag ma rdzogs par bstan par 'gyur ba sa'i khams kyi skra la sogs pa ston pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang de las ni skra la sogs pa dag kho nas sa'i khams ston pa yin te /
translated: This is not a good example.🔽The passage does not teach that hair and so on are the earth element, but rather that the earth element is taught by hair and so on.

original: skra la sogs pa ma gtogs pa yang sa'i khams med pas 'di rdzogs par bstan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: skra la sogs pa ma gtogs pa yang sa'i khams med pas 'di rdzogs par bstan pa kho na yin no //
translated: Since the earth element does not exist apart from hair and so on, it is taught completely.

original: de bzhin du 'di las kyang ma rig pa la sogs pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa kho nar bstan pa yin gyi lhag ma dang bcas par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di las kyang ma rig pa la sogs pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa kho nar bstan pa yin gyi lhag ma dang bcas par ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, here, ignorance and the other members are taught in their entirety, not in part.

original: skra la sogs pa ma gtogs par yang mchi ma dang / mchil ma dang / snabs la sogs pa dag la sa'i khams yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: skra la sogs pa ma gtogs par yang mchi ma dang / mchil ma dang / snabs la sogs pa dag la sa'i khams yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But, you say, in tears, mucus, saliva, etc., which are not included in the head hairs, etc., there is earth element.

original: de yang bstan zin pa nyid de /
analyzed: de yang bstan zin pa nyid de /
translated: This is not so, for it has been taught:

original: lus 'di la gzhan yang zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus 'di la gzhan yang zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this body, there is also the other.

original: yang na gal te de kho na dang 'dra bar bstan par nus na ma rig pa'i lhag ma yod la rag go //
analyzed: yang na gal te de kho na dang 'dra bar bstan par nus na ma rig pa'i lhag ma yod la rag go //
translated: Or else, if it were possible to teach in the same way, there would be a remainder of ignorance.

original: rigs tha dad pa ni ma rig par ci'i phyir bstan /
analyzed: rigs tha dad pa ni ma rig par ci'i phyir bstan /
translated: Why is the difference in type of the members taught?

original: gnas skabs de dag la phung po lnga char yod du zin kyang gang zhig yod dam med na gang yod pa dang med par nges pa de kho na yan lag yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs de dag la phung po lnga char yod du zin kyang gang zhig yod dam med na gang yod pa dang med par nges pa de kho na yan lag yin no //
translated: Even though the five aggregates exist in these states, that which is ascertained to exist or not to exist when this or that exists or does not exist is a member.

original: dgra bcom pa la phung po lnga yod kyang 'du byed rnams kyang mi 'byung la /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la phung po lnga yod kyang 'du byed rnams kyang mi 'byung la /
translated: Even though the five aggregates exist in an arhat, formations do not occur.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sred pa la sogs pa yang ma yin pas mdo'i don ni ji skad bstan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sred pa la sogs pa yang ma yin pas mdo'i don ni ji skad bstan pa kho na yin no //
translated: The meaning of the sutra is just as we have explained it.

original: mu bzhir bshad pa gang yin pa de la yang /
analyzed: mu bzhir bshad pa gang yin pa de la yang /
translated: As for the four possibilities that were explained,🔽if future dharmas are dependent origination, then it contradicts the sutra that states,

original: gal te chos ma 'ongs pa rnams rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin nam rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: gal te chos ma 'ongs pa rnams rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin nam rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the dharmas that are dependent origination?

original: ma rig pa nas rga shi'i bar dag yin no zhes gsungs pa'i mdo dang 'gal lo//
analyzed: ma rig pa nas rga shi'i bar dag yin no zhes gsungs pa'i mdo dang 'gal lo//
translated: They are ignorance, etc., up to old age and death.”

original: yang na skye ba dang / rga shi'i yan lag dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus su rnam par gzhag par mi 'dod par bya dgos pas cha gsum du dgod pa rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na skye ba dang / rga shi'i yan lag dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus su rnam par gzhag par mi 'dod par bya dgos pas cha gsum du dgod pa rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, you must not assert that the members of birth and old age and death are posited in the future, and thus the tripartite formulation would be undermined.

original: de sde pa gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: de sde pa gzhan dag na re /
translated: Other schools say:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung chos nyid 'di dag ni gnas pa @129a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung chos nyid 'di dag ni gnas pa @129a * //
translated: Whether the tathāgatas arise or not, these dharmas of reality remain.

original: kho na'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni 'dus ma byas yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kho na'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni 'dus ma byas yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Dependent origination is unconditioned.

original: de ni dgongs pa'i dbang gas de bzhin yang yin la de bzhin yang ma yin no /
analyzed: de ni dgongs pa'i dbang gas de bzhin yang yin la de bzhin yang ma yin no /
translated: This is so in one sense, but not in another sense.

original: re zhig ji ltar de bzhin yin //
analyzed: re zhig ji ltar de bzhin yin //
translated: In what sense is it so?

original: yang na ji ltar na de bzhin ma yin zhe na /🔽gal te dgongs pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung rtag tu ma rig pa la sogs pa dag la brten nas 'du byed la sogs pa rnam pa kun tu 'byung gi ma brten par ram /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar na de bzhin ma yin zhe na / gal te dgongs pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung rtag tu ma rig pa la sogs pa dag la brten nas 'du byed la sogs pa rnam pa kun tu 'byung gi ma brten par ram /
translated: In what sense is it not so?

original: gzhan dag la brten nas ni nam yang ma yin pas rten cing 'brel pa ni rtag pa'o zhes bya ba yin no zhe na ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag la brten nas ni nam yang ma yin pas rten cing 'brel pa ni rtag pa'o zhes bya ba yin no zhe na ni /
translated: If the intention is this: Whether the Tathagatas arise or not, it is always on the basis of ignorance, etc., that the formations, etc., originate in every way, not without a basis, or on the basis of other things.🔽Thus dependent origination is permanent.

original: de de bzhin no zhes gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de de bzhin no zhes gzung bar bya'o //
translated: This is so in one sense.

original: 'on te dgongs pa 'di rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba dngos po gzhan rtag pa cung zad cig yod do zhes bya ba yin no zhe na ni de de lta ma yin no zhes dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te dgongs pa 'di rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba dngos po gzhan rtag pa cung zad cig yod do zhes bya ba yin no zhe na ni de de lta ma yin no zhes dgag par bya'o //
translated: But if this intention is that some other thing called dependent origination exists as a permanent entity, then that is to be refuted: “It is not so!”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'byung ba ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because origination is a characteristic of the conditioned.

original: dngos po gzhan rtag pa ni mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid yin par yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan rtag pa ni mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid yin par yang mi rung ngo //
translated: And it is not possible for a permanent entity to be a characteristic of the impermanent.

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba yin pa'i phyir 'di ma rig pa la sogs pa dang ci zhig 'brel na gang gi phyir de dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes brjod par 'gyur /🔽rtag pa zhes kyang bya la /
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba yin pa'i phyir 'di ma rig pa la sogs pa dang ci zhig 'brel na gang gi phyir de dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes brjod par 'gyur / rtag pa zhes kyang bya la /
translated: Since origination is production, what connection is there between it and ignorance, etc., that it is said to be dependent origination?🔽It would be both permanent and dependent origination.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes kyang bya bas tshig gi don kyang nus pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes kyang bya bas tshig gi don kyang nus pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus the meaning of the words would be meaningless.

original: yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the term dependent origination?

original: rten cing 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni phrad pa'i don to //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni phrad pa'i don to //
translated: Pratitya means “having met” or “having contacted.”

original: ai ti ni 'gro ba'i don to //
analyzed: ai ti ni 'gro ba'i don to //
translated: Iti means “going.”

original: nye bar bsgyur ba'i dbang gis skad kyi dbyings kyi don yongs su bsgyur ba'i phyir phrad nas zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa de ni rten cing 'brel te zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: nye bar bsgyur ba'i dbang gis skad kyi dbyings kyi don yongs su bsgyur ba'i phyir phrad nas zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa de ni rten cing 'brel te zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: Since the meaning of the verbal root is transformed by the influence of the prefix, the meaning of “having met” is the meaning of “having depended.”

original: pa da ni yod pa'i don to //
analyzed: pa da ni yod pa'i don to //
translated: Pada means “existing.”

original: sam dang aud gong na yod na 'byung ba'i don to //
analyzed: sam dang aud gong na yod na 'byung ba'i don to //
translated: Sam and ud above mean “arising.”

original: des na phrad nas 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: des na phrad nas 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, arising from contact is dependent origination.

original: tshig gi don 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig gi don 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not the meaning of the term.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: byed pa po gcig gis bya ba gnyis ni dus sngar te zhes bya ba'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: byed pa po gcig gis bya ba gnyis ni dus sngar te zhes bya ba'i rkyen yin te /
translated: The condition of “having met” is the condition of “having depended.”

original: dper na khrus byas te bza'o zhes bya ba lta bu yin no sngar phrad nas phyis skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni skye ba'i sngon rol na 'ga' yang med la /
analyzed: dper na khrus byas te bza'o zhes bya ba lta bu yin no sngar phrad nas phyis skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni skye ba'i sngon rol na 'ga' yang med la /
translated: But that which has already come into existence and will arise later does not exist prior to arising.

original: byed pa po med pa'i bya ba yang med do //
analyzed: byed pa po med pa'i bya ba yang med do //
translated: And there is no action without an agent.

original: @129b 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: @129b 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: gal te 'byung sngon phrad nas yin //
analyzed: gal te 'byung sngon phrad nas yin //
translated: If it is prior to the elements,

original: med phyir rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: med phyir rung ba ma yin no //
translated: it is not tenable, because it does not exist.

original: gal te lhan cig 'dir de ni //
analyzed: gal te lhan cig 'dir de ni //
translated: If it is simultaneous,

original: ma grub sngon du byed phyir ro //
analyzed: ma grub sngon du byed phyir ro //
translated: that is not established, because it is prior to the action.

original: 'di ni nyes pa med de //
analyzed: 'di ni nyes pa med de //
translated: We reply: This is not a fault.

original: re zhig sgra pa la gnas skabs gang gis chos zhig skye /
analyzed: re zhig sgra pa la gnas skabs gang gis chos zhig skye /
translated: First, let us ask the Sūtra-followers: By what state does a dharma arise—

original: da lta'i 'am 'on te ma 'ongs pa zhig ces bya ba 'di bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: da lta'i 'am 'on te ma 'ongs pa zhig ces bya ba 'di bri bar bya'o //
translated: in the present or in the future?

original: de las cir 'gyur /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur /
translated: What follows from this?

original: ci ste da lta'i zhig skye'o zhe na ni //
analyzed: ci ste da lta'i zhig skye'o zhe na ni //
translated: If you say that it arises in the present,

original: gal te ma skyes na ji ltar da ltar yin /
analyzed: gal te ma skyes na ji ltar da ltar yin /
translated: if it has not yet arisen, how can it be present?

original: 'on te skyes zin pa zhig yang skye na ni thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te skyes zin pa zhig yang skye na ni thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you say that that which has already arisen arises again, then it follows that there is an infinite regress.

original: ci ste ma 'ongs pa zhig skye'o zhe na //🔽med pa ji ltar byed pa po nyid dam /
analyzed: ci ste ma 'ongs pa zhig skye'o zhe na // med pa ji ltar byed pa po nyid dam /
translated: But if you say that it is the future that arises,🔽how can a non-existent be an agent?

original: byed pa po med pa'i bya ba 'grub /
analyzed: byed pa po med pa'i bya ba 'grub /
translated: Or how can an action be accomplished without an agent?

original: de'i phyir gnas skabs gang skye ba'i gnas skabs de nyid dang phrad nas zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas skabs gang skye ba'i gnas skabs de nyid dang phrad nas zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, it is like saying that it arises having come into contact with the state in which it arises.

original: gnas skabs gang zhig skye zhe na /
analyzed: gnas skabs gang zhig skye zhe na /
translated: In what state does it arise?

original: skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i ma 'ongs pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i ma 'ongs pa ste /
translated: It is the future that is about to arise.

original: gnas skabs de kho na rkyen dang phrad nas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs de kho na rkyen dang phrad nas zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said that it arises having come into contact with that state.

original: sgra pa'i 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sgra pa'i 'di lta ste /
translated: The Grammarians say:

original: byed pa po dang bya ba rnam par 'jog pa 'di yang grub pa ma yin te /🔽skye'o zhes bya ba 'di ni byed pa po yin la /
analyzed: byed pa po dang bya ba rnam par 'jog pa 'di yang grub pa ma yin te / skye'o zhes bya ba 'di ni byed pa po yin la /
translated: This establishment of the agent and action is not established.

original: skye zhes bya ba 'di ni bya ba yin na 'di la skye'o zhes bya ba'i don las bya ba gzhan yang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: skye zhes bya ba 'di ni bya ba yin na 'di la skye'o zhes bya ba'i don las bya ba gzhan yang ma mthong ngo //
translated: In the statement “it arises,” the agent is “it” and the action is “arises.” But we do not see any action other than “it arises.”

original: de lta bas na tha snyad dag la klan ka med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na tha snyad dag la klan ka med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in our conventions.

original: tshig gi don ni 'di yod na 'di 'byung /
analyzed: tshig gi don ni 'di yod na 'di 'byung /
translated: The meaning of the words is: If this exists, that arises.

original: 'di skyes pas 'di skye zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa de ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don to zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'di skyes pas 'di skye zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa de ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don to zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: The meaning of “this having arisen, that arises” is the meaning of dependent origination.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: ji ltar med pa skye ba ltar //
analyzed: ji ltar med pa skye ba ltar //
translated: Just as a non-existent thing arises,

original: med pa phrad pa'ang de dang 'dra //
analyzed: med pa phrad pa'ang de dang 'dra //
translated: So a non-existent thing contacts.

original: skyes pa skye na mthar thug med //
analyzed: skyes pa skye na mthar thug med //
translated: If an existent thing arises, there is an infinite regress.

original: 'on te snga na yod na 'ang rung /
analyzed: 'on te snga na yod na 'ang rung /
translated: But if it exists prior to arising,

original: lhan cig pa la 'ang de yod de //
analyzed: lhan cig pa la 'ang de yod de //
translated: It exists also in the simultaneous.

original: mar me byung nas mun pa med //
analyzed: mar me byung nas mun pa med //
translated: When the lamp is lit, there is no darkness.

original: kha gdangs nyal bzhin gal te phyis //
analyzed: kha gdangs nyal bzhin gal te phyis //
translated: If you say that the eye sees even when closed,

original: btsums pa la yang ci phyir min //
analyzed: btsums pa la yang ci phyir min //
translated: Why doesn’t it see when open?

original: gzhan dag ni klan ka 'di yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir don gzhan du yongs su rtog par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni klan ka 'di yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir don gzhan du yongs su rtog par byed do //
translated: Others imagine a different meaning in order to avoid this fault.

original: rten cing 'bral pa ni zlos pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'bral pa ni zlos pa'i don yin no //
translated: Pratītya means “to repeat.”

original: sam ni 'du ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: sam ni 'du ba'i don yin no //
translated: Saṃ means “to come together.”

original: a'itya ni 'gro bar rung ba ste mi sdod pa'o //
analyzed: a'itya ni 'gro bar rung ba ste mi sdod pa'o //
translated: Ity means “to go,” i.e., “to be ready to go,” i.e., “not to stay.”

original: aung gong na yod pa'i pad ni 'byung ba'i don te /
analyzed: aung gong na yod pa'i pad ni 'byung ba'i don te /
translated: Pad, which has ūṅ at the end, means “to arise.”

original: 'di skad du tshogs pa de dang de na 'gro bar rung ba rnams 'dus nas skye ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du tshogs pa de dang de na 'gro bar rung ba rnams 'dus nas skye ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the expression pratītyasamutpāda is as follows: pratītyasamutpāda is the arising of a phenomenon in dependence on a complex of causes and conditions.

original: rtogs pa 'di ni 'di kho na la rab tu brtag tu rung gi mig dang @130a * //
analyzed: rtogs pa 'di ni 'di kho na la rab tu brtag tu rung gi mig dang @130a * //
translated: This interpretation is valid only for the expression pratītyasamutpāda; it is not valid for the expression cakṣuḥ pratītya rūpāṇi cotpadyate cakṣurvijñānam.

original: gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba 'di la ji ltar rung //🔽yang ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di yod na 'di 'byung /
analyzed: gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba 'di la ji ltar rung // yang ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di yod na 'di 'byung /
translated: How can one say that visual consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and visible form?

original: 'di skye bas 'di skye'o zhes rnam grangs gnyis gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'di skye bas 'di skye'o zhes rnam grangs gnyis gsungs she na /
translated: Why did the Fortunate One teach two formulas of dependent origination, “When this exists, that comes to be; due to the arising of this, that arises,” and “From the production of this, that is produced”?

original: nges par gzung ba'i don te /
analyzed: nges par gzung ba'i don te /
translated: The first formula has the meaning of determination:🔽“If this exists, that exists; due to the arising of this, that arises.”

original: dper na gzhan las ma rig pa yod na 'du byed rnams 'byung gi / ma rig pa'i rkyen med par 'du byed rnams ma yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzhan las ma rig pa yod na 'du byed rnams 'byung gi / ma rig pa'i rkyen med par 'du byed rnams ma yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The second formula has the meaning of condition:

original: yang na yan lag 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yang na yan lag 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo //
translated: “From the production of this, that is produced.”

original: yan lag 'di skyes pas yan lag gzhan skye'o zhes yan lag brgyad par bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang na sngon gyi mtha' yod na da ltar gyi mtha' 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yan lag 'di skyes pas yan lag gzhan skye'o zhes yan lag brgyad par bstan pa'i phyir ro // yang na sngon gyi mtha' yod na da ltar gyi mtha' 'byung ngo //
translated: because it shows the eight members as having the nature of a cause and effect, since it is said that “when this member arises, that member arises,” and so on.🔽Or else, it shows the continuity of life, since it is said that “when the prior limit exists, the present limit arises,”

original: da ltar gyi mtha' skyes pas phyi ma'i mtha' skye'o zhes tshe brgyud par bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang na res 'ga' ni 'du byed rnams ma rig pa'i mjug thogs su 'byung ngo //
analyzed: da ltar gyi mtha' skyes pas phyi ma'i mtha' skye'o zhes tshe brgyud par bstan pa'i phyir ro // yang na res 'ga' ni 'du byed rnams ma rig pa'i mjug thogs su 'byung ngo //
translated: and “when the present limit arises, the future limit arises.”🔽Or else, it shows the nature of a condition as direct and indirect, since it is said that “sometimes formations arise immediately after ignorance,”

original: res 'ga' ni brgyud nas so zhes mngon sum dang brgyud nas rkyen gyi ngo bor bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽gzhan dag na re rgyu med na dngos po mi 'byung la /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni brgyud nas so zhes mngon sum dang brgyud nas rkyen gyi ngo bor bstan pa'i phyir ro // gzhan dag na re rgyu med na dngos po mi 'byung la /
translated: and “sometimes they arise indirectly.”🔽Others say that it is in order to refute the doctrine of causelessness and the doctrine that the cause is permanent, since a thing does not arise without a cause,

original: rang bzhin dang skyes bu la sogs pa skye ba med pa dang ldan pa rtag pa las kyang cung zad kyang mi skye'o zhes rgyu med pa dang / rgyu rtag par smra ba dgag pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang skyes bu la sogs pa skye ba med pa dang ldan pa rtag pa las kyang cung zad kyang mi skye'o zhes rgyu med pa dang / rgyu rtag par smra ba dgag pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
translated: and nothing arises from a permanent cause such as a nature or a person.

original: rtog pa 'di la ni tshig snga ma smos pa don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtog pa 'di la ni tshig snga ma smos pa don med par 'gyur te /
translated: But in this interpretation, the former words would be meaningless,

original: 'di skyes pas 'di skye'o zhes bya ba 'di kho nas smras pa gnyi ga dgag pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di skyes pas 'di skye'o zhes bya ba 'di kho nas smras pa gnyi ga dgag pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mere statement “When this exists, that comes to be” establishes the negation of both.

original: 'o na ni gang lags bdag rten du gyur pa yod pas 'du byed la sogs pa rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'o na ni gang lags bdag rten du gyur pa yod pas 'du byed la sogs pa rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: But if you say that formations, etc., arise because the self, as their support, exists,🔽and that they arise when ignorance, etc., arise, then this interpretation is refuted by the following passage:

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa skyes pas de dag skye bar rtog par byed pa yod pas de'i phyir rtog pa de bsal bar byas pa'i phyir gang zhig skyes pas gang skye ba ni de nyid yod pas de 'byung gi / gzhan las ni ma yin no zhes
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa skyes pas de dag skye bar rtog par byed pa yod pas de'i phyir rtog pa de bsal bar byas pa'i phyir gang zhig skyes pas gang skye ba ni de nyid yod pas de 'byung gi / gzhan las ni ma yin no zhes
translated: “When this exists, that comes to be” means that when just that exists, that arises, not from another.

original: 'di nges par gzung ba mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di nges par gzung ba mdzad pa yin te /
translated: This passage is stated in order to ascertain this point.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example:

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams dang / sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig yang dag par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams dang / sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig yang dag par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
translated: “With ignorance as condition, there are formations, and so on up to: this whole great mass of suffering comes to be.”

original: slob dpon dag na re /
analyzed: slob dpon dag na re /
translated: The masters say:

original: ma rig pa ma spangs na 'du byed rnams mi spong la de nyid skyes pas skye bar 'gyur ro zhes ma spangs pa dang skye bar 'gyur ba rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa ma spangs na 'du byed rnams mi spong la de nyid skyes pas skye bar 'gyur ro zhes ma spangs pa dang skye bar 'gyur ba rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: If ignorance is not abandoned, the formative forces are not abandoned. And when ignorance arises, birth arises.

original: gzhan dag na re rgyu'i @130b rgyun ji srid pa de srid du 'bras bu'i rgyun 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rgyu'i @130b rgyun ji srid pa de srid du 'bras bu'i rgyun 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Others say: As long as the stream of causes exists, the stream of effects will occur.

original: rgyu nyid skyes pas 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gnas pa dang skye ba yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
analyzed: rgyu nyid skyes pas 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gnas pa dang skye ba yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
translated: When the cause itself arises, the effect arises.

original: 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad pa yin na gnas pa'i tshig tu thal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad pa yin na gnas pa'i tshig tu thal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: If it is in terms of origination, what is the consequence of the word “endures”?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ci'i phyir rim pa mi mthun par sngar ni gnas pa dang phyis ni skye ba gsungs par 'gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ci'i phyir rim pa mi mthun par sngar ni gnas pa dang phyis ni skye ba gsungs par 'gyur /
translated: Why would the Bhagavān state endurance first and origination later?

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: Again, it is said:

original: 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yod na rgyu 'jig par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yod na rgyu 'jig par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If this exists, that occurs means that when the effect exists, the cause ceases.

original: 'o na ni rgyu med pa las 'bras bu 'byung ngo snyam du sems par 'gyur bas smras pa /
analyzed: 'o na ni rgyu med pa las 'bras bu 'byung ngo snyam du sems par 'gyur bas smras pa /
translated: But if that is so, then you might think that an effect arises without a cause.

original: de'i phyir rgyu med pa las 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu med pa las 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it does not arise without a cause.

original: 'di ltar na 'di skyes pas 'di skye'o zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: 'di ltar na 'di skyes pas 'di skye'o zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: In this way, the Buddha said, “When this exists, that comes to be.”

original: gal te mdo'i don de yin par gyur na ni 'di yod pas 'di mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba kho nar bka' stsal par 'gyur la /🔽re zhig sngar ni 'bras bu skye ba kho na yin la /
analyzed: gal te mdo'i don de yin par gyur na ni 'di yod pas 'di mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba kho nar bka' stsal par 'gyur la / re zhig sngar ni 'bras bu skye ba kho na yin la /
translated: If that were the meaning of the sutra, the Buddha would have said, “When this exists, that does not occur.”

original: phyis ni 'di yod na 'di mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyis ni 'di yod na 'di mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal par 'gyur te /
translated: First, the effect arises, and later, “When this exists, that does not occur.”

original: de ltar na go rims legs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na go rims legs pa yin no //
translated: This is the proper sequence.

original: gzhan du na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba'i skabs su 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i rig pa gang zhig yin /
analyzed: gzhan du na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba'i skabs su 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i rig pa gang zhig yin /
translated: Otherwise, in the passage, “What is dependent origination?,” what is the knowledge called “cessation”?

original: de lta bas na de ni mdo'i don ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de ni mdo'i don ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is not the meaning of the sutra.

original: yang ji ltar na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams yin pa nas skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi'i bar dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams yin pa nas skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi'i bar dag yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that ignorance is the condition of the formative forces, and so on up to birth being the condition of old age and death?

original: 'brel pa tsam zhig bstan par bya ste /🔽byis pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'du byed tsam 'di mi shes pas bdag tu lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal la mngon par zhen cing bdag nyid bde ba'i don tam /
analyzed: 'brel pa tsam zhig bstan par bya ste / byis pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'du byed tsam 'di mi shes pas bdag tu lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal la mngon par zhen cing bdag nyid bde ba'i don tam /
translated: We shall explain this merely in terms of their relationship.🔽The childish, not understanding this mere conditioned process of dependent origination, are attached to the view of self and the pride of “I am,” and they initiate the three kinds of action with their bodies, etc., for the sake of their own happiness,

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i don du lus la sogs pa dag gis las rnam pa gsum rtsom ste /🔽tshe phyi ma la bde ba'i don du bsod nams bde ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i don du ni mi g-yo ba /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i don du lus la sogs pa dag gis las rnam pa gsum rtsom ste / tshe phyi ma la bde ba'i don du bsod nams bde ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i don du ni mi g-yo ba /
translated: or for the sake of neither pleasure nor suffering.🔽For the sake of happiness in a future life, they initiate meritorious action; for the sake of neither pleasure nor suffering, they initiate unmoving action.

original: tshe 'di la bde ba'i don du bsod nams ma yin pa rtsom ste ;
analyzed: tshe 'di la bde ba'i don du bsod nams ma yin pa rtsom ste ;
translated: For the sake of happiness in this life, they initiate demeritorious action.

original: de dag ni 'di'i ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni 'di'i ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed dag yin no //
translated: These are the formative forces conditioned by ignorance.

original: las kyi 'phen pa'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa'i rgyun srid pa bar ma dang 'brel pa'i phyir me 'bar ba 'gro ba'i tshul du 'gro ba de dang der 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: las kyi 'phen pa'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa'i rgyun srid pa bar ma dang 'brel pa'i phyir me 'bar ba 'gro ba'i tshul du 'gro ba de dang der 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because the continuum of consciousness is connected to the intermediate existence by the power of the projection of karma, it goes to that and that destination in the manner of a burning fire.

original: de ni 'di'i 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa yin @131a * //
analyzed: de ni 'di'i 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa yin @131a * //
translated: That is the condition of consciousness due to karmic predispositions.

original: no ; / de ltar bshad na rnam par shes pa'i yan lag bstan pa las /
analyzed: no ; / de ltar bshad na rnam par shes pa'i yan lag bstan pa las /
translated: If it is explained in this way, then the explanation of the link of consciousness is tenable.

original: rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is consciousness?

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go zhes bshad pa de 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go zhes bshad pa de 'thad pa yin no //
translated: It is the six collections of consciousness.

original: yang rnam par shes pa sngon du 'gro ba'i ming dang gzugs phung po lnga po 'gro ba de dang der skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang rnam par shes pa sngon du 'gro ba'i ming dang gzugs phung po lnga po 'gro ba de dang der skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, name and form that are preceded by consciousness are born in that and that destination,

original: rnam par 'byed pa las de skad bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa las de skad bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is taught in the Exposition.

original: de'i 'og tu ming dang gzugs yongs su smin pa'i rim gyis skye mched drug go //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ming dang gzugs yongs su smin pa'i rim gyis skye mched drug go //
translated: After that, the six sense bases are due to the process of the full development of name and form.

original: de'i 'og tu yul dang phrad na rnam par shes pa skye bas gsum 'dus pa las bde ba la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yul dang phrad na rnam par shes pa skye bas gsum 'dus pa las bde ba la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa'o //
translated: Then, when the object is encountered, consciousness arises. From the coming together of the three, there is contact, which is the experience of pleasure, etc.

original: de'i 'og tu tshor ba rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tshor ba rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Then, there are the three feelings.

original: de'i 'og tu sred pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sred pa ste /
translated: Then, there is craving.

original: sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba'i tshor ba bde ba la ni 'dod pa'i sred pa'o //🔽bde ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la ni gzugs kyi sred pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba'i tshor ba bde ba la ni 'dod pa'i sred pa'o // bde ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la ni gzugs kyi sred pa'o //
translated: Craving for the pleasure of feeling that is tormented by suffering is craving for desire.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la ni gzugs med pa'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la ni gzugs med pa'i sred pa'o //
translated: Craving for the feeling that is neither pleasure nor suffering is craving for the formless realm.

original: de'i 'og tu tshor ba yid du 'ong ba la sred pa las 'dod pa la sogs pa nye bar len te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tshor ba yid du 'ong ba la sred pa las 'dod pa la sogs pa nye bar len te /
translated: Then, from craving for pleasant feeling, one grasps the objects of desire, etc.

original: de la 'dod pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dag go //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dag go //
translated: Here, the objects of desire are the five sense objects.

original: lta ba dag ni drug cu rtsa gnyis te /
analyzed: lta ba dag ni drug cu rtsa gnyis te /
translated: The views are the sixty-two views,

original: tshangs pa'i dra ba las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i dra ba las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: as they are described in the Brahmajala Sutra.

original: tshul khrims ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims spong ba'o //🔽brtul zhugs ni khyi dang ba lang gi brtul zhugs la sogs pa dang / ji skad du gcer bu pa la sogs pa rnams ni sgren mo gos med pa yin no zhes rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu dang / bram ze dang / phyugs bdag pa dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims spong ba'o // brtul zhugs ni khyi dang ba lang gi brtul zhugs la sogs pa dang / ji skad du gcer bu pa la sogs pa rnams ni sgren mo gos med pa yin no zhes rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu dang / bram ze dang / phyugs bdag pa dang /
translated: Morality is the abandonment of immorality.🔽Asceticism is the practice of dogs, cows, etc.,🔽and the practice of nakedness, etc., as the Jains do, as it is said:🔽The Jains are naked, without clothing.

original: kun tu rgyu la sogs pa dag dbyu gu dang g-yang gzhi dang / ral bu dang / thal ba dang / dbyu gu gsum dang sgre bo la sogs pa yang dag par len pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu rgyu la sogs pa dag dbyu gu dang g-yang gzhi dang / ral bu dang / thal ba dang / dbyu gu gsum dang sgre bo la sogs pa yang dag par len pa'o //
translated: Asceticism is also the practice of the brahmins, the cowherds, the mendicants, etc., who wear their sacred thread, carry a staff, wear their hair in a topknot, cover themselves with ashes, carry the triple stick, wear the girdle of darbha grass, etc.

original: bdag tu smra ba ni lus te /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba ni lus te /
translated: The theory of self is the body.

original: de la bdag tu smra ba yod pas na bdag tu smra ba'o //
analyzed: de la bdag tu smra ba yod pas na bdag tu smra ba'o //
translated: The body is called the theory of self because the theory of self is located in the body.

original: gzhan dag na re bdag tu lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bdag tu lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal yin no zhes zer te /
translated: According to other masters, the theory of self is the afflicted view of self and the pride that thinks I.

original: 'di gnyis ji ltar na bdag tu smra ba nyid yin no zhe na 'di gnyis kyang bdag go zhes smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ji ltar na bdag tu smra ba nyid yin no zhe na 'di gnyis kyang bdag go zhes smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: How can these two be the theory of self? Because they say that the self exists.

original: bdag med pa'i phyir bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i phyir bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Because of the absence of self, the self is called the appropriator.

original: skad du dge slong dag bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba ni byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa @131b btags pa'i rjes su lhung bar zad kyi /
analyzed: skad du dge slong dag bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba ni byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa @131b btags pa'i rjes su lhung bar zad kyi /
translated: The Buddha said: “Monks, the self and what belongs to the self are for the purpose of the immature, ordinary person who is not learned and who falls into the trap of hearing.

original: 'di la bdag gam bdag gi ni med do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di la bdag gam bdag gi ni med do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: In reality, there is no self or what belongs to the self.”

original: de dag nye bar len pa ni de dag la 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de dag nye bar len pa ni de dag la 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags gang yin pa ste /
translated: The appropriation of those is the desire and attachment for them.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis thams cad las ji skad du nye bar len pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis thams cad las ji skad du nye bar len pa gang zhe na /
translated: The Bhagavān said in the sūtra, “What is appropriation?

original: 'di la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags gang yin pa'o zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags gang yin pa'o zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is the desire and attachment here.”

original: yang len pa'i rkyen gyis yang srid pa'i la sogs par byed pa de ni srid pa yin te mdo las /
analyzed: yang len pa'i rkyen gyis yang srid pa'i la sogs par byed pa de ni srid pa yin te mdo las /
translated: The condition of appropriation is the existence that creates rebirth and so on. The sūtra says:

original: kun dga' bo tshe phyi ma la yang srid pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i las gang yin pa de ni 'dir srid pa yang yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo tshe phyi ma la yang srid pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i las gang yin pa de ni 'dir srid pa yang yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Ananda, that action which produces a future existence is existence here.

original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'i tshul du ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba ni skye ba yin te /
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'i tshul du ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba ni skye ba yin te /
translated: The future birth of consciousness, in the manner of a condition for existence, is birth.

original: phung po lnga po yin no //
analyzed: phung po lnga po yin no //
translated: It is the five aggregates.

original: skye ba yod na rga shi 'byung ste /
analyzed: skye ba yod na rga shi 'byung ste /
translated: When there is birth, there is old age and death.

original: mdo las ji skad bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mdo las ji skad bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said in the sutra.

original: de ltar 'di 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'di 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'o //
translated: Thus, this alone is devoid of a self and what belongs to a self.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshogs thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshogs thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
translated: The great mass of suffering is the collection of suffering without beginning or end.

original: yang dag par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: It originates is produced.

original: bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs ni sngar bshad ba gang yin pa de kho na yin no //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs ni sngar bshad ba gang yin pa de kho na yin no //
translated: The Vaibhashika system is just as it was explained earlier.

original: yang ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin /
analyzed: yang ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the term ignorance?

original: rig pa ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the opposite of knowledge.

original: mig la sogs pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The same would be true of the eye, etc.
