original: 'o na ni rig pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni rig pa med pa yin no //
translated: It is the absence of knowledge.

original: de lta na ci yang ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ci yang ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, it would be nothing at all.

original: de yang rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rig pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not knowledge.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: rig pa'i mi mthun phyogs chos gzhan //
analyzed: rig pa'i mi mthun phyogs chos gzhan //
translated: The opposite of knowledge is a separate thing,

original: ma rig mi mdza' brdzun sogs bzhin //🔽ji ltar mdza' bo zhes bzlog na de'i mi mthun pa'i sa phyogs su gyur pa mi mdza' pa 'ga' zhig yod kyi /
analyzed: ma rig mi mdza' brdzun sogs bzhin // ji ltar mdza' bo zhes bzlog na de'i mi mthun pa'i sa phyogs su gyur pa mi mdza' pa 'ga' zhig yod kyi /
translated: Like the opposite of a friend, an untrue statement, etc.

original: mdza' bo las gzhan pa gang yin pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: mdza' bo las gzhan pa gang yin pa yang ma yin la /
translated: When the opposite of a friend is expressed, it is a separate thing that is the opposite of a friend, not just any other thing, nor the absence of a friend.

original: mdza' bo med pa yang ma yin pa dang / bden pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa'o //
analyzed: mdza' bo med pa yang ma yin pa dang / bden pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa'o //
translated: When the opposite of truth is expressed, it is a separate thing that is the opposite of truth, not just any other thing, nor the absence of truth.

original: de mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i tshig ni mi bden pa yin pa dang / chos ma yin pa dang / don ma yin pa dang / bya ba ma yin pa la sogs pa yang chos la sogs pa'i mi mthun par gyur pa de bzhin du ma rig pa yang rig pa'i mi mthun par gyur pa chos gzhan zhig tu blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i tshig ni mi bden pa yin pa dang / chos ma yin pa dang / don ma yin pa dang / bya ba ma yin pa la sogs pa yang chos la sogs pa'i mi mthun par gyur pa de bzhin du ma rig pa yang rig pa'i mi mthun par gyur pa chos gzhan zhig tu blta bar bya'o //
translated: The words that are contrary to that are untrue, unrighteous, meaningless, improper, and so on. Just as unrighteousness, etc. are contrary to righteousness, etc., so too should ignorance be viewed as a separate dharma that is contrary to knowledge.

original: 'di ga las she na /🔽rkyen gyi dngos por bstan @132a * //
analyzed: 'di ga las she na / rkyen gyi dngos por bstan @132a * //
translated: Why is that?

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is taught to be a causal entity.

original: gzhan yang kun sbyor sogs kyi phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang kun sbyor sogs kyi phyir //
translated: Moreover, because it is a fetter, etc.

original: mdo dag las ma rig pa ni kun tu sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / phra rgyas dang / chu bo dang / sbyor ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo dag las ma rig pa ni kun tu sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / phra rgyas dang / chu bo dang / sbyor ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: In the sūtras, ignorance is called a fetter, a bondage, a latent tendency, a flood, and a yoke.

original: med pa tsam ni de lta bu yin par 'ongs pa ma yin la mig la sogs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa tsam ni de lta bu yin par 'ongs pa ma yin la mig la sogs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Mere nonexistence is not like that, nor are the eye, etc.

original: de lta bas na ma rig pa ni chos gzhan kho na zhig yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na ma rig pa ni chos gzhan kho na zhig yin no //
translated: Therefore, ignorance is a separate dharma.

original: 'o na ni dper na chung ma ngan pa la chung ma ma yin zhes bya ba dang / bu ngan pa la bu ma yin pa zhes bya ba ltar ma rig pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'o na ni dper na chung ma ngan pa la chung ma ma yin zhes bya ba dang / bu ngan pa la bu ma yin pa zhes bya ba ltar ma rig pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as a bad wife is called a nonwife and a bad son is called a nonson, so too is ignorance.

original: gal te / shes rab ngan pa'o min lta phyir //
analyzed: gal te / shes rab ngan pa'o min lta phyir //
translated: It is not bad understanding, because it is not view.

original: smad pa'i shes rab ni nyon mongs pa can yin na de yang lta ba'i rang bzhin yin pas ma rig pa yin par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: smad pa'i shes rab ni nyon mongs pa can yin na de yang lta ba'i rang bzhin yin pas ma rig pa yin par mi rung ngo //
translated: If bad understanding were afflicted, and it is by nature view, it would not be suitable to be ignorance.

original: 'o na ni gang lta ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni gang lta ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not by nature view, it would be ignorance.

original: de yang yin par mi 'os so //
analyzed: de yang yin par mi 'os so //
translated: But that is not suitable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lta ba de dang mtshungs ldan phyir //
analyzed: lta ba de dang mtshungs ldan phyir //
translated: Because it is concomitant with that view.

original: gal te ma rig pa shes rab yin par gyur na shes rab kyi rdzas nyid mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir lta ba de dang mtshungs par ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa shes rab yin par gyur na shes rab kyi rdzas nyid mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir lta ba de dang mtshungs par ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If ignorance were understanding, it would not be concomitant with that view because it would be a substance of understanding that is not concomitant.

original: shes rab nyon mongs bstan phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab nyon mongs bstan phyir ro //
translated: Because it is taught to be an afflicted form of understanding.

original: zhes bya ba 'di las kyang 'grub ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di las kyang 'grub ste /
translated: This is also established from this.

original: mdo las / 'dod chags kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i sems ni rnam par mi 'grol lo //
analyzed: mdo las / 'dod chags kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i sems ni rnam par mi 'grol lo //
translated: A mind that is afflicted by attachment is not liberated.

original: ma rig pas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i shes rab ni rnam par mi 'dag go zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ma rig pas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i shes rab ni rnam par mi 'dag go zhes gsungs te /
translated: Wisdom that is afflicted by ignorance is not purified.

original: shes rab de nyid shes rab de'i nyon mongs pa 'dod chags rigs pa ma yin pas ji ltar sems kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa 'dod chags rigs tha dad pa gzhan yin pa ltar shes rab kyi ma rig pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: shes rab de nyid shes rab de'i nyon mongs pa 'dod chags rigs pa ma yin pas ji ltar sems kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa 'dod chags rigs tha dad pa gzhan yin pa ltar shes rab kyi ma rig pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is not tenable that that very wisdom is the affliction of that very wisdom, just as attachment that is an affliction of the mind is a different type from the mind.🔽Why is ignorance of wisdom not asserted to be its branch affliction?

original: yang ci'i phyir 'di ltar shes rab nyon mongs pa can dang / shes rab dge ba 'dres na rnam par mi 'dag pas de'i phyir 'di de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yin par mi 'dod //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'di ltar shes rab nyon mongs pa can dang / shes rab dge ba 'dres na rnam par mi 'dag pas de'i phyir 'di de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yin par mi 'dod //
translated: Since afflicted wisdom and virtuous wisdom are mixed, the latter is not purified. Therefore it is not asserted to be a branch affliction.

original: 'dod chags kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i sems rnam par mi 'grol ba gang yin pa de yang gdon mi za bar 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa yin nam ci /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i sems rnam par mi 'grol ba gang yin pa de yang gdon mi za bar 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa yin nam ci /
translated: Is it not so that the mind that is defiled by attachment is not liberated, and that it is also certainly bound by attachment?

original: gang rnam par mi 'grol ba de ni 'dod chags kyis de ltar nye bar bcom pa yin la /
analyzed: gang rnam par mi 'grol ba de ni 'dod chags kyis de ltar nye bar bcom pa yin la /
translated: That which is not liberated is destroyed by attachment in that way.

original: bag chags rnam par bzlog pa ni rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bag chags rnam par bzlog pa ni rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But when the latent impressions are eliminated, it is liberated.

original: de bzhin du ma rig pas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur @132b pa'i shes rab rnam par mi 'dag pas ma rig pas nye bar bcom pa yin par yongs su brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma rig pas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur @132b pa'i shes rab rnam par mi 'dag pas ma rig pas nye bar bcom pa yin par yongs su brtag par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be understood that the wisdom that is defiled by ignorance is destroyed by ignorance, because it is not purified by the lack of liberation.

original: yongs su rtog pa la ni su zhig bzlog ste /
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa la ni su zhig bzlog ste /
translated: But who can stop the imagination?

original: ma rig pa rigs gzhan kho na zhig yod do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ma rig pa rigs gzhan kho na zhig yod do zhes brjod do //
translated: It is said that there is a separate class of ignorance.

original: gang yang nyon mongs pa can thams cad ma rig pa yin no snyam du sems pa de'i yang 'di nyid kyis bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: gang yang nyon mongs pa can thams cad ma rig pa yin no snyam du sems pa de'i yang 'di nyid kyis bsal ba yin te /
translated: Also, this refutes the view of those who think that all defiled states are ignorance.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin na kun tu sbyor ba la sogs pa'i nang du yang logs shig tu bshad par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin na kun tu sbyor ba la sogs pa'i nang du yang logs shig tu bshad par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: If ignorance were the nature of all the defilements, it would not be mentioned separately among the fetters, etc.

original: lta ba la sogs pa phan tshun mtshungs par ldan pa med pa'i phyir lta ba 'am nyon mongs pa gzhan dang yang mtshungs par ldan par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa phan tshun mtshungs par ldan pa med pa'i phyir lta ba 'am nyon mongs pa gzhan dang yang mtshungs par ldan par mi 'gyur la /
translated: And since view, etc., are not mutually associated, ignorance would not be associated with view or with any other defilement.

original: sems kyang ma rig pas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa kho nar bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems kyang ma rig pas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa kho nar bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the mind would be afflicted only by the presence of ignorance.

original: 'on te bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir de skad du bshad do zhes bya bar 'dod na ni shes rab la yang ma rig pa bye brag tu bya dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir de skad du bshad do zhes bya bar 'dod na ni shes rab la yang ma rig pa bye brag tu bya dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you maintain that ignorance is mentioned in order to distinguish it, then you must distinguish it from wisdom, since it is said, “Wisdom is the absence of ignorance.”

original: ma rig pa chos gzhan zhig yin la rag na de'i rang bzhin ci yin /
analyzed: ma rig pa chos gzhan zhig yin la rag na de'i rang bzhin ci yin /
translated: If ignorance is a separate factor, what is its intrinsic nature?

original: bden pa dang dkon mchog dang / las dang 'bras bu rnams mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: bden pa dang dkon mchog dang / las dang 'bras bu rnams mi gsal ba'o //
translated: It is the non-clarity of the truths, the jewels, action, and their results.

original: mi gsal ba zhes bya ba 'di ci yin pa 'di yang mi shes so //
analyzed: mi gsal ba zhes bya ba 'di ci yin pa 'di yang mi shes so //
translated: But we do not understand what non-clarity is.

original: gal te gsal ba ma yin pa zhig gam /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba ma yin pa zhig gam /
translated: If it is not clear,

original: gsal ba med pa zhig yin na ni ma rig pa la ni ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal ba med pa zhig yin na ni ma rig pa la ni ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: or if it is not non-clear, then the same criticism applies to ignorance as to the prior state.

original: 'on te gsal ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa /
analyzed: 'on te gsal ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa /
translated: If it is a factor that is the opposite of clear,

original: chos gzhan zhig yin no zhe na yang de bzhin du de ci yin pa 'di mi shes so zhe na /
analyzed: chos gzhan zhig yin no zhe na yang de bzhin du de ci yin pa 'di mi shes so zhe na /
translated: then what is it?

original: chos rnams bstan pa de lta bu yang yod de /
analyzed: chos rnams bstan pa de lta bu yang yod de /
translated: There is a teaching of the factors that is like this.

original: dper na mig gang zhe na /
analyzed: dper na mig gang zhe na /
translated: For example, “What is the eye?🔽It is the clear form that is the basis of the eye consciousness.”

original: gzugs dang ba mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu dang / btsun pa chos skyob na re nga'o snyam du sems can la 'jug pa ni ma rig pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang ba mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu dang / btsun pa chos skyob na re nga'o snyam du sems can la 'jug pa ni ma rig pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Bhadanta Dharmatrāta says: Ignorance is the entry of the mind into the idea of “I am” with regard to the sentient being.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal las gzhan pa'i 'jug pa gang zhig yin zhe na /🔽mdo las bdag gis de ltar shes //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal las gzhan pa'i 'jug pa gang zhig yin zhe na / mdo las bdag gis de ltar shes //
translated: What is the entry that is different from the pride of “I am”?

original: de ltar mthong ste /
analyzed: de ltar mthong ste /
translated: The sūtra says, “I know thus, I see thus.”

original: sred pa thams cad dang / lta ba thams cad dang / 'jug pa thams cad dang / ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal la mngon par zhen pa'i phra rgyas thams cad spangs shing yongs su shes nas grib ma med par mya ngan las 'das so zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de yin @133a * //🔽no ; /'jug pa de yod kyang de ni ma rig pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na 'di ltar nyon mongs pa gzhan yin no zhes brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //🔽nga rgyal gzhan yang yod pa kho na ma yin nam zhe na /🔽'di la dpyad par chad na brjod pa mang por gyur te /
analyzed: sred pa thams cad dang / lta ba thams cad dang / 'jug pa thams cad dang / ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal la mngon par zhen pa'i phra rgyas thams cad spangs shing yongs su shes nas grib ma med par mya ngan las 'das so zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de yin @133a * // no ; /'jug pa de yod kyang de ni ma rig pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na 'di ltar nyon mongs pa gzhan yin no zhes brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro // nga rgyal gzhan yang yod pa kho na ma yin nam zhe na / 'di la dpyad par chad na brjod pa mang por gyur te /
translated: The Buddha said, Having abandoned and fully understood all craving, all views, all engagement, all the proclivities of 'I am' and 'mine,' and all the pride of 'I am,' they attain nirvana without remainder.🔽🔽If this engagement exists, how do you know that it is ignorance? Because it cannot be said that it is another defilement.🔽🔽Isn't there another pride?🔽🔽If we were to analyze this, there would be a lot to say.🔽

original: de lta bas na 'di ni bzhag go //🔽yang ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba 'di'i don ci zhe na /🔽gzugs ni rgya cher bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni bzhag go //🔽yang ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba 'di'i don ci zhe na /🔽gzugs ni rgya cher bshad pa yin no //

original: ming ni gzugs can min phung po //
analyzed: ming ni gzugs can min phung po //
translated: Name is the non-material aggregates.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: ming dang dbang po dang don gyi dbang gis don rnams la gzhol bas na ming ngo //
analyzed: ming dang dbang po dang don gyi dbang gis don rnams la gzhol bas na ming ngo //
translated: Name is that which is directed toward objects by means of name and sense faculty.

original: ming gang gi dbang gis she na /
analyzed: ming gang gi dbang gis she na /
translated: By means of what name?

original: 'jig rten na grags pa ming yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten na grags pa ming yin pa ste /
translated: The name that is known in the world.

original: don de dang de dag go bar byed pa ba lang dang / rta dang / gzugs dang / ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: don de dang de dag go bar byed pa ba lang dang / rta dang / gzugs dang / ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is that which causes the understanding of this or that object, such as cow, horse, form, taste, etc.

original: de yang ci'i phyir ming nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir ming nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it called name?

original: 'on te de dag la ming de gzhol bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te de dag la ming de gzhol bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is directed toward those objects.

original: gzhan dag na re 'dir lus bor nas skye ba gzhan du gzhol ba'i phyir ming ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po dag yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'dir lus bor nas skye ba gzhan du gzhol ba'i phyir ming ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po dag yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that name is the non-material aggregates because, after abandoning the body, one is directed toward another birth.

original: skye mched drug ni bshad zin no //
analyzed: skye mched drug ni bshad zin no //
translated: The six sense bases have already been explained.

original: da ni reg pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni reg pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now contact will be discussed.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar ro //
translated: There are six kinds of contact, from eye contact to mind contact.

original: de dag kyang /
analyzed: de dag kyang /
translated: They are also said to be

original: 'dus te byung ba ni /
analyzed: 'dus te byung ba ni /
translated: 1. Arisen from the coming together of three.

original: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa dang gsum 'dus pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa dang gsum 'dus pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: Arisen from the coming together of the three: sense faculty, object-field, and consciousness.

original: re zhig lhan cig skye ba'i phyir dbang po lnga ni don dang rnam par shes pa dag dang 'du bar yang rigs na /
analyzed: re zhig lhan cig skye ba'i phyir dbang po lnga ni don dang rnam par shes pa dag dang 'du bar yang rigs na /
translated: The five sense faculties, eye, etc., are suitable to come together with their object-field and their consciousness, because they are simultaneous.

original: yid kyi dbang po 'gags pa'i chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dag dang ji ltar 'du zhe na /
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po 'gags pa'i chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dag dang ji ltar 'du zhe na /
translated: But how can the mental faculty, which is past, come together with the factor and the mental consciousness, which are future or present?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po gang yin ba de nyid de dag gi 'du ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po gang yin ba de nyid de dag gi 'du ba yin no //
translated: The fact of being cause and effect is the coming together of these three.

original: yang na gsum po de dag thams cad kyang reg pa bskyed par bya ba la mthun pa yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu gcig pa'i don ni 'du ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang na gsum po de dag thams cad kyang reg pa bskyed par bya ba la mthun pa yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu gcig pa'i don ni 'du ba'i don to //
translated: Or else, the meaning of coming together is the meaning of having the same effect, because the three, in all cases, are in agreement in producing contact.

original: 'di la slob dpon rnams kyi blo tha dad par gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la slob dpon rnams kyi blo tha dad par gyur te /
translated: The masters differ on this point.

original: kha cig na re 'dus pa nyid reg pa yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'dus pa nyid reg pa yin no zhes zer te /
translated: Some say: The coming together itself is contact.

original: 'dir mdo'i khungs de ltar na chos gsum po 'di dag 'brel cing 'dus la tshogs pa gang yin pa de ni reg pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yang khyer te 'ong bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dir mdo'i khungs de ltar na chos gsum po 'di dag 'brel cing 'dus la tshogs pa gang yin pa de ni reg pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yang khyer te 'ong bar byed do //
translated: “The three factors of contact are related, conjoined, and combined. That which is related, conjoined, and combined is contact.”

original: kha cig na re sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos gzhan kho na zhig reg pa @133b yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos gzhan kho na zhig reg pa @133b yin no zhes zer te /
translated: Some say: Contact is a separate factor that is concomitant with the mind.🔽Here, they also cite the following sutra passage:

original: 'dir mdo'i khungs chos kyi rnam grangs drug tshan drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir mdo'i khungs chos kyi rnam grangs drug tshan drug gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the six groups of six factors?

original: nang gi skye mched drug dang / phyi'i yul drug dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug dang / reg pa'i tshogs drug dang / tshor ba'i tshogs drug dang / sred pa'i tshogs drug go zhes gsungs pa yang khyer te 'ong bar byed do //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched drug dang / phyi'i yul drug dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug dang / reg pa'i tshogs drug dang / tshor ba'i tshogs drug dang / sred pa'i tshogs drug go zhes gsungs pa yang khyer te 'ong bar byed do //
translated: The six internal sense spheres, the six external objects, the six collections of consciousness, the six collections of contact, the six collections of feeling, and the six collections of craving.”

original: 'dir ni reg pa'i tshogs dbang po dang don dang rnam par shes pa dag las logs shig tu bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir ni reg pa'i tshogs dbang po dang don dang rnam par shes pa dag las logs shig tu bstan to //
translated: Here, the collection of contacts is taught as being separate from the faculties, objects, and consciousnesses.

original: de la gang dag 'dus pa nyid reg pa yin no zhes zer ba de dag ni 'di skad du logs shig tu bstan pa'i phyir logs shig na yod pa kho na yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de la gang dag 'dus pa nyid reg pa yin no zhes zer ba de dag ni 'di skad du logs shig tu bstan pa'i phyir logs shig na yod pa kho na yang ma yin te /
translated: Those who say that contact is the mere assembly of the three elements respond that the three elements are not separate from one another, because they are taught separately.

original: tshor ba dang sred pa dag kyang chos kyi skye mched las logs shig na yod par 'gyur du 'ong ngo zhes lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang sred pa dag kyang chos kyi skye mched las logs shig na yod par 'gyur du 'ong ngo zhes lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: They respond that if the three elements were separate from one another, then feeling and craving would also be separate from the element of mental objects.

original: de ni nyes pa med pa de dag las ma gtogs pa'i chos kyi skye mched kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nyes pa med pa de dag las ma gtogs pa'i chos kyi skye mched kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not a fault, because there is an element of mental objects that is separate from those three elements.

original: de lta bur 'dir lhag ma gang zhig smos su rung ba reg par gyur pa gsum las gzhan gsum ni med do //
analyzed: de lta bur 'dir lhag ma gang zhig smos su rung ba reg par gyur pa gsum las gzhan gsum ni med do //
translated: In the same way, here, what is the remainder that could be mentioned? The three that are not contact are not separate from the three that are contact.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa med pa'i dbang po dang don dag yod du zin kyang dbang po dang don med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni med do //
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa med pa'i dbang po dang don dag yod du zin kyang dbang po dang don med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni med do //
translated: Even if the faculties and objects exist without consciousness, consciousness does not exist without the faculties and objects.

original: de lta bas na gsum bstan zin pas yang reg pa smos pa ni don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na gsum bstan zin pas yang reg pa smos pa ni don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since the three have already been mentioned, it is meaningless to mention contact again.

original: kha cig na re mig dang gzugs thams cad kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: kha cig na re mig dang gzugs thams cad kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rgyu ma yin la /
translated: Some say: Not all eyes and forms are causes of all eye consciousnesses,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang mig dang gzugs thams cad kyi 'bras bu ma yin pas de'i phyir gang dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa de dag ni reg pa'i dngos por rnam par gzhag go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang mig dang gzugs thams cad kyi 'bras bu ma yin pas de'i phyir gang dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa de dag ni reg pa'i dngos por rnam par gzhag go zhes zer ro //
translated: and not all eye consciousnesses are effects of all eyes and forms. Therefore, those that are cause and effect are posited as contact.🔽What response do you give to the sūtra that states:

original: gang de dag reg pa ni 'dus pa las gzhan no zhes zer ba de'i chos gsum po 'di dag 'brel zhing 'dus la tshogs pa gang yin pa de ni reg pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i mdo 'di la ji ltar lan 'debs she na /
analyzed: gang de dag reg pa ni 'dus pa las gzhan no zhes zer ba de'i chos gsum po 'di dag 'brel zhing 'dus la tshogs pa gang yin pa de ni reg pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i mdo 'di la ji ltar lan 'debs she na /
translated: The three phenomena that are connected, meet and assemble are contact?

original: de skad du mi 'don to //
analyzed: de skad du mi 'don to //
translated: They do not recite the sūtra in that way.

original: yang na ni 'di rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang na ni 'di rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Or else this is a case of designating the cause by the effect.

original: brjod pa 'di rgya che ba'i rnam pa ha cang mang por 'phro ba yin pas zhar la 'ongs pas chog go / chos mngon pa rnams na re reg pa gzhan kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: brjod pa 'di rgya che ba'i rnam pa ha cang mang por 'phro ba yin pas zhar la 'ongs pas chog go / chos mngon pa rnams na re reg pa gzhan kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The Abhidharma masters say that there is a sixth type of contact, contact through designation.

original: reg pa drug po de dag las //
analyzed: reg pa drug po de dag las //
translated: From among these six contacts,

original: lnga ni thogs pa'i reg pa yin //
analyzed: lnga ni thogs pa'i reg pa yin //
translated: five are contacts that are obstructions.

original: drug pa bla dags tshig ces bya //🔽mig @134a * //
analyzed: drug pa bla dags tshig ces bya // mig @134a * //
translated: The sixth is called contact through designation.

original: dang ; rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa lnga ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dbang po la brten pa'i phyir thogs pa'i reg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang ; rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa lnga ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dbang po la brten pa'i phyir thogs pa'i reg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The five contacts of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body are called contacts that are obstructions because they are based on sense faculties that are obstructed.

original: drug pa yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni tshig bla dags kyi reg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: drug pa yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni tshig bla dags kyi reg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The sixth, contact of the mental faculty, is called contact through designation.
